s : a roasted nose with hop undertones . not a big nose on this beer .  this beer is absolutely stunning , sharp ruby red . it 's a really great looking winter brew .  cake/nutty malt up front with a huge , thick spiced tea hop flavor headbutt with the swallow . not just season 's best , but saranac 's best . i usually find them to be just an average brewery but this stuff is nice .

very easy drinking ale with nice dark copper color and good lacing . makes a good session ale or good beer to introduce to non craft beer drinkers who will occasionally drink guiness stout .  pours a hazy golden color , with a huge fluffy white head . what a sight , as the head rose easily above the rim of the glass , and held there like an ice cream cone for a lengthy period of time .  body is on the thin side of medium and the finish is both mildly astringent and slightly bitter .

not a whole lot stood out in the aroma . flavors : spices with ginger , some bitterness , and a roasted malt and coffee finish and aftertaste .  lively . golden with a dense creamy head ... after all it is the cream of manchester ... a nickname i 've never felt comfortable with .  mouthfeel is way more thin than the head and lacing made me think it would be . very quaffable .

nice black color with edges of brown , poured to a medium head that dissipated quite quickly . some malty sweetness up front which fades into a roasted malt taste . very small hop bitterness and most of the rest of the bitterness is from the roasted malts . goes down smooth and is quite tasty . ~jonathan passow  i enjoy just about everything this beer has to offer .  it has a medium body and a fair amount of carbonation , but again feels a bit weak .

the aroma was very strange and not at all appetising for me . the aroma was disappointing but that is one of the nicest beers i have ever tasted .  color is an absolutely gorgeous golden amber that promises an excellent brew .  a-garnet with small ring of foam s-raisin , pancake syrup , faint vinager t-assertive sour front , sour cherry , some malt sweetness , dates m-medium , with average carbonation d-very tasty !

s : somewhat subdued citrus & pine hops with a caramel sweetness . t : really well balanced and drinkable .  poured out a beautiful and dark midnight black color with a cascading and creamy rich head of tan foam .  ran into the maui brewing company while killing time until our dinner reservations were ready . there was a very slight bitterness in the aftertaste but was well hidden in the passion fruit sweetness . found the beer to start like any average golden ale but the aftertaste was what i really liked about it sorta like an ice tea aftertaste .

the scent is pretty muted , it smells woody with some spicing and a tiny bit of citrus the flavor profile is interesting , it 's one of those distinctly staged brews .  bottle provided by mike , drank into my hill farmstead glass ... looks great , a dark clear peach with a big bright white head . looks awesome ! ! ! ... boring aroma of light toffee and hops , generic .  m : medium body with a sticky quality when it enters the mouth .

the aroma was underwhelming but neutral grainy .  yeti pours out like the darkest of used motor oils , thick and smooth with a monstrous billowing head that never goes away .  m : light to medium bodied and highly carbonated .

the nose is full of notes of raisiny notes as well as distinct hoppy character .  a dark body that exhibits a reddish tinge when held up to the light , with thick lacing spiraling down the side .  no sediment at all when bought fresh . this really brought out flavors you could not taste beforehand . a wedge of orange or lemon is a nice touch also . best served a little warmer than most beers . goes really well with food . a beer you could drink all night especially during a good bar-b-que .

the smell did n't give much away other than chocolatey malt and hops , so when i took the first sip i was surprised and utterly pleased . notes of fruit , a little nutty with a slightly bitter spicy hop aftertaste .  lovely hue , a truly good bright ruby red , with a collapsing , but pleasantly silky head of yellow white . it 's a really lovely looking american red ale , absolutely what you want from the style .  mouthfeel is moderate and relatively flat .

well i poured this into a pint glass and it has a good head , a pink hue and good watermelon aroma . this is very easy to drink !  highly envigorated light brown head of fine bubbles that left behind a nice lacing on the pour .  body was medium with med/high carbonation and a dry finish .

i really enjoyed this beer . it really did not have an aroma .  first pour into pint glass from 22oz bottle- brilliantly clear straw color . head was bright and high but fell to an inch for the remainder .  m : um . it was carbonated and did n't leave any odd off flavours on the palate .
the smell is malty , very mild . mouthfeel is thick , rich , almost creamy .  appearance ; beautiful black color with an attractive tan head .  mouthfeel is sticky-sweet and dense .

s : lots to smell here , very complex . standard malt and hops smells are there along with a fruitiness : appless and cherries . the smell is very sweet .  pitch black with a full dark amber head that settles to very thick sticky lacing .  this is the least impressive quad from the trappist breweries ... do n't get me wrong , it has a similar taste profile , although not that perfect as a westy 12 or a rochefort 10 , dark fruit , plums , candy sugar , but i did n't like the mouthfeel on this one . too much sparkling going on ... pretty funny thing is i just absolutely endlessly adore the la trappe quadrupel oak aged batch 1 version ... so so so much better then the regular one , especially when the oak aged version , bottled this summer , is coming around fantastic ! i like their dubbel more too .

some sweetish caramel malt . not much else in the nose but what 's there is tasty . overall it is very good .  appearance - black with no light passing through . good tan head on top . looks like a very nice stout or porter . nice amount of head but with even less lacing then their other beers .  tastes pretty amazing really . watery on the tongue but ends dryish .

hazy and color brings to mind pineapple juice . carbonation factor is high.get some funk in the aroma , not overpowering .  oysters ... hmmm ... pours a blackish black with a black interior and black edging . nice looking bubbling dark brown foam . really attractive .  m : medium-full bodied , zero carbonation , silky . d : lacks the warming feeling that is usually related to a winter warmer .

the aroma is really bad , it almost smells like chroline . the aroma just crushes this .  my first 5 for appearance , and it 's well deserved .  the flavor is a bit harsh and a bit watery , but not too much .

slight fruity aroma but nothing stands out here .  appearance : the brown head that just will not die . halfway through the glass i 'm still looking at a thick 1/4 ince layer of foam . there 's dried up , sticky lacing all over the glass , too . a perfectly dark taste for a dark brew .  carbonation is ample but the body lacks a little texture .

smells : slightly sulfurous on opening , but not as bad as my last sample of pbr . maybe the pabst plant has a little sulfur in the water ? i 'd really like to compare this side-by-side with pbr since they 're both pabst beers .  a : pours a clear copper color with a big rocky head . great sustain and tons of thick , sticky lace on the glass .  dark dark amber colot cant see thru at all thick white head remains on the glass and laces well the smell is of roasted and caremel malts , like a traditional english ale slightly different then my expectation of an alt but i like the smells tastes like a homebrew very fresh and smooth with crystal and roasted malts through out . to finish not a lot of body or carbonation leaves a dry roasted flavor

d- not a huge fan of the aroma but other than that it is a really nice beer .  pours a real nice rich caramel color with a solid dense frothy eggshell colored head with excellent retention and light lacing .  nice dark brown color with fantnaztic lacing ! smells choclotly with coffee . tastes even and thick with cocoa sweet caramel flavors continuing thru . good for its class this porter represents well , its much better than its younger brother . would drink again .

smell : i 'm really not getting much aroma off this . perhaps a hint of grasses , but barely . taste : nice malt taste with a light bit of citrus ( lemon ) and grasses .  slight visible carbonation , a very nice looking brew .  mouthfeel is a little too carbonated & acidic , which in my experience is typical of the japanese beers .
roasted aroma of chocolate , sweet coffee and a slight cinnamon bun finish . oxidation . whoa !  pours a deliciously cloudy , rich red with a nice thick & dark tan head .  light bodied .

fairly mild .  delicious and only $ 7/pint..hells yes please . angry and black it pours with a dark brown head , roast and alcohol dominate with some hop aroma , very faded , a little smoke , a little coffee .  lighter feel and dry in the mouth with a little too much carbonation .

decent german pils a- clear golden color with a nice fluffly head that leaves great lacing s- floral , medicinal , and metallic smells coming from this .  on tap at strange brew in manchester , nh 2/2/11 a : light yellow , almost hay colored , hazy . 1 1/2 inch fluffy white head , leaves tons of lacing , almost completely covering the glass .  incredibly light with cereal grains , very grainy taste , hops are nowhere in site . there are way better summer beers out there .

s : the weakest aspect of this beer for me . general maltiness is all i get . t : the key here is balance ; a supremely well-crafted beer .  old plowshare stout is a very dark reddish brown ale with a frothy , bubbly light brown head that has great retention and leaves lumpy lacing .  this brew is 5.2 % abv and my bottle looks exactly the same apart from the two silver australian international beer awards one from 2007 & the other from 2008 in the top left of the label anyways it pours a dark cola hue with a fast vanishing two finger head and sporadic lacing , the aroma is fresh chocolate icecream and vanilla expresso , it has an average mouthfeel with tastes of fresh chocolate icecream , vanilla expresso , macadamia and it finishes with a light bitter mouthfeel , overall a nice brew that is just lacking that full mouthfeel of a stout in my mind but in saying that its very sessionable and ill definately buy this again .
s- very tart sour smell . bit like figs or sour apple .  has a really nice fluffy one finger tan head that sticks around . lacing covers a huge portion of the glass .  heavy mouthfeel .

uh oh . smells sour . behind the sourness , i can smell candied pecans .  poured into a tall hobgoblin tumbler , there is a huge billowing light tan head . very impressive presentation .  mouthfeel works just fine , but is a little watery . highly drinkable .

it went down very smooth and i enjoyed it . however i was expecting more taste , the bottle says brewed with imported hops but to tell you the truth this beer tasted very similar to the less pricey michelob golden draft light sold here in minnesota .  looks really viscous and is extremely dark . excellent cascading head .  mouthfeel - medium body with a very active carbonation .

delightful smell . the taste , not so much .  pours with an excellent appearance , thick tan head with small dense bubbles and a clear hazelnut color .  im augustus gloop : ) m - carb a little low , a little on the sweet side .

nice , semi-transparent brown body with sparse thin head tracing on glass ... hints or green bottle metallics ... the maltiness presents little uniqueness ... tremendous carbonation ! lively curving of the beer around the tongue ... a bit of nut -- and a lot of malt ... a classic in brand name , smooth and aggressive ... enjoyable and versatile , and mainstream enough to be served at barbecues and holiday parties ...  the most beautiful foamy head i 've ever seen , and it lasts forever in the duvel glass , sitting atop a gold so intense it almost glows .  mouthfeel is very dry with almost no carbonation .

s : a bit oc chocolate but not much to the nose here t : malty chocolateness , along with a bit of bready malt .  excellent look - copper color with a big slightly off-white head that leaves excellent lacing . looks as good as a rye beer can .  very light mouthfeel .

on-tap at the clark street ale house . awesome yeast funk and they really nailed the look .  crystal clear straw hue with a two finger dense and frothy head that slowly settles to a thick cap , leaving a solid wall of lacing in its place .  mouthfeel is decent , this beer seems to foam up in your mouth .

smell is almost non-existant to me .  pours out very clear straw color with plenty of carbonation and a rich frothy white head that lingers and laces , truly beautiful .  but i felt the feel was a bit thin .

s - toasted malt , cinnamon & spices , and a mild fruitiness . very much like a pumpkin pie .  the old version of this beer brewed at devils canyon was pretty mediocre , but this is actually very good . appearance is excellent . clear golden with a soapy-looking white head that lasts and leaves great rings of lacing .  mouthfeel is light , and carbonation is set at medium .
smells very nice . very peppery with spicy yeast , bananas and pineapple .  decent lacing . a very attractive beer .  mouthfeel is ok. a litte too dry for my liking though .

aroma is mild , too mild , but i pick up on dark roasted malts , cocoa , light caramels , ans very german-smelling hops . tastes better room temp , smells better too as it warms .  poured from a liter swingtop bottle into a snifter a= pours a thick black color with a nice one finger brown head that lasts suprisingly long with amazing lacing . s= huge hop notes which is amazing as well as a prominent coffee smell .  overall , quite easy to drink and enjoyable though the mouthfeel is a bit on the thin side and not up to par with the style .

s : sweet , almost cloying honey ; a saccharine , slightly off-putting aroma . d : not bad , but smell is a bit too sweet and almost like sweaty skin .  poured an opaque brown , as expected from a stout , with thick , pillowy tan head and excellent lacing .  mouf & gt ; easy , average .

s : i got virtually no scent until it warmed up and i got chocolate and nice coffee but mostly roast and alc . t : great taste , smooth high gravity , the coffee taste is great .  i 've been avoiding this beer , but my wife bought me a sixer so here we go ... poured into a sa perfect pint glass , and it looks pretty good with mounds of soft and pillowy head , and a golden/slightly hazy body .  m/d - body is a little thin for me , would like to see the consistency just a hair thicker .

aroma is of caramelized sugar and taffy ; it really does smell just like creme brulee .  original rating date : october 19 , 2008 pours dark copper , thick , creamy head . strong lacing down the glass .  this beer has a fairly heavy body , a bit too much for my tastes .

very weird . the aroma was a bit off and the tastes could be a bit more `` in your face '' but it was worth the try .  a - pours a deep mahogany color with an inch of fluffy golden head . so far great .  mouthfeel : it feels like an astringent hop bitterness , but i sure as heck ca n't taste any hops .

smell is pleasantly malty and sweet .  appearance : pours with a massive amount of head , ca n't even pour the bottle in one try . awesome lacing . the beer itself is black as black can be , without even a hint of any other color around the edges . drinkability : this beer is a beautiful thing to behold , with amazing lacing .  mouthfeel : this was my one issue with this beer . it loses carbonation quickly , and with not that much to start with , it is kind of a bummer . a little sticky as well but the taste makes up for a bit of this .

smells of caramel and ... pepper ? very faint .  pours with an outrageously massive head , a dense , simmering mass of eggshell brown rising over the rim of the goblet like a souffle . what a visual feast !  m : lighter body , medium carbonation , somewhat watery thin feel to the body , with a crisp finish .

aroma is a delight . clean , bright and complex , yeasty sweet spicy goodness . taste is equally complex . figs , green grapes , caramel , leather and a brief dry twang .  pours a beautiful dark brown , nearly black , with a tan head of about one finger .  have you ever canned tomatoes ? if you have , you should be familiar with the smell and flavor tomatoes have when cooked . this beer had an overwhelmingly strong odor and taste of spicy stewed tomatoes . it was too strong to drink . i know this is not normal for this beer from the other reviews of it i have read ( and the style does n't allow for many strong flavors ) , but it was only days past the best by date and had been stored in a refrigerator . there was also some floating particles in the beer which i also assume is not normal , pilsners typically being filtered . i will come back and rerate , but i 've been told by some fellow raters that i should take this beer into account for my rating .

light malt and grainy presence upfront with nice floral hop notes and undertones of grassy hops . overall , quite flavorful and easy drinking , tasted fresh despite the freshness date being about 3 weeks past .  from tower liquor a - a deep reddish-copper pour , slightly hazy , with a great fluffy , off-white head with good retention and lacing .  m - exceedingly bitter . needs to be a little creamier for this style d - not a session beer .

esbs are not stop traffic hot chicks , but they are the type of chick that can give good head ... so this is on par . nose ... surprisingly musty , tones of malt and caramel are lurking around the back of the joint but are n't quite in the door , nothing offensive , nothing aggressive ... not much to quaff here taste etc ... tastes a bit like the smell except the aftertaste really develops nicely , up front it is slightly bitter with that musty flavor that leeches into the fluggel type flavor and rounds out with a mild cascade floral/p [ ne hop character . this is perfect at cellar temp ... nothing too complex here but man this beer just is a pleasure to drink .  pours a deep , rich plummy color topped by a lively head of sloppy , sticky looking foam . this has a very healthy head that sticks around and laces majestically .  the colour is a light straw , probably the weakest colour i have seen in a pale lager , the head is very pleasent and has some serious glass cling ... the aroma is very skunky when first opened but quickly disappears and the taste is highly sweet malts on a thin body , very nice for dining , not a stadium brew ... i first reviewed this brew in march of 03 , approx 10 monthes ago .

appearance : pours into a sam adams glass a clear pale yellow with a loose-bubbled white head on top . smell : quite sweet with indications of wheat and lemony citrus .  poured almost pitch black , good size tan foamy head that diminished to a tan creamy collar that held the sides of the glass all the way down .  the mouthfeel is a little thin , very dry , but well carbonated .

s : striking tropical fruit , pineapple , lots of oranges , kiwi fruit , very nice . my kind of nose in an ipa . d : the nose tricked me into thinking i was going to get something great , but this beer still impressed me just going on the previous scores .  a=a nice , beautiful dark amber-brown , with decent-sized creamy head , that leaves noticeable but faint lacing . nice , very nice .  the mouthfeel is a little on the thin and watery side though .

smell : aromas of spice , yeast , and a hint of citrus . what it lacks in smell it makes up in appearance and ever moreso , taste .  the color was hazy lemon yellow with two fingers of rocky , yellow-tinted head . the cap retained itself beautifully and the lacing was in solid bands .  mouthfeel : medium body and a finish that is a bit dry . this beer almost flat .

s : some malt characters , bread and toffee mostly . after that not to much going on in the nose . very subtle hints of hops but that 's reaching for it . d : very drinkable beer !  a : light orange color with the most insane head i 've ever seen . off white and very very creamy head .  mouthfeel is just a tad watery .

smells of noble hops and that 's really about it , pretty much standard for a german lager , i guess . tastes more bitter than i expected , and a little sweeter than i expected .  a= a hazy orangish amber color with an enourmous off white creamy head with amazing lacing and retention . really nice looking s= fruity for sure .  mouthfeel is a little thin , but not offensively so .
) aroma is mostly malt but not very impressive overall .  jet black ... amazing tan head .  body is light and the carbonation is lively , a bit too much for my preferences .

aroma is very muted . i had a hard time picking anything up at all . unique , and very enjoyable .  poured a 4 finger fluffy white head with excellent retention .  mouthfeel is a bit thin for my liking .

whatever , it sounds good . it pours a very deep brown color , just a hint of blood red at the bottom , with a small , short-lived beige head .  a : orange colour and a huge 4 cm head that sticks around due to the high carbonation .  body is perhaps the one less thanexcellent area , as its a little too light and i would have preferred something heavier and slicker ( more like the maui offering ) .

almost no aroma , though the floral hops and lotus flowers do come through .  a : huge snowy head , billowing above the glass . classic belgian carbonation , bravo .  taste is dominating by anis with some candi sugar . body was above average and alcohol was well hidden .

aroma packs an immediate bourbon punch and is balanced by rich vanilla and milk chocolate . molasses , raisins , brown sugar and caramel with very little roast , burnt or hop aromas . non-existent alcohol and the sweetness is very pleasant and smooth . flavor is similarly smooth and balanced with surprisingly more of a milk chocolate , vanilla and molasses presence than in the nose . bourbon is still present , particularly in the finish , but never harsh . warming throughout , yet the balance between the barrel and base beer is remarkable . mouthfeel is slightly thinner than hoped for , medium thick with light carbonation ; slightly milky in character . i do n't feel like this detracts from my enjoyment of the beer , but for the style would have expected something a little more robust .  probably the prettiest lacing you will ever see on a glass . effing beautiful .  the mouthfeel starts off kind of watery since this seems to be a light to medium bodied brew and leaves a dry , but sticky feel to the lips .

smell is rather striking and unique . slight hints of spice most likely from the chilles , with a really sweet grainy hop note .  pours a brilliant copper ; a vigorous pour produces only a one-inch head but a nice , tight , foamy one .  m : it 's a little thin , but i kind of like it . d : improved because of the thin mouthfeel .

a : beautiful deep dark red , with a foamy , rich head s : unbelievably fragrant of cherries t : this is a sweet cherry beer . yummy .  a : pours a clear golden color with two fingers of creamy white head that fades slowly , leaving countless strips of lacing on the glass .  the mouthfeel is light carbonation , somewhat on the watery side , but very drinkable .
worth trying but i wont get it again .  head is enormous and really nicely laces . retention is amazing .  light bodied d- in moderation , this beer is perfect for a 2 beer session .

the first thing that hit me and my friend was the fantastic smell -- heavy with alcohol and woody wine overtones .  appearance : poured a nice , thick dark tan head which persisted nicely . color is very dark brown -- pretty much opaque .  very creamy mouthfeel .

s - extemely sweet and malty , with hints of floral aroma hops . the flavor and aroma are good enough to have couple of these beers , but there is n't much to want to bring you back .  i absolutely loved this bottle .  m : nice light body on it with mild carbonation , which was perfect for this style of ale .

smells great . big , overripe tropical fruit and citrus with a little bit of grass underneath . i actually coughed and spilled some while pouring and thought , `` man , that smells awesome ! '' while cleaning it up . still good , just a letdown after the nose .  just an over-sized glass with great markings . excellent to look at . a clear golden pour with a very generous head .  m - smooth and creamy ! d - surprisingly good for an american porter .

this one starts off with a huge citrus aroma . this is led by a strong grapefruit aroma and some fresh earthy hops .  i had this on tap and have to say was extremely impressed by its beautiful golden color , and fine head .  m - very creamy and milky and chewy , and not heavy in the least , this combined with the fantastic flavors gives one much to savor .

upon opening the bottle you receive a pleasant aroma and on pouring the smell is obviously even more intense . the mouthfeel is actually kind of weak and bitter , surprisingly , given the pleasant look and smell of this beer .  a - pours nice black and huge heavy sticky head .  i keep tasting chocolate ice cream ... dry chocolate ice cream ... not cloy at all ... very fantastic finish and mouthfeel ... german beer ftw will buy again !

no alcohol notes , good for 6.7 % abv and warmer serving temp . drinkability : decent , i could drink a few in one sitting overall : smell is pretty disappointing , way too faint for a west coast ipa and `` the bursting hops '' it claims on the label .  perfect appearance . really smooth 2 finger ashy cocobutter brown head . dark black balled body that looks beautiful in my snifter .  mouthfeel was great , it was very rich and smooth with little carbonation but it fit the stout just right .

s : very nice smell here with wood tones in the nose and some great hop/malt balance .  pours brown with ruby hints . there are two healthy fingers of head ( boy , is this a live beer ) and the retention and lacing are top notch .  i love the mouthfeel on this beer , probably my favorite part of it .

anyhow , when you have a need for hops , this one certainly takes care of the fix . aroma , yes , just like it should be- huge citrus , flowers , grapefruit rind , oranges , probably lemons and limes if i was n't diving in so fast . this beer has a nice solid body holding in a creamy , milky nectar thats very smooth . the finish is bitter but smooth , maybe a little woody from all the hops . it only lacks a little malt complexity in the flavor , the malt seems a bit basic but does hold up well to the hop explosion .  big bulky beige head 1 1/2 inches . a thin head remains throughout no matter how long it sits ( very nice ) .  a nice smoothness develops into a wonderful creaminess .

smell- by far the sweetest smelling beer i 've ever had .  a- pours orange-amber with a massive , foamy and creamy head that retains amazingly , gives duvel a run for its money . the cloud is as big as the head of others .  the mouthfeel is one of the best i 've ever had .

longneck into a cascazilla pint glass purchased at the brewery : ( a very cool glass with some red hops on it ) a - copper/red hue with about a 1/2 inch head that quickly died down to an outer ring and no lacing - maybe it was the glass ' fault s - straight up pine and citrus from the hops , also some malt sweetness in there t - a burst of hops to start with . taste like west coast hops , and not too bitter , probably lots of late mid/late hop additions and dry-hopping , as there is a great hop flavor and aroma to this beer without too much bitterness . good supporting role by the malt to keep the hops in check . awesome job combining the characteristics of a red ale and an ipa .  it pours a thick , viscous black with a large dark tan hea that slowly recedes .  great mouthfeel and is smooth on the palate with a hoppy bitterness that lasts forever .

the initial pour sends a wafting of grapefruity hop notes into the nose , though sadly the aroma fades away , becoming very subdued .  this is the only barley wine i have every tried , and chances are it will be the last . some people love this stuff , not me , not my taste buds .  this is a big , complex , full bodied beer . the huge amounts of malts in this thing are chewy and even feel like they stick to the teeth some .

5.0 s : lots of oatmeal is apparent . this may be the most oatmeal laden beer i 've had . awesome balance between sweet and roasted flavors . 4.0 t : the taste is just about as good as the nose , but the mouthfeel is too distracting for me to enjoy it .  you get the beautiful nitrogen show and then it settles with a dark brown , almost black , body with a nice light tan head .  taste- wonderfully intense malt , and a big bready character that thankfully outweighs any unpleasant sweetness that the malts could impart . fantastically effervescent , it rides into the mouth and over the tongue with confident grace ... all the while alive and outspoken .

s-this beer has one of the most pleasant aromas that i have smelt in a long time .  a - clear dark , ruby red . head is thick , creamy and immovable .  super creamy mouthfeel , medium body and carbonation level .

s : the glass was a foot and a half away from my face and i could immediately smell a warm pumpkin pie coming out of the oven with a nice floral hops on the back . t : the spicy pumpkin flavor swirls with a strong caramel malt flavor .  a - has two full fingers of ultra-fine reddish-tan head . what a beauty !  the mouthfeel is exceptional and that is all i am going to say about this .

s - cherries , orange peel , and fresh fruits combine to create an enticing aroma . a definite yeasty quality is also present .  after pouring most of the 16oz can into my new duvel tulip , thanks again brian , i am left with an immaculate 3 beige head that lingers for what seems like forever , and it leaves thick clumps of lacing and leaves behind a nice pillow of foam . the medium brown hue with a red tint is darker than most but still pretty with good clarity .  mouthfeel - heavy body with mild carbonation . it 's perfect to me .

a little unusual too . overall , a unique and very enjoyable iipa .  looks fantastic ! the head leaves plenty of lace after a couple of minutes .  m : the mouthfeel is delightful . fairly thick for an ipa , almost creamy with mild carbonation .

wow ... the nose on this is excellent ! tons of roasted malts , coffee beans and dark chocolate . very nice ... the taste is n't quite as profound as the nose , but it holds up well . i am really glad i had the chance to try it ... after all , it has been on my wants list for some time .  brilliant cloudy , fuzzy , bubbly orange appearance with a perfect 1/4 inch puffy head and a pleasant hoppy aroma .  appearance : cloudy burnt orange/brown - nice head retention smell : cinnamon , nutmeg , pumpkin spice taste : hops , cinnamon , coriander , nutmeg - similar to an american wild ale - very tannic mouthfeel : my favorite part very tannic , smooth - the rye dries the palate out so you 're ready for another sip or another bite of food .

aroma is incredibly full and delicious . very very nice aroma . the flavor is just as incredible as the aroma . cherries , both sweet and sour are here in abundance , as well as a bit of graininess , and almost a thin flaky pastry flavor .  pours a 1+ finger tan head over a brilliant bright gold liquid .  m - the creamiest beer i 've ever had . wow . thick , smooth , perfect .

nice hop aroma right off the bat . very piney and resiney .  reviewed 1/12/2010 ( bottle ) : pours a dark reddish brown color body , big fluffy head , off-white , lasting .  bear republic really , really nailed the mouthfeel on this one .

s : a great big whiff of piney , citrus , and florally goodness hits the olfactory receptors . i 'm expecting a decent malt backbone here . o : this was only my fourth offering from 3 floyds ( alpha king , apocalypse cow , arctic panzer wolf ) and i 've been impressed with most .  immense multi-layered head with frothy , large bubbles at the base and fine meringue top . lasted for ever , leaving beautiful lacing behind .  m : nice and light , yet still has some body . very smooth , good carbonation , good residue . exceptional .

s - huge pine aroma that is quickly and easily enjoyable . massively beautiful from the get-go , with underlying citrus notes . a perfect , varied aroma that promises wonderful delights within t - slight pine taste , bit of grapefruit , pure hops abound . d - very nice , but perhaps lacking a bit of malt balance making this a bit more difficult to enjoy .  brett poured a beautiful slightly hazed golden-orange color producing a massive white head of assorted bubble sizes which was a bit hard to tame .  however , it tastes great and feels great in the mouth .

smell is phenomenal ; coffee , mocha , vanilla , kahlua , coffee cake ... the aroma is outstanding . perhaps the best porter i 've ever sniffed . this beer is simply delicious . slight let down from that a+ aroma but minimal . tastes like the smell but with some malt and roasty notes . very drinkable .  pours a deep deep dark brown with a monumental rocky khaki head ... . beautiful .  the mouthfeel is oh so smooth and creamy , just perfect !

the nose is ... strange . i 'm bad with identifying odors , but suffice to say , whatever it is it does n't smell good .  looks nearly black with about a 3/8 '' caramel colored head from a vigorous pour .  mouthfeel- damn , this sh*t is creamy ! smooth , medium carbonation , but goes down super smooth . nice light bitterness in the aftertaste .

aroma is wow coffee , rich robust , you want it , it 's here , with a nice dark malt sweetness underneath .  great `` belgian '' lacing & very good head retention smell : sourness & then woody , lactic notes .  sweet malts are offset by crisp hops together producing a wonderful balance and mouthfeel . sooo smooth !

the aroma is thoroughly enticing , presenting notes of buttered wheat , bubble gum , orange peel , banana creme , vanilla , and a touch of spicy , organic hops . all in all , a satisfyingly complex and tasty wheatwine from the talented terrapin brewers .  beautiful pour . bits of sediment floating around . nice creamy tan head that remained throughout with gorgeous lacing .  the mouthfeel is light , with excellent particulates that roam the mouth . a most excellent brew that i would n't hesitate to try again .

it 's an awesome smelling stout !  the beer was served in a traditional belgium chalice and the color alone really made me stop and admire this beer . it was a light ruby red , very clear and was topped with a creamy pink head .  m : smooth as silk but liquid is very thick and creamy . low carbonation .
there is noe smell other than grain .  excellent lacing and a fully lasting head .  smooth and creamy , very soft carbonation . booze is extremely well hidden .

i love the smell of this beer ... i smell molasses with hints of toffee ... nice maltiness . mouthfeel is very good . great esb !  12oz bottle app : huge 2-3 finger , tan head . devilishly dark and opaque . makes you think it 's truly from a monster .  mouthfeel is truly wonderful , with a heavy , syrupy feel mixed in with a light tingle from some hidden carbonation and the alcohol itself .

smell is exceptional , with a peach and plum smell up front with a bit of malt and hops to follow .  as pretty as beer poured out of a can into a glass can be .  super creamy mouthfeel w/o any overcarbed bite .

the aroma is phenominal . funky , yeasty , wet wood , barn yard , and sour lemons and oranges .  330ml bottle poured into tulip dec9 2010 a super hazy golden orange with tiny suspended particles being move around by a shitload of bubbles . a gentle pour leaves a massive 3 finger head that forms a dome over the top of the glass and just sits there for a while ever so slowly falling to a thick film with a island in the middle that looks like a little brain s a little yeast and pineapple with some other fruits i ca n't quite place and some booze t what i smell but with a little more booze , some cereals and a nice little blast of hops .  m-grand canyon deep and gordian knot complex . amazingly tantalizing on the palate . while it looks still in the glass it bursts with palate stimulating carbonation with each sip . like an amusement park in your mouth ! this is a highly enjoyable and palate stimulating sipper . a mighty fine drinking brew .

grapefruit ! my favorite aroma in beer and life for some strange reason , but enough about me ... .once i break from my grapefruit coma , i do notice pine and a little lemon rind in the background t - there is that damn grapefruit again , i just ca n't get away from it . immense hop flavor with a surprising amount of malt that finds its way through the hops .  almost impossible to open due to the stupid wax coating covering the whole swing top . lightly hazed bronze color with a nice full pillowy light beige head , nice active carbonation , and nice lace sheets .  the mouthfeel on this beer is abosolutely amazing , almost like carbonated cream , it is wonderful and invites another sip immediately .

smell : absolutely delicious . the hops really fused well with the cedar in this case . love it . taste : it is a very sharp flavor .  could n't decipher a date code on this one , so not sure how old/new it is ... pours an absolutely beautiful pitch black color with a deep tan foamy head .  t/m - well carbonated , providing a prickly yet very smooth feel as it rolls across the tongue .

a truly wonderful bouquet . taste accents of hops and light fruits , again pineapple , with a delayed afterthought of hops bitterness at the back of the throat . a tasty and sexy organic brew .  a nearly perfect pour . smells and tastes of the usual hefe spicy , peppery yeast , clove and banana , with a touch of citrus ( maybe lemon ) sourness .  again this is a beer with a very good character but i still feel it does n't perfectly balance m- incredible mouthfeel .

poured from the bottle into a nonic glass a- pours a dark orange amber color with a two finger frothy , slightly fluffy head that leaves some sticky , patching lacing , and high streaming carbonation s- a strong bouquet citrus , pine , and floral hop aroma t- balance of piney and citrus hops , caramel malt backbone , pretty strong woodiness , hits you with hops on the front and finishes with a strong piney hop finish , leaves a bitter aftertaste m- pretty smooth drinking , finishes a little watery o- a good ipa that packs a lot of bitterness and is very aromatic .  pours a pretty deep black with dark tan head that clings to the glass . looking quite appealing .  m- great body , great carbonation . feels good .

s- large amount of aromatics here ! strongly grapefruit in character , citrus of oranges and lemons behind that , notebook paper , and minute hops profile . t- the grapefruit is a tease . i prefer to smell it to be honest , but that wo n't last forever . the hops become distracting towards the middle , but it is no where near the annoyance of a hop bomb .  pours a massive , incredibly thick , dense and chunky white head that is long lasting .  m - rich and thick , very chewy .

big sweet malty aroma . caramel , candied walnuts , raisins .  glass : snifter temp : cellared @ approx 45 degrees this is perfect appearance for a stout . it 's as black as black can be . the head takes a long while to recede to a nice thick surface covering , over an 1/8th of an inch thick . visually , this is quite an impressive beer .  excellent mouthfeel , low carbonation .

aroma is a staggering , fresh , really rich chocolate .  this is a stunning looking ale : dark-brown with a ruby glaze , bubbles dancing toward the top like a light snowfall in reverse , crowned with a creamy mocha head .  m : perfect . syrupy feel at first , but it does not over pollute your pallate like some brews .

it is astoundingly complex . t - it tastes like a better-than-average barleywine , but not by much . d - a mixed bag ; full of lore and hype , looks intriguing , smells wildly complex , tastes like an old abused barleywine .  starts off creamy white and then cascades from the bottom of the glass to the top changing to black as it goes . there is a thick off white head that lasts forever and covers the sides of the glass in foam and thick rings that mark each swallow .  finishes dry with nice mocha notes & a touch of charred grain mf : very oily & smooth as all hell with low carbonation & nice stickyness .

the pure white fluffy head looked like snow had fallen on a green-apple tree ! the smell of grannysmith apple and candied sugar . the taste was the same as the nose except at the finish , some good tart apple rhine gives a good semi-dry finish .  purchased as a 22 from wine and beer westpark in glen allen , va - tulip pours dark but with mahogany edges , perfect head with awesome lacing .  bitter black chocolate moves into the woodiness and finishes boozy m- creamy , full-bodied , coats the mouth and boozy heat d- really impressed with this one .

pretty tasty with a great aroma .  appearance : poured a milky orangy and yellowish hazy color , typical of hefeweizens , especially authentic german ones . yielded a huge 3 finger creamy head that came right out of the glass but maintained its shape is it was thick and creamy .  round velvety texture , excellent carbonation , and ( as you would expect ) some warming . exceptionally satisfying brew - if not my absolute favorite from unibroue , it is the one i return to most often .

smells heavy of cherries , very good smell . taste is just as heavy with the cherries .  pours with a deep amber/red body topped by a thick off white head with lots of lacing .  the malt is well back but the beer still has a nice light body . the palate is a great balance of all that and a nice honey quality in the background .

s : the smell is unbelievable . tons of robust , fresh raspberries blended with a nice cherry and lemony tartness . slightly acidic smelling with a hint of vinegar . not as robust and/or flavorful as the smell led me to believe , but this is great nonetheless . mouth puckering raspberry goodness to start , followed by some lemon rinds , dry oak , and slight vinegar . it was very good , but we all thought it was lacking something .  bottle 1347/3700 a- pours a deep rich black with a nice brownish head .  it 's just smooth and thick enough to feel perfect going down .

really really strong nose - very sweet with notes of baking spices , vanilla , vanilla cake batter , pumpkin . there is also something about it that i 'm not sure i 've ever smelled before ... and i love it . t : lives up to the smell .  pours a beautiful crimson/brown color with a fluffy two finger head - as i move the beer around the head remains as one and sticks together , unwilling to fade away .  mouthfeel is sublime . kind of like a benign dreamy tingling that coats the palate evenly .

the aromas are divine : brandied , sour apples , an array of raw and roasted nuts , oranges , vanilla and pepper . on the palate it was metallic and struggled to deliver the promise of the nose . still , bright , sweet green strawberry and caramel curled in and out of the perfectly flat liquid . apparently this beer was not out of date , as there have been many other reviews this year for examples this old . a shame .  biggish , crusty , light tan head leaves lots of hard , sticky lacing . very pretty .  a full bodied beer that is creamy smooth and goes down really easy .

the first thing that hits the nose is fresh , sweet apricots . notes of peaches and a creamy aroma come through as well . t- very sour with lactic acid . the fruit was far more subtle that i thought it would be , based on the smell . the fresh apricot flavor comes through a little more clearly as the beer warms . d- a bit of a sipper , considering how sour it is , but overall very good .  quite close to black with a fine textured tan head . i love the way the beer horizon ( the separation between the beer and the head ) looks . it stayed that way throughout the beer .  m : wonderfully smooth . nice creamy texture that does n't stick too long in the mouth .

by far the best smelling pumpkin beer i 've had , and one of the best i 've had , period , in a long time . t- not quite as good as the smell , but still pretty good . cinnamon , nutmeg , pumpkin , orange creamsickle , and alcohol .  pours a glowing hazy golden with a thick creamy head that retains well and laces the glass .  a faint bit of tannins in the middle of the tongue starts the finish , which is incredibly long with trailing , vineous notes of chocolate and spiced orange peel . ya it 's a bit like those warheads candies , but it 's tucked in such an incredible silky richness .

smell : so wonderful ... the smoky peaty aroma fills the nostrils . cloying . i really did n't care for the sweetness of this beer .  pours a murky , dark dark brown colour , only a sliver of colour really visible . head is stunning : beige , dense , small bubbles that wobbles on top but retains , with a beautiful , vibrant cascade when poured . lace is clingy and thick , like coffee foam . that 's a stunning beer .  m/d : a full , silky smooth brew with low ( perfect ) carbonation .

this is delicious beer . the aroma is just like liquor soaked fruit , with a hint of cinnamon . it 's got a nice clear amber color .  this is my first bigfoot so we will see how the talk stands up ... a- really dark ruby red in my snifter . big sandy , fluffy head perched atop . at this point the head seems unwavering . but it eventually faded leaving all sorts of lace .  subtly carbonated , with a medium-full body and a delightful smoothness .

i stick my nose to the glass to get a better whiff of the hoppy goodness and i sneezed 3x . this is all about the hops . as the aroma foretold , this beer is all about the hops . the beer is drinkable now , but it is a big beer and pretty green .  12 oz bottle poured into a dfh tulip . a- literally my favorite color of beer- deep reddish-copper . solid 1+ inch head that laces well .  mouthfeel is where this beer really shines , and makes one understand why some folks are such lager fans . the balance in this beer is amazing , with everything seemingly in the right preportion .

( s ) - a ridiculously rich aroma . awesome whiffs of oaky bourbon with sweet toffee and caramel with an even more glorious smell of cocoa covered dark cherries behind it . its strong , but smells really stinking good .  a vigorous pour produced several fingers of foamy white head that eventually dissipated to about two fingers . lots of sticky lacing .  the mouthfeel on this is exceptional , so smooth will alcohol masterfully controlled .

smell - not a whole lot of aroma , maybe a bit of malt and a little bit of caramel , but not much taste - the taste matches the smell quite well .  pours up a beautiful grapefruit color with a very thin white head .  m= perfect dryness and crispness .

this beer smells so good ! sweet with almost a balsamic vinegar quality . great . tart , sour gets me in the back of the mouth .  appearance : looks beautiful . jet black stout , brown creamy head pours thick with a thin half finger head .  not the stunner i was hoping for m- beautiful mouth feel . i sure hope this is not the `` great sculpin '' i 've been waiting for for that past few years .

this is quite possibly the sweetest smelling beer i 've ever sniffed .  great looking beer .  m : the feel is exactly how i like my imperial stouts . there is a decent amount of carbonation in there as well .

this is one of the nicest smelling beers i 've had .  pours a dark brown with hints of red at the edges , crackling four finger light tan head settles to a finger tall , and remains all the way through , leaves temporary sheets of lacing that fade ( probably due to the abv ) .  mouthfeel was phenomenal - silky smooth and with a slight hops bite on the tongue , giving 'way on the finish to a great caramel sweetness .

the smell is the best part of this beer : very hoppy and `` dirty '' . the taste is good , but i feel that it 's a bit weak compared to dogfish head 's 90 minute ipa . overall , a good ipa , but not the best i 've had .  a : pours to a frothey tan head with a deep and beautiful copper body . excellent lacing .  the mouthfeel on this beer is almost perfect . a nice smooth drinkable beer .

s- very wonderful aroma here . very nice hop smells come from this .  a-bronze and brilliantly clear . huge eggshell head .  the mouthfeel was phenomenal . to have a cask conditioned beer is such a treat , and i 'm glad my neighborhood bar always has one beer on cask .

a : dark brown with yeast particles s : could be the strongest smelling dark fruit belgian style beer ever .  produced a huge rocky head that lasts & lasts and when subsides leaves half its mass on the side of the glass ( i did n't mean for that to rhyme , it just worked out that way . ) the aroma is ok , its floral like perfume but not particularly citrusy or piney or any of those typically american hop descriptors .  visual appeal : a bubbly , misty bar of shining gold , appealing streaks , almost continuous effervescence smell : very reminiscent of hard apple cider , mild hop aroma , strong yeast , really grew on me as beer warmed flavor : pilsner malts and bohemian hops and very strong cloudy yeast flavor lingers a long time , feel warmth of alcohol on back of palette , hints of citrus but not strong enough , i 'd prefer this a little sweeter , however mouthfeel : lovely effervescence plays with whole of tongue drinkability : heavy abv -- sipping beer , definitely would not drink more than one at a time my first ever belgian ale , right before the yank memorial day weekend , and i 'm definitely feeling it ( the ale , that is . ) i have `` gained a level .

one of the nicest smelling dipas ( imperial pale ? ) i 've experienced t : initially starts out with lots of bitterness from the hops .  pours a very dark reddish brown color with a very nice looking 2 finger slightly tan head that does n't seem to want to go down !  the body is very full & rich with just the perfect amount of carbonation .

s : kiwi fruit and pink watermelon with a hint of yeast , very pleasant . t : nice floral component , early on flowery with and hint of dandelion greens and grass .  this beer pours an inky black with a dark brown head .  the carbonation is very low ( natch ) , the body silky smooth , and dead creamy .

it has a great aroma . lots of sweet malt , floral notes , and honey . it 's a little too sweet , but still good . i also get a slight undertone of cloves .  superb retention .  first sip reveals a soft creamy texture with mild rolling carbonation .

man this was incredible . citrusy herbal if i had to put some words on it .  this one pours a dark muddy brown that shows some ruby highlights when held to light . the beer is topped by a nice frothy khaki head that lasts and leaves beautiful lacing .  mouthfeel : exceptionally smooth and silky as can be .

very good . t - starts out quite fruity , sweet and tart with heavy notes of strawberries .  a : beautiful , clear , dark ruby body under a majestic two-finger head of creamy , sticky tan foam . tons of lace . truly spectacular . s : a little underpowered - light acetic sting , some sweet fruit , and a bit of husky malt .  really coats the mouth for an excellent mouthfeel .

overall , a seemingly pleasant ipa , that tastes wonderful at first , but then bites back too hard and dies flowery . still pleasant on the nose and eyes and foretaste though .  appearance : beautiful deep gold color , a lushous two-fingered layer of white foam , lots of rising bubbles , good head retention , flecks of lace aroma : dusty , cinnamony , malty , honey-like sweetness , floral hops , plummy fruitiness , perfumy ( sage and roses ?  mouthfeel : about as perfect as could be asked for .

the aroma was amazing , especially for a beer of such humble stature . chocolatey rich to the extreme . steaming hot fudge instantly came to mind . sweet and creamy with strong notes of vanilla and a touch of oak . dark chocolate came through strong up front . black coffee was noticeable in the center . this was a smooth and tasty beer with an aroma that was to die for . at 5.7 % abv , this porter was surprisingly drinkable .  poured from a growler into a pint glass . pours a deep , clear ruby-brown with wonderful garnet highlights when held to the light . a fat , frothy head of light tan foam shows marvelous retention , holding tight throughout and lasting to the finish , grabbing tightly to the walls of the glass , leaving behind thick , bubbly curtains of lace as the glass empties .  perfect . d- a remarkably smooth beer , although a bit mild .

s : smells delicious . tart fruit all over the place . fairly satisfying . m : huge carbonation level makes it just a tad unpleasant , but not so much so that i dont still enjoy the beer overall .  pours a three finger cream head that fades slowly to a thin layer leaving a good lace .  f : wonderfully thick .

tomato , oregano , basil , pizza dough , the whole nine yards . i swear i smell green olives ! t : tomato , pepperoni , garlic , olives , dough , even kind of salty . d : let 's face it , you 're going to get this for the same reason i got it : novelty .  anyone that has seen guinness will know that the appearance is just incredible . exactly what stout should look like .  m : very creamy feeling , small bubbles , not too sticky .

the smell of this 2 year old beer is so rich and strong . it smells of sweet fruits and a little bit of alcohol .  this beer poured slow , and was pitch black in color . the head was medium sized , but brown , with small bubbles . looked beautiful !  full rich mouthfeel , particularly fun after back-to-backing the hansenns cassis .

the aroma is grainy with a bit of hops .  it basically looks very impressive ... fantastic .  body is velvety , full , round , and waiting to be enjoyed like a dangerous fruit i have in mind heh heh . finish is a fascinating contrast between exquisite and coarse , not too long and proly not a session unless ur into gettin hauled off .

this is a really great nose . tastes not quite as good as it smells , but still solid . smells great and is solid all around - worth a shot .  had this one just a few minutes ago , and i have to say i 'm was very impressed . gorgeous presentation especially in a decorated glass german stein .  the alcohol burns just a bit in the back of my throat , but overall the mouthfeel on this is amazing . d- wow !

really light . the smell department was very disappointing though .  pours almost oil black which was a pleasant surprise . medium/thick lumpy head that reveals most of the aroma right off the bat .  exceptional body .

smell - rosey , very subdued , but a little too much so . just would have expected a bit more out of it , in terms of aroma . taste - this reminds me of a barleywine . there were lots of hops in this , but it was very smooth . you can taste the alcohol . not what i would have expected out of the winter warmer style , but enjoyable none the less . feel - extremely smooth with a nice mouthcovering .  poured a hazy straw colored hue with a fluffy three finger head . the retention was beyond excellent as was the very stick lacing . by the time i got to the bottom of my hefe glass , there was still nearly a finger of fluffy head remaining .  '' love the mouthfeel .

another great beer from denmark , this little country is no slouch in craft beer world.poured into an imperial nonic a near jet black except from some chocolate brown highlights when held to the light , a large blooming lighter mocha colored head atop.to me the aromas couldnt get any better , a fantastic display of chocolate and resiny hop , maybe the best aroma of any stout i have come across , if you like the hops no matter the style its spot on.the mouthfeel is a little sharp and not as full on as i would have liked.bitter chocolate , dark fruit , and a healthy dose of resiny hop make for a well rounded flavor profile , if that mouthfeel was just a little more smooth ! a really good beer that is close to being great , love the hop play going on .  poured a slightly cloudy , amber to copper color with . nice frothy two finger off white lasting head . ample lacing cling to the glass .  mouthfeel : full bodied , chewy , carbonation is spot on .

rodenbach grand cru , abv : 6.0 % . s : big aromas of red wine , cloves , ginger , oranges , berries , juniper and liquorice . like a mix of glgg ( mulled wine ) and julmust ( a swedish type of soda , drunk at christmas ) . t : rich , sour flavours of red wine , cranberries , apples , oranges , cloves , juniper , liquorice , brown sugar and black pepper . it 's unusual to me ( but i like it ) . i do n't know what to say - it 's the sourness that does the job for my tongue . while i 'm all alone in the dark , the aromas and flavours bring a lot of memories and other stuff to my mind - i think i 'm going to enjoy more of beers like this in the future .  sampled on 4-7-09 pours a clear deep red/brown , with a huge , foamy , clingy , off-white head that leaves crazy thick lacing .  this was the first belgian i ever had . it has a very creamy smoothness that i really love . finishes long and dry with more fruityness .

aroma is very inviting with apple , pear , and an awesome yeastiness . the taste is n't as fruity and glorious as the incredible aroma but it is nice and earthy . there is a great toastiness to it and great caramel , bread and diacetyl butter flavor .  the body of hop head poured an absolutly beautiful copper-orange color , with a sizable custard head . retention and lacing were both excellent , thanks to a constant supply of carbonation from below .  the taste is a rich velvety malt with an amazing mouthfeel and a fully satisfying richness .

wonderful citrus aroma of oranges and grapefruits . the nose is n't just there , it smacks you in the face - and this is a wonderful thing . if i could give higher than a five for aroma on this beer i would . taste - this beer is called hop dragon and consequently is all about hops . great bitter kick that almost goes unnoticed because of all the other great things about this beer .  appearance : dark black color , with big chocolate brown head , medium carb smell : chocolate , with malts , and some wood taste : bitter dark chocolate , coffee , alcohol , and roasted malt mouthfeel : dry , slightly bitter , rich full body drinkability : a drinkable imperial stout , the high abv is moderately masked .  very big and chewy mouthfeel

crisp . ( t ) - has a rather tart profile with some serious pineapple & grapefruit citrus up front . ( m ) - a tad higher carbonation level than you would expect from the style , but it really is not too bothersome . really crisp because of it though , with really potent citrus .  beautiful , beautiful honey color with a thick , but not creamy , head .  body is medium-full for style , and this is just about perfect on the way down .

s : holy hops ! strong citrus and pine hop aroma , sweet and fruity , not very bitter smelling . t : follows the nose , tropical fruit and citrus hops dominate , followed by piney flavors . o : this beer gives me a rock-solid .  had this at a recent ba gathering at milly 's , and brought a growler home . this is a beautiful beer : as black as can be , with a thick coffee-colored head .  great mouthfeel .

it has a very sweet aroma to it and that makes it all the more appealing . smell is more prevalent the more it warms up .  not like motor oil , more like tobacco water . it 's damn near a hop bomb . very drinkable . i get a real dry finish from porters , maybe it 's relative to the color , but that dryness coupled with the hops makes me want more & more each sip i take .  solid mouthfeel , smooth and dense with animated carbonation .

i still say that there 's nothing like the `` original '' pilsner -- as the marketers would say -- and that is pilsner urquell . sure the hop aroma has faded a bit over the years , but the fluffy head has n't . i know the green is pretty , and i even know that some people ( like an old friend of mine ) like that skunky aroma , but why could n't they at least put some of the beer in brown bottles ?  a : pours just as the name states a golden color with 1 finger width white head and really no lacing down the glass .  interesting effervescent mouthfeel makes it a pleasure to savor .

a sour and somewhat bitter smell to start off , contrary to what others have said . the usual appearance for this style , and the taste improved as it warmed .  brown bottle glassware : shaker pint purchased : single from j. barleycorn , nashville medium brown and mostly clear in appearance , with a tan head of two and a half fingers . there was not much in the way of lacing or carbonation .  really big round full mouthfeel .

the smell is exactly like a cafe mocha -- dark chocolate , buttery , and quality roasted coffee . the taste is very intense on the chocolate but the roasted coffee malts come through nicely too .  pours an orange-caramel color with a pretty large white head .  high level of carbonation with tons of tingle on the tongue . another excellent beer from ommegang .

full and rich , with dried fruits overtaking the nose . lots of vanilla in here , as well as some caramel and licorice . t : quite a lot going on in this brew . nothing too special here . d : so scarily drinkable . at 11.5 % , i feel that i could sip this all night .  '' pours to a slightly hazy dark orange-caramel with a small white head and just ok retention and minimal lacing .  it is exceptionally smooth and drinks perfectly for the style .

frothy near lace remains . the aroma is a vibrant combination of tangerine juice and zest hop nose along with mellow esters of a ripe pear nature . understated light caramel bolsters fruity sweetness . spot on and appetizing aromawise .  poured and hazy copper/orange color with very little head .  m - full thick body , chewy and creamy at times .

s : this beer smells great . a very nice balance of booze with piney/citrusey hops . was slightly underwhelmed by the flavor after experiencing such tantalizing aroma smelling the beer . it is still a hearty and satisfying , flavorful brew .  golden orange body , brilliant in the light . compact , slightly khaki head bubbles out to a collection of foam on the sides of the glass . minimal lacing .  the mouthfeel of this bastard makes the beer for me -- incredibly soft and smooth for strong ale , probably the result of the oaking .

very very subdued floral notes with a metallic tinge .  this beer had a great pumpkin pie smell , one of the better pumpkin beers , not too much spice which tends to happen sometimes like with the pumking from southern tier ( still think its great though ) it has a good pumpkin flavor too .  mouthfeel was full , thick , and creamy with a rich sweetness on the tongue .

it was quite amazing . nice bitter coffee notes , with more chocolate notes and sweet malts than with the aroma . this was smelling great , drinking good and going down easy .  from a growler into a frosty mason-jar mug at purv 's beer and more in peckville , pa lighter in appearance than i had expected . smell was of straight cocoa powder and a little bit of spice from the chili pepper mouthfeel was very nice considering the light color .  first sip reveals a smooth silky textured beer with a fairly thick body and gentle rolling carbonation . there is a sticky sweet residue on my lips after each sip and the boozy warmth lingers as well . the booze factor makes this a sipper and it is a little sweet and boozy to drink a full bomber .

smell : wonderful aromas on this beer .  i made the mistake of pouring this like the helles i just had and did n't empty the bottle in one pour due to the huge cream colored head . the head faded to a thin ring after only a minute or two , which for a weissen is a bit weak . smells great , tastes great , and there are only a few minor flaws keeping this from being an amazing hefeweizen .  mouthfeel is oily with a full body and fine carbonation for a smooth chewy feel . surly always hits this aspect right on the nail and this beer is no exception .

incredibly complex aroma , a deep strong dark with dirt , sour grass , tart apple , a cornucopia of spices . perfect touch of the rustic .  the amazing extras from alewatcher just kept coming and coming . a- not much head , but i wasnt expecting that at all . the beer is a semi murky brownish color .  a great take on belgium ale ; apples , pears , lemons , apricot and orange flavors nustle their way thru a carbonated full bodied swig .

nose is amazing ! huge assertive orange spice . the single most assertive bold orange spice nose i may ever have smelled . beautiful . mouthfeel is rich and lightly creamy with nice carbonation and a nice texture and feel . flavors are just plain weird . there is an herb quality and character to this beer , initially stange and offensive that become very appealing . i suspect that one will love or hate this one ; and , it deserves a taste ; it 's unique .  pours a dark amber with 1/4 '' of bubbly head that quickly fades to nothing .  it is very creamy and very smooth . it 's like chocolate silk . very delicious .

smell : a slightly sour smell that i seem to associate with wheat brews . fairly clen aroma .  a : deep prune-brown , minimal wisp ring , minimal legs , no lacing .  m : the mouthfeel is what really sold me on this beer .

the aroma is soft with sweet corn and pale malts . more sweet corn on the palate , fairly sweet .  a : 'midnight ' dark ( nearly black ) pour , with a slim head . good ringing lace that trails fang-like tendrils of tawny film ... but overall , eh it 's just an average stout , nothing remarkable whatsoever .  mouthfeel - great smoothness , i was inclined to take a deep draw at the outset , very quenching . restrained carbonation adds to the smoothness .

smell : complex nose boasts belgian yeast with a sweet apricot note and some underlying white pepper spice . complexities abound . taste : a well balanced tripel with a nice peppery spice and undistinguishable fruit presence . overall : solid , solid tripel . very fine beer .  a : copper-bronze , off-white head , no retention or lace .  the aroma is bold of chocolate and roasted malts ... the taste is very mild for a stout , blended extremely well between the sweetness and the roastness ... the mouthfeel wins top honors , this is even smoother than samuel smith 's imperial stout , absolutely incredible mouthfeel !

it smells like when i picked hops and stuck my head into a box of them . it smells so fresh it 's wonderful . the taste was rather assertive in hoppiness .  small craft warning is a hazy golden lager with a somewhat diminishing , soft and splotchy , white head .  mouthfeel is just perfect - thick , rich , and creamy , with a slightly oily sheen that coats the mouth and throat .

smell is extremely fruity and surprisingly sour , extremely complex and enjoyable . aromas of apple juice , dark fruits , and a little olive .  presentation dark brown glass 330 ml bottle with freshness date on rear label . a- midnight , dark opaque brown , very slim off-white head which disappeared quickly .  exceptional silky mouthfeel .

the aroma is intoxicating , deep and bold arabica coffee notes upfront that is fruity and intense . high quality cacao , molasses , pepper , cherry wood and a wallop of alcohol ... really outstanding . the flavor is a letdown from the aroma , with a broad sweetness that kind of smothers the coffee and roasted notes , some cherry and plum notes in the background and an alcohol bite finishes things off . an incredible aroma almost makes up for the cloying sweetness .  pours a very effervescent amber with 3+ fingers of rocky tan head . average lacing & head retention s : herbal hops , breadyness , a slight nuttyness .  m : incredibly creamy leaving a nice coating around the mouth that tingles slightly .

the smell is loud with touches of sweetness . dead guy has a unique taste , that is over powering at first .  appearance is a brown to dark copper color with not much head .  super thick dark chocolate flavor , light coffee flavors , good coffee bitterness near the finish super creamy , heavier in body , extremely smooth and hopefully i 've mentioned the creaminess overall , i love this stout , give me more

the smell is also quite pleasant and interesting . apple skins , lemon zest , belgian candi sugar , complex alcohols , malt backing , and dry-ish . it is a terrible combination .  not golden , as it turns out - more of a nectarine skin-amber brown . its parchment head is not very impressive in terms of size or retention , but the nose is lovely : plenty of caramel/toffee malts to anchor more volatile , spicy notes of ginger , lemon , brandy , and a little bit of leafy/piney hops .  mouthfeel is astonishingly smooth and creamy for such a rich , complex ale .

s : smelled like caramel malts , which i appreciated and let me hopefully anticipate the beer .  a - pours a pretty clear color with a fizzy white head that dissipates quickly .  great bubbly mouthfeel , no aftertaste at all .

this has got to be one the best smelling ipa 's out there . the fruity and hoppy flavours balance out perfectly to leave a tasty , dry , almost graperuit-esque finish which is just fantastic . this beer packs a mighty punch .  500 ml bootle from germany pours dark brown with large off-white head that soon dissapears , the small rising carbonation bubbles create kind of prickly surface , no lacing .  wonderful full mouthfeel .

smell is incredible . a big sugar smell is predominant accompanied by nice dark malts . there is a nice thickness to it as well , that makes it incredibly smooth . drinkable beer for a strong abv .  appearance : lightly hazed pale golden straw . very volatile , fleeting white head .  the mouthfeel of this beer is great . they do an excellent job with the carbonation and creating the perfect body for a beer .

a : orange copper color , almost no head s : floral hops , not much else but thats ok with me . i love the way this beer smells ! t : tastes like it smells .  ommegang adoration special winter ale belgian strong dark ale bottle dated 7/18/11 and poured into a tulip on 1/5/12 a . pours a murky deep reddish brown with a 1 inch off white head .  mouthfeel : true german feeling on this beer . medium viscosity , rolls across the palate smoothly and is perfectly carbonated . great overall feel and authenticity .

back to the smell - oak , but the lovely old sort . . .  i drank this from a 375 ml bottle into my rochefort chalice . this ale is a very dark amber , a little lighter in the light . it is brown with highlights of red , reminding me of tea . there is little carbonation as the head is about half a finger but fades way too quickly .  mouthfeel : truly phenomenal creamy medium body with the slightest touch of syrup likeness .

its the unfiltered wheat aspect i suppose , but there seems to be a glowing quality about this golden beer . the aroma , is like the taste , not too strong , but definitely my favorite beer .  1 pint 6 oz bottle eyes : pours a straw to yellow , pretty average looking , not much head , nothing too exciting looking at it nose : grapefruit ginger ale with a citrus twinge more towards the tart variety.. lemon ices hops mmmm almost smells like a sparkling soft drink ... drool ... taste : like a light american pale ale with an exceptional tart finish with a gentle hop bite .  perfectly carbonated with an amazing mouthfeel .

aroma is very very faint . i got picked up by the nice light smokey taste of coffee , roasted malts , dark chocolate , mild spice , and nuttiness .  fresh batch courtesy of viggo . pours a fluffed up retaining head , with lace remaining in glass.. smooth easy creamy drink , creamy and well-malted , well-carbonated .  m : absolutely wonderful ... smooth & creamy .

the aroma is alittle funky , i was not pleased .  a : pours with an average size head that dimishes quickly into a film . the body is a murky medium dark tawny brown , almost completely opaque . streamers line the edge of the glass .  m- medium body and creamy soft carbonation lends to this one being a great sipper . d- pretty smooth but balanced , could have more now and will definitely have again .

absolutely amazing grapefruit , lemon , and orange aroma . also has a touch of sweet toffee and vanilla . this was a beautiful hazy golden pour , with typical cask frothy head . very well balanced flavor , then a wonderful dry bitter finish . this is an amazing brew , and the cask only adds to it .  appearance : a deep brown , with smaller head and lower retention of that head . nothing overly special , though i suppose it 's on the prettier end of things as far as brown ales go .  mouthfeel is full and rich , easy to sip and enjoy . sweetness hinders the drinkability a bit , one bottle at a time is enough for me .

super sweet aroma with lots of yeast an plenty of sweet , dark fruit . some toffee aroma as well . sweet flavor , though there 's a little sharpness there as well that reminds me , again , a little of port .  hazy straw-colored body with a fizzy white head that tails off fairly quickly , leaving little opportunity for much in the way of lacing . a tart burst of citrus- lemon juice and orange zest- greets the nose , backed up with cloves , tangy wheat and tangy yeast .  mouthfeel : has a great mouthfeel . it has exceptional smoothness .

took a trip down to colorado springs last week , mainly to visit this brewery . aromas of passion fruit , grapefruit and tangerine . medium bodied , and not at all bitter , with flavors of oak , booze and sweet malt .  when the poured the translucent reddish brown brew into the glass surprisingly there was n't but a one finger head that nearly disappears . it does lace nicely though .  mouthfeel is medium-thick but amazingly silky . carbonation is moderate .
the smell is hoppy and a little of for some reason .  minimal head with an aggressive pour . minimal to no lacing at all .  m - perfect . exactly how a dipa should be .

the smell came off fruity , flowery , and hoppy . great aromas ! !  it poured a dark brown color with some red .  amazingly full body and mouthfeel for an american wheat , yet is crisp and refreshing at the same time .

for the record , fresh - this might be the mightiest tasting ipa out there . smells like mango , citrus , pine needles , pineapple , melon etc . also has a nice sweet malt aroma in the background . lots of piney resin with a pineapple/mango twang . o : overall , a finely crafted ipa . among my favs all-time and easily my top 3 from out west .  a : brown gold color , head looks like the top of a latt , lacing is pretty good s : fruit , herbs and spices , an overall sweet aroma alcohol notes present t : has a strong sugar caney taste , herbal taste with a grainy flavor .  taste- for a double ipa , this beer is not on a mission to wreck the palate ... with so much flavor i 'm surprised that the malts weigh in so heavily . solid . it 's sudsy ( the name of my beloved late parakeet ) and sublime . drinkability- one real attribute about this bruiser of a beer is that the abv ( 10 % ) is completely hidden ... it 's nowhere in any of the above categories . this is more like a nectar , thick and juicy , garnering respect for each sip .

head is a bright off white , watery and light , not much retention or lacing ... outstanding aroma , very funky floral muskyness , some nice brett ... taste has some nice things going , this is a musky sour brett saison , not sweetness , makes no bones about it . crushable musky saison , well worth trying .  i do n't actually know what it looked like because i had it poured in a cinema that was very dark . no head , though , i know that .  mouthfeel is very soft and full bodied with light carbonation .

s : a very rich banana/clove mix , just about perfect . no hops , no nothing .  a refreshing light-bodied ale that goes down easy a- very clear amber-yellow with thin , big-bubbled head s- smells a bit like honey along with a bottle/metal hint .  m/d : full bodied , very smooth , velvet like .

s : the aroma is fantastic . natural lemon scent and orange zest , mostly lemon .  a : pours a deep , reddish copper with a modest beige head that dissipates in short order . lacing is minimal .  the texture on this is great . with the silky texture and sweetness , this is a good sipper , but nothing you 'd have more than 2 of in a single sitting .

the aroma was spectacular , one of the best i have ever been privy to . though the look could use a touch of tinkering , the amazing aroma and depth of flavors more than made up for it . a unique and enjoyable offering unlike any other saison i 've ever had .  aside from the sediment that slowly floated like stars on a cool new hampshire evening the overall appearance was pretty average , striking shiny copper .  taste & mouthfeel : thick , full-bodied texture goes well with the rich and yet smooth malt flavors .

very sessionable , but only an adequate porter with the exception of the nose which is amazing .  this beer poured a-not-too-shiny copper red with a good amount of head which quickly faded to a thin lace .  while there was no head , the carbonation is just right ; the body is no thinner or heavier than it should be .

an impressive nose . t : mouth puckering bitterness is the first thing i noticed . d , notes : this is very good . the type of beer that bas help move to the best of list .  hmm organic and spelt so this is a no wheat wit . very pale with a light fluffy head and lots of carbonation going on . a touch of lace but not much . notes of lemon and wheat like twang . excellent thirst quencher and it goes down like your favorite cold soda on a 100 degree day .  however , the mouthfeel of this beer is phenomenal , on the tim of your tongue it tingles , in the middle it is smooth as silk , on on the edges it is a touch syrupy ( amazing ) a good beer , but not worth the price they charge for it .

the aroma is off , it made me not want to drink this , but the metallic smell fades away and does not linger from the fresh poured bottle . not as good as their ambree , but quite good none the less .  pouring a copper color into a pint glass , it leaves 1 finger of head that dissipates rather quickly to about nothing , but the ale appears a bit hazy throughout .  unbelievably smooth in mouthfeel - bittersweet chocolate and bitter roasted notes played effortlessly on your tongue .

smell is of bourbon , wood , malt , brown sugar , toffee , and dark fruits . overall , this is a fantastic beer with very complex aromas and flavors . i am really glad i was able to try this one .  pours a very hazy straw color with one finger of tight white head that dissipates slowly .  feel is pretty rich for the style , although it 's medium body it 's almost full really , with such a rich , smooth feel . excellent . honestly , it 's not very typical of the style at all , but i 'm not letting that change my rating .
