aroma is pungent with herbs , mostly sassafras . i really enjoy the aroma of this . simply too sweet , and the herbal essence is too overbearing .  extremely pale straw golden yellow in color and completely clear .  mouthfeel is nice and balanced , although approaching thin at times .

drank it on draft at legacy and at reading country club i have also had three cases of it made for them by the lion in bottles it is smooth favorful light and not biteing , nice head great smell very refreshing to drink it is a amazing product that they have made it is very nice to just sit and drink again and again .  the appearance is pale gold with a slight white hue and a small head that fades fast .  the mouthfeel is medium bodied with a velvety texture , and appropriately low carbonation .

the smell is outstanding - i was salivating from the roasty nutty goodness .  appearance was gold , clear , no head , and fizzy . almost looked like champagne .  hoping it 's one of those better in a bottle beers i 'm returning to give it another try . so far so good . maybe , and i 'm stretching , some neutral hop spice . this beer makes me try too hard . these hops should be hops should be ashamed of themselves . good malt base to support hops , were they present . bottle is equally bland as on tap .

quite a nice aroma . tastes like it smells but with a bit of sweetness . was light and crisp with a slight dryness at the end .  a= golden yellow little head and that 's about it .  it 's fairly pleasant in the mouth . combine the crisp and refreshing mouthfeel with a decent flavour and this beer would be worth getting .

bottle from 99 bottles federal way , wa a : poured a glowing golden orangish color with good carbonationa and a nice white head s : citrus , booze , sweet and perfumey t : heres a story..there i was at the daily pint in sanata monica , ca decide to get a pint of the 2nd anny ipa and upon the first sip i was like whoa..to perfumey , to much booze and sweetness . the mango and tropical fruits were overpowering .  poured almost no head , even though the beer was almost foaming out of the bottle . strange .  mouthfeel : light body , medium carbonation , but the bubbles do n't really `` prickle '' the tongue like i thought it would . a very nice and smooth carbonation .

s : a fruity smell predominates , some citrus notes , but a cherry and raisin aroma is stronger . a mildly piny hop presence is there as well .  very very pale yellow color with little head or lace .  very rich flavor of dark malts and smoke , with hints of coffee and chocolate as well . the finish is almost all smoke , much too intense for my liking . ive used this many times in making caribou pot roasts in the crockpot . they even have a recipe on their website , which is delicious . i was informed that this beer has won more medals at the great american beer festival than any other beer , quite an accomplishment .

aroma of chocolaty mocha and alcohol .  22 oz bomber with bbd of jan 07 , but this brewery is very conservative when it comes to shelf life of their products imo pours black ( purple when held to intense light ) with 1 finger of mocha colored head . zero head retention & or lacing s : some coffee & cocoa notes t : dryness & then chocolate up front .  the mouthfeel of this beer ( outside of taste ) was great . great carbonation , bitter hop aftertaste , medium bodied .

s - the initial smells were malty , yeasty , and complex . i noticed coffee and sweet cake smells in there too . the pleasant malty smells died down after a few min and left the bitter hoppy smell of an ipa t - initial taste was sour and yeasty .  well ... it was purchased as it was the only `` pumpkin '' beer that was available cold at our retailer after experiencing the likes of southern tiers pumpking , this flat out sucked from the minute i poured it , and it looked like a budweiser , i had a gut feeling this was n't gon na be good overall , its drinkable , but there is nothing spectacular about it , its like a budweiser with some pumpkin spices added , very blah , just plain ... .  the body and carbonation levels are appropriate .

s : amazing aroma . very syrupy and sweet smell . lots of brown suger/toffee/caramel notes , some faint char and even some coffee . o : the smell on this beer is phenomenal , but the taste just does n't deliver .  pours a really bright golden straw color , no head at all . it 's super transparent and looks basically like a bud , not very inviting at all .  mouthfeel : crisp and refreshing .

pours and looks like a glass of diet dr. pepper s : caramel , banana , sweet bread dough . t : tastes of wheat and toasted corn .  that too failed to rouse any semblance of head . anyways , it 's a golden colored beer with a flat head and little carbonation bubbles .  orange , darkish color , looks a lot like the two previous hop project beers i had . the flavor also left a lot to be desired . the last hop project beers i had were both quite intriguing and sadly this was just boring as far as the hops were concerned . oh , well , hopefully i get to try more of this crazy series .

a big floral hop aroma -- smells great . taste is bitter hopiness , floral and citrus .  head forms at two fingers , lots of bubbles that fade quickly to a thin foam on the surface . zero lacing whatsoever .  the mouthfeel at the start was mildly crisp and finished dry and smooth . the unbalanced flavors knock down the drinkability for me .

while i am a huge barleywine fan , i just do not like this beer at all . smell is that of apricot an fruit .  the best japanese beer i 've had ... although that does n't say much ... perhaps the really good japanese beers are only available in japan ? appearance : clear/yellow . minimal head smell : just about nothing at all .  the mouthfeel was quite good , though . well carbonated and it felt good going down .

a big sniff presents brown sugar , molasses , a touch of butterscotch , and a tad of bittersweet chocolate .  carling black label 12 oz can recent canning , washed down 10/06 fast pour in my mouth straight out of the can ( save for a 1 oz sample in a shot glass for reviewing ) pours mildly dark yellow with a quickly diminishing fizzy white head .  medium bodied and smooth .

odd sweetness behind the tartness , still had no problem drinking a few glasses of it at la mort subite cafe in brussels though .  acceptable beer but the appearance was way compromised by literally zero head .  ) mouthfeel : in one word , thick .

just from the smell i get smoke , coffee and caramel . the latter , not just hints , but a decent sweetness that 's apparent .  ) a : clear pale yellow body . white foamy head dissipated over a few minutes .  this beer has a high level of carbonation with a very crisp and clean mouthfeel .

the scent is very good ... roast and espresso ... .unfortunately the taste was like coffee ground in water ... .was n't creamy or had body ... which is what i like in my stouts .  yellow-brown beer with a fizzy head that dissolves right away .  m : chewy and viscous . if anything , the aging has tempered some of the trademark trainwreck mouthfeel and flavors of base dark lord , so i 'm impressed .

well , it smells pretty good at least .  this lager poured a weak lackluster yellow-orange in color with a frothy head which quickly reduced to a thin lace covering .  quickly hops dominate and overwhelm with a slightly unpleasant linger . smooth with a light bite . it 's not too bad until the hop bitterness overwhelms and turns this into just another hoppy ipa . all the other flavors disappear without anything to redeem it beside bitterness and a nice feel .

s-very faint . citrusy hops , malt notes , and some sweetness .  a : the beer is a light gold color with a short white head that fades very quickly and leaves very little lace on the glass .  we 're okay though , as next time we get a samuel adams winter sampler pack , i 'll give her my cranberry , and i 'll have her boston lager . it 's not a bad beer , it 's just not to my liking . i ca n't even really say why . a bit sweeter than i 'd like , and just nothing that stands out and says `` i 'm great '' .

s- it had a really nice aroma . it was big in both sweet-bread malt and pine-citrus hop scents .  come and drink this corn syrup ! cuz in denmark we dont like beerz that are tart as a matter of fact we hate traditional wert we skip the ones with any hop heart lets just slam the ones that make us shart !  mouthfeel : medium body , medium carbonation overall : this beer has almost no taste , pity

not much in the way of aroma , except for some caramel from the malts , some metallic hops qualities , and a hint of pine .  a : pours a copper body with a very small off-white head with extremely poor retention and no lacing .  the mouthfeel is decently crisp while not out-of-control with carbonation .

strongly acidic black patent , chhocolate , earthy hops , sweet malts , so good . one sip it is like a good german pilsner , and at another like a robust english porter , and at the next like the doppelsticke it is .  appearance : hefeweizen like appearance . very hazy with floaters at bottom . lacking head size and retention .  m : crisp , clean , would call it refreshing if it tasted better .

huge fruity aroma , kind of a grapefruit/lemon hybrid . extremely bitter , even for a west coast ipa . this makes for a tasty , although not particularly well balanced , ipa .  yellow , little head , no lacing , boring . reviewers of beer are like reviewers of art -- for many , it stops being about what tastes or looks good , and starts being about complexity and distinctiveness . if it was lighter , it might be refreshing , but it is n't light .  the aroma contained notes of malt , hops and a discernable alcohol content of medium strength . it had a stong alcohol flavor that was very over powering the other flavors . it was smooth yet burned as it went down . truely a devilish brew !

this beer looks good , and it smells good too , but in the end beer is not drunk for the way it looks or smells .  appearance : kind of a pale yellow to cold and a little cloudy . thick white cloudlike head made of small bubbles ... some lacing , but poor retention ... just disappears on me smell : banana or wet bread like smell .  the flavor is a bit better as the taste of both a good belgian tripple and a solid ipa can both be percieved ; however , the flavors compete for dominance instead of blending harmoniously . i think the problem here is that tripple is a big , expressinve beer . with exit 4 the subtle flavors are masked behind a second layer of bold expressiveness . i love the brewery for pushing the envelope and i look forward to buying the next release in the series . with innovation like this , flying fish is sure to hit a huge winner sooner than later .

had a very hoppy aroma upon first sniff . second whiff hints at fruity aromas that almost smell like a fruit salad .  presented in a 12oz brown bottle with a best before date of 01-28-04 on the label . poured a clear light gold color with virtually no carbonation and a piteously tiny skim of white bubbles for a head . while sunshine wheat is drinkable ( i didnt dump it ) , it looks more like a pilsener minus the hops profile .  the mouthfeel is slightly creamy and very enjoyable . this drinks nicely . there is a lot going for this though , the mouthfeel in particular .

s : wheat , malt , mainly fruit . generally weak t : first time i had this i was surprised .  it pours a clear , pale yellow , with a below average white head , fades very quickly and leaves a little ring around the top .  it was smooth and had a decent mouthfeel to it , with some nice malt flavor .

i poured this beer into my tubler at 50 degrees . it poured a fair head that oozed coffee and hints of toffee mingling nicely . i was excited . however , the taste was extremely bitter and ruff . to me the beer was an odd mix that could use some refinning , a good begginning but a ruff finish .  at just 7oz , this beer will only fill up your glass about 2/3 full , so feel free to give it a hard pour right down the middle . even with a hard pour this pale yellow beer only made a finger white head that disappeared in about 30 seconds . this beer was skunked beyond belief and i was n't sure i would even be ale to drink it , but after i let it sit and breath a bit , most of the skunkiness wore off and i was able to pick out a sweet grainy corn smell .  mouth feel is completely crisp , refreshing , and clean .

smell leaves scets of caramel and roasted coffee , and a very sweet smelling milk scent . very appetizing .  lightly golden in color with a very thin head that does n't stick around too long . label/artwork looks cheap but has nice pictograms to solve under the caps .  the same color , mouthfeel , and drinkability were there , just the hopiness , aroma , and flavor , as well as most of the bitterness seemed to have blown away .
smell-no real smell , which is good to me .  pours a golden straw color with no head , even after pouring into the middle of the glass .  mouthfeel : lightly carbonated and creamy .

the aroma is powerful with the start anise and burbon really dominating , a hint ot the orange came out , but after tasting , all i could smell was the bourdon and black licorice flavor ( start anise ) . to me the bourbon overpowers the rest of the beer , so if you 're more of a bourbon drinker , this would be right up your alley .  a new beer can in my country , specifically in my city , little better than its other presentation glass bottle , made by miller , a strong american brewer in my country , i think best than a & b in market participation , a 32 oz beer , like `` caguama '' , i drink in a pilsner glass , its taste is like crusehd hops , little of malt liquour reminicense , poor color , pale yellow , poor lacing , good for the mexican food , 70 % recommended .  hard to rate , as i appreciate that it is flavorful , but do n't like said flavors ... medium-light bodied , creamy , and well carbonated .

the smell is quite nice with a mixture of dark fruits as well as fresh grapes . a slight boozy character .  the beer is the typical straw yellow color .  mouthfeel : nicely carbonated and good level of thickness - probably the best part of this beer .

an interesting nose . noble hops if i had to guess .  pours a very pale , clear yellow color with an airy white foam that fades in a matter of seconds to nothingness . even for an aal , this one does not look great .  mouthfeel was nice - weizenbock like . bananas , black beans , chile peppers and/or pepper jack cheese with some creamyness amidst the carbonation . interesting , no doubt , and worth seeking out if you want something really different .

( s ) - a spicy apple & honey with bits of cranberry . ( t ) - very dry with a musky-like honey & cranberry . has a big corn husk background . ( d ) - a basically good beer to have around for the holidays .  not at all terrible , not great , typical mexican macro that actually tasted a bit like fosters if fosters made a lighter version . nice classic beer taste upfront , thins out and fades away with a decent lingering corn and hops aftertaste . the can has a classic look that adds to the appeal .  medium mouthfeel .

the smell just really is n't there , i buried my nose in the foam just to see if i could get anything from it . very nice , citrus with a touch of mint , just enough malty back to keep things pretty well balanced .  review based on notes : pours an effervescent auburn with a pinky of tan head . zero head retention & lacing s : slight toasty malt & nothing else t : slight breadyness , herbal & metallic hops , plus dryness up front .  mouthfeel : medium bodied beer . very short aftertaste with his beer .

rolling the beer around the glass shows off some very nice legs and leaves some really nice lacing . nose - i could smell this beer across the room while setting up the pictures , it is strong . lots of roasted barley notes , alcohol and really dark coffee . very bitter and very aggressive .  the color is moderate golden . something is wrong with the color on this one . no head and no lacing on the glass .  the mouthfeel was good , but the drinkability hass to be chopped down due to the smell and the taste of this beer .

i have never had a pumpkin ale before . it smells of spices ; nutmeg , ginger and clove . it begins deceptively cleanly with a metallic taste before the spices take over with nutmeg to the fore .  clear gold and looks a bit like a bog standard pale larger .  mouthfeel is nice and full and slippery without any carbonation .

snifter s -- very funky smell with apples , pears , oranges , and white grapes creating a nice complexity t -- totally caught me off guard , i may not be ready for this yet .  i poured the beer and it gave me about a one inch head . some what less cloudy than what i enjoy in a weiss beir my expectations were low .  m : super-smooth , eminently drinkable . lighter body , but crisp/clean finishing .

3.5 s : mild smell of malt sweetness . no hops present in the nose . 2.0 . t : hop bitterness can be found on the back end to balance this brew out , but little-to-nothing in terms of floral/citrus hop flavors ... malt sweetness and hop bitterness do strike a nice balance here though .  straw yellow color , little lasting head .  m/d : light and smooth feel on the mouth , drinkable but not something i will ever get again .

appearance : dark brown , not ebony , slight retention , no lacing smell : some roasted and coffee aroma taste : flat , low on taste , just not much there .  this stubby pours a turbid peach tea color with minimal pearl colored head . zero head retention & lacing s : grassyness & citrus , both fade quickly t : grassyness , coriander & tangerine up front .  palate : very enjoyable . great , smooth , and light on the throat . it would be stellar with cheese .

grolsch amber ale pours a reddish brown with an off white head from a clear twelve ounce bottle . there 's a little grainyness in the nose , that 's about it . there is more flavor than i expected , a bit of toasted grain , some caramel malt , just a hint of sweetness . definitely worth a try .  chang pours an light gold .  the mouthfeel is medium and creamy .

smell is honestly terrible . many would describe it as `` dark fruit '' or some other lame 'fruit ' something , but honestly it smells like the residue that stays at the bottom of a plastic trash can after it 's been used for a while .  the pour looks very viscous . it has globs of shit floating around in suspension .  mouthfeel is actually pretty nice , medium body and carbonation with a creamy quality .

syrupy with about 1 finger of dark brown head . s - vanilla cookies , some brown sugar and chocolate , but it 's alright .  a : ugh . thin , sickly yellow with minimal head . d : i could definitely see this beer serving as fodder for beer pong or similar games .  mouthfeel is fine for the style .

s - smells malty with a small sweet scent ... smells like most of flying dog 's beers ... t - very thick and extremely malty m - strong and bitter d - extremely bitter and filling ... .i would probably only be able to drink a couple before feeling full . im not a porter guy and this was my first one so i can really say it does porters justice ... its very bitter and reminds me of a stout being so dark and filling .  a - pours yellow with a one finger off white head that dissipates at a pretty quick pace . no lace to be had here ... s - smells really sweet .  aside from the taste , mouthfeel is actually pleasant on the palate . good medium body and carbonation is about right on the tongue .

notes of sugar and apple dominate the nose . a touch of pear and a hint of caramel .  coppery color , with a pinky 's head that dissolved in 15 seconds and no lacing . disappointing appearance .  mouthfeel is good .

s : the red ale has plenty of caramel to go around , a sweet aroma with plenty of strength . too bad too , because the nose has a really nice aroma .  appearance - yellowish smell - smells like blueberries taste - sweet , too sweet for my tastes . almost has an alka seltzer effect .  the mouthfeel is fine . it is a low/medium bodied beer with good carbonation .

s- malt and hops . i also smell something rotten like compost or a fart ... t- bitter all the way .  a - pours a clear orange color with decent carbonation . the head fizzled out before i could even look at it long enough to see what color it was . obviously no lacing here .  the mouthfeel is surprisingly creamy and not too heavy . the drinkablity is pretty low , not from the booze , but extreme bitterness , which overwhelms the decent , but not exceptional malt .

great natural look but it smells like a sack of government grain that has been rained on for two or three seasons .  pours yellow and very cloudy . one finger head , soapy but dense . poor lacing and a few specs of lace .  feels slick , not very carbonated , and heavy . alcohol warming is powerfully strong . lacks balance and drinkability .

s : bourbon , a little chocolate , coffee , and a little smoke .  lots of foamy white head at first , but it quickly dissipated . the beer itself was extremely light in color , almost transparent .  wine like alcohol warmth , and a vinous texture , i rather like this feel and good carbonation .

smell is minimal ( beer could have been too cold at first ) taste is nice and malty that grows as it gets a bit warmer .  with the 5.9 abv , this is equivalent to putting down around 9-10 macro lights , like coors or bud light .  mouthfeel is medium , well carbed , nice on all fronts but where it needs to be . big failure , in my opinion .

smell : classic tripel aroma , but not strongly pungent . taste : slight alcohol bite in after-taste .  a : solid black , no head , inert , no lacing -- wow it looks dead s : roasted barley with waffs of leather t : burned barley taste detracts from what otherwise would be a simple , pleasant stout ; very lightly hopped , so not complex m : the lack of head and carbonation really detracts from the mouthfeel i 'm a big fan of growler 's -- i 'm prouder of no other ; but this batch did n't turn out well .  m- nice carbonation while retaining a good smoothness .

aroma : a pleasant smell of grapefruit like hops , with some malt coming through .  pours a very light pale amber color , almost watery looking with a tiny white head that dissipates quite quickly without a lace .  the mouth is thick and malty . as far as drinkability , i have to say that i would be really happy to have one of these if i was alive 4000 years ago but for now i 'm going to have to go for something else .

nice aroma , blend between surprising coffee nodes and bread and toffee blend . not huge and not too complex , but nice and balanced .  a - this is too light . it has a big soapy like head that goes away eventually , but yuck .  the carbonation feels pretty crisp .

pleasant smell of green bananas and citrus .  a : pale golden in color . strong pour creates thick head that is gone in a moment to barely a trace of head .  the mouthfeel is good , but obviously does not improve the flavor !

awesome bouquet ; fruitiness and candy malts . even so a pretty good drop .  pours a pale clear yellow . not too far off from natural light in paleness and probably the worst appearance of any wheat i 've had . little head the dissapates quickly and does n't lace at all .  mouthfeel is crisp and a little sizzly . refreshingly light bodied and clean .
smells rich and butterscotchy .  very little head that diminishes right away , and little carbonation . seems thin and lifeless for a hefe .  a little sticky and a very bitter aftertaste .

it had surprisingly little smell , which belied the very tarty flavour.the tartness was very nicely balance at the end with a citrus fruitiness which made the taste and refreshing .  a - poured out a straw yellow color with a bubbly , white , two-finger head .  light and creamy mouth feel with obviously knocked down carbonation .

s : a nice aroma of fruit , yeast , and malt . t : tasted of apples and yeast up front , with a malty finish .  semi-cloudy caramel , forming a small white head with no retention or lacing .  ) and is a deep rich molasses s : once again , may have been too cold for phenols to waft up t : slightly sweet really tasty m : nice and cold d : pour me another

huge chocolate in there . big sweet chocolate , dominates with malt and a little bit of roasted grain in the background . t : lots of booze at first , followed by a slight tart flavor , and it ends with roasty goodness . d : nice but the bit of tartness in the flavor really takes away from this .  it was a light , translucent yellow in the glass with a filmy head . a thick lace would form as i sipped , but it would quickly slide back down into the beer . but it was not as wheaty as a hefeweizen .  the mouthfeel is the pinnacle of this brew . full-bodied with a dry crisp feel .

it smelled like very strong dried apricot hops , sweet caramel malt , melted butter , and a hint of oak and alcohol . it was fairly complex , but was still clean .  a : pours brown , with no head and no lacing . looks like it might be flat .  m : thick , chewy..medium carb .

overall : nice smell , average taste but the rest is forgettable .  i bought this can at a nepali night shop . when poured only a small white head develops . the colour is golden pale . i emptied it & # 8230 ; not because it was good , but because you don & # 8217 ; t waste beer .  mouthfeel is fine and not heavy .

smell-a nice nutty and sweet aroma . nice hints of roasted malts and caramel .  kuhnhenn 's winter wonder lager ( 2008 ) pours up like a flat soda pop w/o much luster , but it manages to release enough carbonation to create a wisper thin beigeish-white head that barely manages to ring the glass above a rather dull , murky brown-burnt umber body . it 's rather an ugly mess to be brutally honest !  mouthfeel : good .

the smell was pretty good . i was intrigued actually .  maybe the factory put the wrong label on the bottles and the bottles in the wrong box .  pours a cloudy , almost 'chunky ' looking way -- looks a bit similar to an apple cider ( non alcoholic kind ) . caramelly sweet too . vanilla . taste is what kind of throws me - again , both the oak ( taste of whisky barrel ) and smokiness are there . i like both of those favors in my beers , but combined , my jury is still out : like they are competing for my affection . alcohol is quite present too , which seems to go well with the aforementioned whisky oak . a lot going on in this brew .

s : molasses , toffee , caramel , chocolate .  pale fizzy watery yellow ! ! ! first thing i smell two feet off is an oniony skunk ... do n't you love sub tropical island that could care less if your beer has sat out in the sun for years ... . mouthfeel lets be honest its just good to have a brew in my mouth , its cold and almost harsh bite to it the carbonation is that of warm soda but quickly smooths out .  m - crisp and refreshing o - overall pretty meh .

smell : really malty . caramel and peanut butter aroma . smells like it would be a really good winter warmer , but it 's not the aroma i expect from an american pale ale .  this brew poured up a straight yellow color ... the aroma was sour !  m - pretty good .

aroma : a lot of oak . toasted coconut and marshmallow flavors . brown sugar and caramel . very cloying .  i drank one beer as is and one with an orange wedge , the orange wedge improved the taste of the beer , but the review ( to be fair ) is of the beer alone like all my others . appearance - a bubbly , fizzy , and murky off-amber color that looks orange . on all of the pours only one had a head that was a thin collar that vanished shortly later . no lacing left at the end . this beer is highly carbonated but not as bad as some other macros or a soda . it leaves a metallic aftertaste that fades away to the usual macro lemon-rind .  mouth is medium bodied , but with some good tingly action on the back of the tongue , so also good .

s : strong notes of malt and caramel , sugary smell .  the beer is a nearly gold color with plenty of carbonation and a 2 finger pure white quickly dissipating head ( almost cola like head - lasted all of 10 seconds ) .  m : lovely long bitter aftertaste .

but since it 's summertime , i 've been drinking more beer and have been quite impressed with the quality of crafty beers out there ( if only i did n't live on the upper east side of nyc , where you do n't get much of a beer selection at the supermarkets and delis ) . i was not a big fan of this beer - i enjoy ipa 's , but this one seemed all hops and nothing else .  appearance - 2.0 poured a small white head that quickly disappeared leaving no head at all . colour is pale straw , large bubbles rising .  m- pretty good body , minimal carbonation but works for the beer .

the description had me sold on this particular brew . i had spent the week camping in new york and in stowe- so drinking this seemed fitting . i felt like i had the remains of a campfire in my mouth . this brew is not for everyone , but i think it is worth trying .  pours a cloudy and murky light urine color with a slight head that dies quick and doesnt lace .  mouth feel is more medium bodied than the wheats i 'm used to , a nice change and the full blast carbonation leaves one a happy advocate overall it is lacking smell , good in flavor , great in feel .

col.or was a lemony , sunshine-yellow with ne-quality clarity . nose had a solid lager sweetness , none of that adjunct b. s. mouthfeel was full with a lot of carbonation scrubbing away all of the b. s. on my tongue as i swirled it around .  poured into a pint glass it looks about the same as coors light , except slightly cloudy ( and i mean ever so slightly ) . the head is almost non-existant and fades leaving zero lacing in my glass .  medium mouthfeel .

smells great , but kind of disjointed on the taste and mouthfeel .  undated bottle , but these just arrived on the shelf at a street wines , so it shouldnt be too old . head is small , rapidly fizzling to a ring of bubbles , beer is copper to very light auburn-amber and though the bottle has no sediment left in it whatsoever , the beer does have a decent chill haze . no lacing on the glass , head is off-white .  m : medium bodied with a medium carbonation .

even before the glass got in front of me the green apple aroma hit me in the face . it dominates right from the start and influences everything else . a medium body is again dominated by the tart green apple with a tang from the carbonation .  pours a very pale , straw-like color . yeah , it 's drinkable as most macros are , but there are many macros that can suit this purpose at a lower price .  carbonation done very well .

smell- it does smell very good . i will give it that much . loads of dark and milk chocolate . one of the more chocolate scents i have set my nose upon in a beer .  very watered down in taste and mouthfeel . very easy to drink a lot of it and get smashed , but very hard to sit and drink one or two and enjoy it .  carbonation was crisp for a medium body .

glassware : celebrator doppelbock pokel ... appearance : tawny , pilsner body with busy effervesence unfortunately props a head that is thin and inconsistent ... aroma : light flowery accents with an undercurrent of sweet maltiness -- fresh and balanced ... palate : crisp , clean lager -- medium-bodied and easy drinking with mild bubble to retard to sipping ... taste : subtle hops ping with a mellow malt profile -- a light aftertaste makes this a pleasant drink from start to finish ... overall : a fitting piece in this year 's summer sampler ... light yet flavorful enough to deserve a second thought , and good enough to be consumed with our without a hot dog ...  poors a rusty orange , completely transparent and devoid of yeast , with absolutely no head .  i have the mom version the head was initially strong , though sudsy and it fell quickly . carbonation is plentiful from the surface of the brew come hop aromas -- minty and herbal -- and coriander . it does n't smell as though an authentic yeast was used , which fits my preconceived notions for rogue 's methods the flavor confirms my american yeast suspicions . light fruity flavors , strong hop contributions , though little spice .

i do n't believe that i 've been unduly influenced by the cranberry and white label or the color of the beer , but i smell dark berries .  there 's no head ... a belgian with no head ... not good for starters . the taste is so compromised by the lack of carbonation , head , and mid section that this beer just falls down in all the wrong places . it was n't until i read some reviews that i discovered that the beer i poured was n't flat after all .  mouthfeel is light body , medium carbonation . fairly nice .

a : pours dark brown with purple hue , has a cloudy appearance ... similar to dark chocolate milk . s : nose features rich roasted malta along with candied red grapes .  a - pours a very pale golden colour , finger f head with no retention or lacing .  there 's big citrus/grapefruit hops , but then a nasty onion/vegetable taste . mouthfeel is fine .

i had not heard of this kristalweizen style before , so i thought i was reviewing a straight wheat , but here goes . aroma is really hefty considering the low abv and general weakness of the flavor . there 's a great bit of bready yeast and a big malted wheat aroma . exactly what you would expect .  very light pale yellow , almost `` white '' with small fine head .  mouth is no complaints , it 's low-medium body with relatively high carbonation .

the nose had a decent malt front line backed by strong fresh hops , a little citrusy , more piney .  light gold color with a bubbly head that dissolves right away .  the mouthfeel is good - smooth with a right amount of carbonation .

smell is nothing to write home about . a big household mould aroma , like clothes left in a wet , warm pile in a basement somewhere .  served in a nonic pint glass , the beer pours a hazy gold color with about a 1/4 inch white head that went away pretty quickly . no lacing whatsoever .  mouthfeel : medium-plus body . medium carbonation . some oily viscosity to the mouthfeel .

super cru appears like it should , starting out with a leather-mahogany color , frothy head . does n't smell too bad either ; nice belgian yeasty notes and the added pear .  bbd of 11/30/07 pours an effervescent bronze with 2 fingers of white head . zero lacing or head retention s : bananas of course & yeasty esters t : banana & some herbal hops up front .  m- mouthfeel is nice . medium body with a good amount of carbonation .
nose is caramel , yeast , oatmeal , and a touch of smoke and spice . decent but not much like a chocolate stout .  very clear and light straw colored .  the mouth is smooth and light .
smell is sweet with cherries and a little smoke , maybe some maple .  a : kinda weak head .  m - nice light feel with a crisp finish , accentuated with a alcohol warmth .

smells surprisingly thick : notes of chocolate on apricot and hops .  this is a soda with a touch of alcohol . the aroma is a little funky and a lot sweet with just lime and a hint of corn . the appearance yellow with a thin fizzy head .  m - tongue ripping bitterness . medium to full body and tingly carbonation to go with it . good .

the aroma is very neutral - wheaty with a tiny bit of hoppy spiciness . it is deep but not complex .  with fairly aggressive pouring i got a small to medium sized off white head that quickly faded to almost nil and no lace .  mouthfeel -pretty good . foamy , not spritzy . nice and full , for a lager .

there is no aroma at all , just like water .  pours a crystal clear medium gold with a one finger head that faded quickly leaving no lace .  m : creamy to a crisp finish with a good carbonation throughout .

s : ton of grapefruit , citrus , lemon , pine in the background , smells sweet t : there 's something that just tastes off and soapy . there 's almost a cloying sweetness that adds to the off-taste .  straw yellow appearance with very little head .  m : dark beers always feel good in the mouth . this one isnt super smooth , but the feel is good .

dusky crimson-glinting brown adorned with a fat gob of buttercreme suds . rum-steeped fruit nose , a la fruit punch with cherries , pineapples , and apples , then backed with a stanch vanillin oak character . begins with a tepid fruitiness . again with the cherries , pineapple , and apples . yeast come in and sprinkles slate and sandalwood earthiness . it leaves a semi-acrid and astringent burnt coconut essense mixed with a tannic and lingering sense of black cherry skins as it rides out forcefully vinous . light bodied , but it feels fatter with some element of clinginess . the barrel-aging really just ruins this .  appearence ... slight haze ( no big deal ) but the color is way off . looks like an amber .  m : a nice , medium body .
smell - decent traditional ipa smell , with some funk our sourness .  pours a light yellow with minimal head and lacing .  m : lots of carbonation , but a pretty smooth medium body nonetheless .

as with most pumpkin beers , this smells just great - cinnamon , nutmeg , spices . beer seemed more like a fruit beer with a pumpkin aroma . it was not unpleasant , just unexpected . a refreshing finish .  looks like white grape juice . i hate it when no head is erected .  2.5 t & m : mouthfeel is fairly viscous and silky .

highly aromatic nose of fruity , herbal resiny hops .  a : one finger head devoid of cream , of bad thickness , and average retention . cloudy lemon-yellow colour .  the mouthfeel was sticky and thick . there was tight and crisp carbonation that was nice .

s : a pleasant aroma of sweet candy sugar , soft raspberries , and maybe a bit of honey . very straight forward . t : first sip : i thought this is sorta nice .  app : pours a pale gold color with a brief white head and high carbonation . it 's similar to a macro lager in appearance .  m : silky smooth feel . i like the finish . smoothed out my palate .

aroma is quite subdued . subtle citrus and toasted malt about sums it up . taste follows suit , but offers a bit more .  it is easy to drink , and is somewhat smooth . once the beer is poured into a glass , the thin white head fizzles out leaving an almost stale taste . maybe a hint of cooked vegetables .  - well carbonated , dries the mouth a bit . nice smooth body , probably this beers highlight is the mouthfeel .

the drink was described as light and long with a sweet taste that stays in your mouth but no `` haze '' more like the reminder of something like perfume sprayed in the air .  pours a very light and clear stale orange color with lots of carbonation and no head .  good medium body with great carbonation .

a very sweet and fruity smell . sweet malts with apple and pear highlights . not very subtle but quite fine .  a - classic green bottle . pours a dark gold with a fizzy soda-like head that goes away quickly .  m : a bit chewy for me albeit nicely carbonated .

a very good roast aroma greets the nose , strong , solid and full the roastiness is outstanding .  zero head . o : the lack of head and almost non-existent carbonation seems off .  m : fizzy carbonation that smooths out a little into the sip and works well with the body of the beer .

clear bottle poured into a chalice ... a : decent head , minimal lacing atop a clear reddish brown body s : biscuit malt , nuttiness , vinous notes t : found the beer dominated by the vinous with a light bitter bite and a satisfying residual sweetness .  a- clear very pale yellow .  pretty slick mouthfeel .

it 's quite clear and straw/amber colored . it has a very strong smell of fresh hops . pine , citrus , and maybe a bit of tropical fruit , but quite spicy . the smell is the only part of this beer to reflect it 's ipa label .  bottle poured a brownish brew with almost no head .  m : fuller side of medium-bodied with moderate carbonation that tickles the tongue and throat . this aspect of the beer is really nice .

consumed at kalamazoo beer exchange . s : predominantly yeasty with some spiciness . bits of citrus and earthy tones t : i thought it was a bit too sweet for a saison .  i 'm of the age where it 's a rather popular drink , it seems to be the philly hipster beer of choice , in my short life on living in the city i 've watched in double in price and have remained baffled . pbr does n't taste awful , atleast as long as i 'm not paying 6 dollars for 22oz of it at a bar . the main flavour i 've noticed in pbr is water , thats always the first thing that hits my pallet , water , then some slight grain flavor that mixes with the alchohal . the appeal to pbr is that it is n't the university beer bong beer , so cheers to you pbr for being the beer of an overpaying counter culture .  thick body is very good . it 's just passable for now .

all of the pleasant aromas of the nose have vanished leaving some nasty diacetyl and way too much breadiness .  poured out a darker yellow with maybe a half pinky head that dissapeared immediately .  m- good carbonation and substantial body , not bad here .

pale , cloudy body with little white head that fades quickly s. a cirtusy lemon , banana scent . nice t. sharp zesty taste , leaving a weird lemon aftertaste .  the opaque black body is entirely headless , laceless and lackluster with a distressing lack of carbonation .  it has a very soft mouthfeel , a little like soda to be honest and you can barely notice the alcohol .

aromas of sweet caramel , brown sugar , clove and other spices . nice , very sweet malt up front , caramel with some chocolate in the middle . looks , smells and starts out good but the finish ruins the drinkability in this one , not balanced at all .  appearance- deep french onion soup color , maybe a weak cherry cough syrup color . pours completely flat . really quite lifeless .  mouthfeel : nicely carbonated , and nice and creamy . feels good on the tongue .
smells sweet , boozy , a little malt but a lot of sugars . smells like a great dessert drink .  pours yellow , clear , small white head .  m - medium bodied with some soft carbonation .

color is a brilliant ruby/amber with minimal haziness , smells of honeyed ginger and spice exactly as promised on the label , flavors of gingerbread and spiced christmas cookies come through cleanly just as promised by the nose , fresh , sharp , and clean flavors overall that really make me feel like the holidays ... if only there was carbonation , it could have been something stellar .  a- hazey pale orange . if i ignored the small foamy cap i 'd swear it was some sort of orange soda made with juice . i would n't buy a 6-pack , and if i had a choice of this macro and blue moon i 'd choose blue moon .  good carbonation .

smelled pretty good , hops & grain filled the nose immediately . after sitting for a moment , the smell faded slightly , but still nice . tasted some hops , but not nearly as dominant as i prefer .  poured a typical macro pee-yellow .  mouthfeel : light-bodied but not watery . it had a nice feel to it .

the smell is of a very cheap light beer : some slight fruitiness , but the dominating feature is the musty/soapy smell which strikes me as somewhat dirty .  pale straw colouring , head subsided almost immediately and made the beer appear quite flat once it had .  mouthfeel is medium bodied with moderate carbonation .

this is skunky . it smells like beer pong beer . not a fan .  bought at/price : woodman 's / $ 8.79 6pack dennis : last year we reviewed the 2004 version of the special brew from anchor . the body is flat and almost carbonation-less . the taste is just a bit of spices with a bitter twinge , and almost no follow-through . over all it reminds me of coke that somebody shook up and made flat .  feel is pretty smooth , nothing weird here .

very pleasant . t : this is too light for the style .  i see this currently ranks 202 out of 205 for the style ... no way this is that bad ... there are many macros worse ... with that said , i am not a big a-b fan ( used to work for a miller distributor ) ..this is at least as good as bud and cheaper ... it pours a light straw color ... .about a 1 inch head settles to virtunally nothing ... .no lacing evident ... .nose is cooked corn and cereal grains ... body is on the lighter side of medium but defnitely not watery or thin like some ... .slick ... not real charged up ... flavor is basically adjuncty sweet cereal grains and corn meal ... .relatively sweet for the style ... .no hop bite at all ... .  m : dry and crisp but smooth as butter .

been a while since i 've had a stout . burnt roasty smell with coffee , cocoa , and cream ... a smokey , woody , hot cocoa almost .  pours a brown + red beer with minimal viscosity and head to it . carbonation appeared to be lacking at this point .  m- decent carbonation , light and airy .

my allergy-addled nose gets very nice dark fruit , cherries , and brown sugar .  almost no head , a tiny rim of almost non-existant film . not very impressed .  but it does n't make me puke ( and it tastes better than bmc by a sconch ) mouthfeel is nice . kinda creamy mixed with crisp .

the best thing about this beer is the aroma imo . awesome , very awesome . beer is thin and falls flat on the flavors at first . its a good beer , just not my favorite .  pours golden yellow with one finger white head when poured aggressively that subsides to none almost instantly .  m : very fizzy , light on body , about right for the style .

nose is slightly spicy with hints of witbier style coriander seed , matched with a sticky-sweet hint of dark toffee and brown sugar . it 's actually rather pleasant all up , and certainly gives a deeper note than expected from the lightness in the body and the colour .  a : pours a one finger head of slight cream , decent thickness , and downright bad retention .  fine mouthfeel , nothing objectionable , but it 's not a stand-out lager either .

ahhh , nice smoke on the nose ! i love smoke beers and i was really hoping this would have some campfire nose and it does .  serving : bottle appearance : very dissappointing for a witbier . instead of a wheat coloring , it almost looked like a pale .  mouthfeel - good smoothness , a medium body on par with the style , crisply carbonated .

flowery aroma , malty & hoppy but very flowery .  dogfish head is really pushing it these days . they seem to be doing the avery thing ... trying to make one beer in every concievable style that will make people say , '' you ca n't even taste the alcohol ! it gets me drunk and it tastes like fruit ! what the hell ? it pours out the color of a cran-apple fruitopia . smells like berris and cheap nikolai vodka out of a plastic bottle . drinkable , sure , if you just want tog et drunk , but this is nothing special , and it is way overpriced .  m : creamy mouthfeel with prickly carbonation .

good head retention & above average lacing s resiny pine & breadyness , honey malt & a little grapefruit as this warms t : piney hops & big time woody hop bitterness , bordering on astringent up front , plus some toffee notes hiding on the edges .  a - pours just the lightest clear gold with a thin white head that dissipates quickly , leaving nothing but a steady stream of carbonation bubbles . a bit better then your average adjunct , but an adjunct nonetheless .  m : tingly carbonation , medium body and refreshing enough .

the smell was firm and earthy ; wet straw , burnt malt and tomato paste fragrances mingled together .  random buy ... a : very light in color with no head . not impressed with the look of this .  feel medium body , pleasant texture , some drying and bitterness in the finish .

smell is overwhemingly of peaches , maybe a hint of dragon fruit , very sweet .  2.0 a : pale greenish yellow color . head is not dense at all , fizzy , and has horrible retention .  smooth in the mouth with nice , crisp carbonation . nice feel , but flavor is not there .
strong sweet , vinous malty scent .  very light yellow with no head to speak of- apple juice .  m : creamy and sticks to the mouth for awhile .

smells is practically non-existent , but as it warms i pick up a very herbal hop aroma that reminds me of straight hop pellets .  as far as light beers go , you ca n't really go wrong with this one . very tiny head , and resembles your typical pale lager in almost every way .  smooth and refreshing , light to medium bodied with a slight tingling on the tongue .

it was nice . taste was primarily strong rich malt .  only a tiny bit of apple juice yellow color . corn and rice but slightly malty m - it 's surprisingly viscous for this type of cheap canned adjunct .  mouthfeel- medium mouthfeel ( for the style ) . carbonation level was perfect for bringing out the bittering hops .

the smell is strong of both a carmel brandy and a little alcohol is evident . the alcohol that was apparent in the scent is not in the mouthfeel , which is very nice .  pours a medium off colored copper , with very thin head and lacing . very low carbonation level .  m/d : a medium body with good carbonation .

smell is one of the best ever , strong flowery , grassy smell . slight grainy smell also . you know what is about to happen .  a - light yellow straw color .  mouthfeel is medium-light bodied , a nice creaminess to the carbonation .

very sweet aroma of floral hops and sweet honey . a little caramel malt but no notice of the bourbon in the aroma , even though the bottle says it is aged in bourbon barrels . yuck . i hope fans of extremely sweet beers will like this . my expectation of american strong ales falls along the lines of stone arrogant bastard .  this beer was watery and did not have much taste to it in my opinion . the hue of this beer was yellow .  but , also an odd smell kind of like salami . this must be some nasty phenol created by the yeast . a bad yeast flavor here and a lot of it . i usually love unibroue brews for that complex yeasty quality but for some reason this one tastes a little off . that lunchmeat aroma and now this bad oily yeasty taste make this beer almost undrinkable . i doubt it considering it 's called edition 2004 , we 're in 2005 , and it 's 10.5 abv .

the aroma is of cocoa nibs , with the piquant woody vanilla nose that nibs have , followed by slightly sour milk and more milk and a whiff of alcohol when swirled . taste is a recap of the aroma . chocolate nibs , kiwi fruit , milk , mild herbal bitterness , medium bodied , with chalky mineral adjuncts and a sour aftertaste .  this was a golden yellow , and my bottle looked different than the label on the site here . very thin head , even tried to pour a little harder at the end to see what would happen ... nada .  m & d : the texture is soothingly carbonated , quite good for a fruit beer , while the body is consistently light against the richly sweet flavour . the downside of using lichee for brewing is that an aftertaste can turn quite `` simplistically acidic '' , but this beer shows a decent balance in the end . compared with the other lichee beer produced by another taiwanese micro-brewery ( takau ) , this one comes a bit too rich in sweet lichee-juice at the expense of more complexity , yet the overall mouthfeel and a clean aftertaste makes up for it .

the aroma was sweet almost grapelike .  on tap brigantine seafood restaurant poway , ca pale straw yellow with a pitiful white head that dissipates almost immediately .  very syrupy and flavors linger on the palate . very unique . strongest beer had to date .

nice pils maltiness on the nose spattered with floral and spicy hop notes .  pours orange with a finger of tan head . zero head retention & lacing s : breadyness & not much else t : herbal & metallic hops , grainyness & some caramel up front .  velvety . good amount of carbonation .

sour fruit to the nose .  12oz bottle appearance - the beer pours a clear yellow colour with an average size fizzy white coloured head . the head was gone in a flash .  mouthfeel is good , soft and tingly .

love the idea of a beer from utah being called polygamy anything , although i 'm not sure how the people who run that state would feel . anyway , at first glance this is a beautiful dark red porter in the glass with a nice chocolate milk head that did dissapate a little quick . the taste of chocolate malt is very mild , if fact you have to wait 5-6 seconds after you swallow to really taste anything . i could drink this porter but for a purist , this would not hold up . a nice try , and not a bad brew , but not worth any extra effort either .  was n't impressed by this lager , pours a golden yellow with no head to speak of , only a dissapointing fizzle .  m - good carbonation and it finishes clean . good light to medium mouthfeel .

aromas of roast , chocolate , and some dark fruits .  soft white to off white head begins at two and three quarters inches falling to one quarter of an inch within five minutes leaving no lace on the glass . hazy dirty gold in color . large quantity of sediment entered glass despite careful pouring efforts .  mouthfeel is light with a good spike of carbonation .

s : smells like raspberries and cinnamon ( do n't think i 've ever smelled cinnamon that strong before in a beer ) .  pours a cranberry juice red with zero head .  mouthfeel : medium-bodied . fair carbonation .

in the flavor : oodles of grapefruit and lime , fresh grass , a bit of dank weed , some sweet honey and black pepper . good hop profile ; great for a pale ale . i would n't say this winter offering from ska has flavors that really gel with the season , but it is a nice little pale .  it was the lightest colored beer i have ever seen with an average head and lace .  first off , i can tell that this one is slightly skunked , but i ca n't really blame the brewer for this one as i am also able to pull out some nice mellow caramel malts and a touch of biscuity-bready goodness as well . nice mellow malts , not too sweet , but the hops come through for a bit too much bite from what i look for and love about english pales . the hops come on a little too strong and linger too long , not really allowing me the chance to savour the mellow malts as much as i would like . there is a slight sweetness about it that reminds me of fresh apples although not the biting green apple off taste . this is different , and nice , but not my first choice for an english pale .

smells awesome ; there 's an herbal hoppiness with orange/tangerine notes , some slight pine , and lots of biscuit/nutty malt with an undertone of sweet caramel . it finishes with a clean bitterness and biscuity malt .  a : pretty bottle , but it 's uh-oh on the pour : uninspiring pale gold color of some unloveable lagers and ( within a few seconds ) no head to speak of .  mouthfeel is this beers strongest point as it is so watery it does n't feel harsh or overly alcoholic .

smell : cherries , wonderful fruity cherries . finishes clean but with a lingering bitterness that i find unappealing in wits .  for a white ale , this is pretty translucent . not terribly impressed -- looks somewhat like a cloudy average big brew ale .  m - pretty thick , smooth and a bit refreshing .

nice and clear amber-orange color with plenty of sticky head . smells of maple , bread , grassy hops , and a bit of apple .  pours into a pint glass a very , very pale yellow with just a little bit of foam .  m- really good carbonation , low abv and the nearly great sweet/tart balance make it actually react quite nicely with the mouth .

very ripe strawberries and a bit of peach . not complaining , though ... one of the best aromas i 've ever encountered .  reviewed 3/5/2009 ( bottle ) : pours a small whitish colored head , very quickly diminishing .  medium mouthfeel .

s : the smell is very balanced and i am loving it . mild fruity esters mix with sweet bourbon , vanilla , and coconut to form what is probably the best smelling beer ( non-ipa ) i 've had before . d : fantastic barrel aged barleywine . great job mayflower .  a-poured yellow with mild cloudiness and a thick head that quickly faded . carbonation was strong initially , but also slackened off rapidly . no lacing . this is my go-to cheap stuff .  meidum bodied and relatively smooth .
smell : very sweet smell . very malty .  there is absolutely no head or lacing . it looked flat .  m : light-bodied , crisp , very clean , refreshing .

nice nose ! great complexity .  miller lite reminds me of taking a can of milwaukee 's best and taking the harshness out of it . miller lite is greater than beast in the same way that bud light is greater than busch light or natty light . i would much rather drink miller lite over beast or anything close to the price of beast any day of the damn week . basically when it comes down to it , yes , it may have a bit more flavor than bud light , but the flavor is a faint hint of beast .  m : very viscous , pretty smooth .

no aroma worth noting .  i 'll tell ya in college , if your drinking bud light that is a good night . it looks like your typical goldish yellow and smells like . . . well like bud light , im sure if your reading this you have had it so there isnt much to compare it to .  mouthfeel good . creamy and subtle carbonation . cant complain about this .

s : super sweet chocolate is the main thing that i get at first . the beer is sitting a foot away from me and all i can smell is cocoa puffs .  appearance : golden yellow color . very thin layer of foam upon pouring , disappeared in a few seconds . no lacing .  medium bodied and decent carbonation .

the nose is straight up cherry . almost too much cherry .  it appears clear , and with a fairly pathetic looking tan color head , that is very thin , and settles to a patchy looking film . not an enticing looking brew ... s- this area is better , with aromas of sweet caramel , coffee bean , and dark chocolate dominating the smell .  strong carbonation . m. very bitter and the carbonation is clean and tart .

smells fantastic ! fruity , citrus , & some serious hops . one of the better smelling beers i 've had .  this beer being a macro lager , still is a very good beer , is nothing to be impress about , this beer have a light gold color with a little bit of head.very easy to drink , not a hard taste or a hard feeling on the mouth .  feel is good - light , crisp , medium bodied .

the aroma is lightly fruity and deeply roasty with some mild bittersweet chocolate , some soft dry tobacco , and stale wet coffee grounds .  light amber pour . forced a short-lived head out of it .  m : creamy and nice . decent carbonation keeps it from sticking to you .
simple but pleasant .  the beer poured a very pale yellow with a small white head .  good mouthfeel , crisp , medium body , good carbonation which is refreshing for a warm weather beer .

not too much of a complicated smell here . taste - sweet with hints of coriander , cornbread , maybe some lemon zest.. has other spices i ca n't really point out .  i wouldnt perfer drinking this stuff everynight , but about once or twice in a month for that cinamon tastes . .. id have to say stick with the punkin ' ale from dogfish-head .  low carbonation and good mouthfeel .

i was expecting this ... s- very oaky smelling with a copious amount of bourbon presence t- bourbon is overwhelming vs the sweet malts of the flat beer .  had bottle of this which revealed a light gold-yellow color . disappointing overall for a brewery with so much god damned hype around it . a very forgettable beer unfortunately .  aroma : hops . the crystal hops dominate the aroma . the malt is there , but overpowered by hops . but i do n't taste the balance that an esb should have . the hops weigh far more than the malt in this beer . notes : this tasted like a very good ipa , but did not have the balance i was expecting , for an esb . a great beer , but did n't fit the style as well as i would have liked .

4.5 s : bourbon and maple come through most prominently . oak and vanilla next . as i sort of expected , most of the wheat gets lost in the previously mentioned powers . i say the bourbon level is just right . 3.0 t : again , maple and bourbon dominate only this time it may be too forceful .  the next cheap beer available this last week at the beach . looks like honey-water . no head at all .  starts off clean and finishes with metallic hops m : silky smooth , good carbonation d : why ?

smells of wheat , banana ( among other fruity aromas ) , cloves and other pepper-like spices . appearance and aroma were right on for the style but the taste was lacking a bit .  pours amber without any head .  m - good mouthfeel . a little heavier thanks to the lack of filtration .

smell : very faint toasted malt , and only that on a really deep inhale . ummm ... sorry .  the color of this beer is murky , hazy dark yellow , but there is a tinge of orange too . the foam was much less than expected with only a few wisps of foam which settles to virtually nothing .  light to medium bodied , with a very smooth mouthfeel .

s- interesting mix of sourness and sweetness . picking up the barnyard , lemon sourness , with a bit of apple skins and oak . decent , but the sweetness was a bit out of a place .  bottle into a pint glass ... yellow color , not much head , nothing to get excited about at all . definitely a step up from the pitchers of bud light the table had ordered before . so ... in summary , a step up from the big american macros , but nothing worth seeking out .  mouthfeel is medium bodied and crisp . good carbonation , but the overall trainwreck of flavor in the brew makes this one hard to take down .

( s ) - smells seriously fruity ! raspberry , strawberry , cherry , and blueberrry . ( t ) - the massive fruits from the smell become really subdued in the taste . ( m ) - kinda lackluster in all categories besides smell .  one in the sixer looking pretty but surrounded , like bellvue ! not a very full for a beer of this kind , but a good gateway drug ... but , it actually kinda nice , has just this little something to it .. pendulum 's blood sugar drops ! ... . no real foam , strange .. '' who pumped ethyl '' ... needs more to be a great one..  m - light-medium body with plenty of carbonation .

assertive citrus aroma features plenty of orange , backed by pine .  bought as a single bottle at the grocery store . poured very pale , white grape juice look . very few bubbles and a fast dying lace . i feel its limited in how much of it you can drink and when .  mouthfeel is as good as you would expect with an aerator . all in all , you can drink it for the mouthfeel but do n't drink it for the taste .

very nice . taste : mmm .. chocolate and coffee with quite a few roasted flavors .  a : the pour is about what you 'd expect from a beer like this : light yellow in color with a fluffy white head that dies quickly .  mouthfeel is good - medium-bodied , good carbonation , smooth .

a hint of cinnamon mixes in there that is a bit unique fir the style t - taste is banana with a hint of bubblegum ; bit of malty sweetness dominates the flavor with a hint of oak of the end ; bit sweet for my taste and much sweeter than the noise led on to mf - bit thick with a hint of syrup ; light carbonation on the back end that attempts to break down some of the sweet , stickiness of the beer but fails d - happy this was a one off since that is about the only time i would drink it .  a - a dark brown color , it looks like a flat coke . pours with a little tan head , absolutely no lacing .  m- very little carbonation . very full syrupy body .

i like this nose quite a bit . t - no where near as tasty as it smells . this looks really nice and smells good too , but it falls short once you get the stuff into your mouth .  light yellow and some greyishness to its appearance . booze in aroma . pino 's bottle.not up to the style of even a light lager .  long , earthy , dry finish . interesting , somewhat unusual brew .

falls surprisingly fast for a hefe and does not leave a whole lot of lace behind . overripe bananas , cloves and bubblegum galore ! there is some nice wheat tang to offset some of the sweeter , fruity yeast esters .  2002 this is one ugly beer . its a decent color , dark red brownish hue , but so freakin ' murky and flat . it looks like it could be the dregs from my garbage disposal .  mouthfeel is nice , good carbonation , but seriously , ca n't get over that ham finish .

smells like brown sugar and caramel with a hint of wood . definitely underwhelming considering how malty the nose smelled . medium mouthfeel with a very fine but thick carbonation .  had one the other night , but this actually tastes better on a fresh set of taste buds imo ... pours an effervescent ebony with a finger+ of brown/chestnut colored head . zero head retention & lacing s : chocolate , coffee & iron t : coffee , dark chocolate , & iron up front .  m : mouth feel is pretty good .

light aromas of oak barrel , sweet malts , raisons , and a tad bitter sweet chocolate . i 've been enjoying the stout and ruby port mix , a.k.a velvet pussy , for some time now and imo a quality 12oz stout with a 1/2oz pour of quality port works better than ohanlons concoction .  this beer fizzes and smells like cider . the head is quickly gone . floaty bits are moving about in hazy orange coloured beer .  mouthfeel is smooth , for sure , with mellowed out carbonation and a surprising absence of slickness , considering the alcohol .

no pop whatsoever upon pulling the sad cork out . it 's very bourbony with traces of molasses , maple , vanilla extract , and sharp alcohol . there is no way in hell i could drink a bottle of this flat , boozy , utter mess of a beer .  a hard pour produced nothing ! very interesting color .  nice carbonation and creamy mouthful .

s : most noticablly wheat with additions of banana , grapes , rose and coriander . t : really tart , sour brew .  from a 12oz can , this pours a very light golden color , plenty of active carbonation , and a quickly dissipating head .  mouthfeel is about right for style , perhaps a touch undercarbed , but all else is acceptable , though it showcases a flavor profile best left behind the curtain .

very little head to speak of , thin collar of dense white bubbles s : deep notes of dark chocolate , carob , molasses , and a hint of coffee . the flavors are very mellow but well integrated . t : the taste does n't translate into being as good as the smell suggested , the smooth chocolate is there , but turns into a slightly sharp flavor by mid palate and has a slightly metallic finish .  hazy dirty looking copper tone . overall , kind of a dirty looking beer . not good for a pilsner .  m - a fairly heavy mouthfeel with all the sweetness .
rich and clean mexican beer smell . beautiful red orange appearance it went downhill with the taste .  all in all disappointing looking .  creamy mouthfeel with the addition of oatmeal in the mix .

smell is milk chocolate sweet and it also has traces of black fruit .  sitting at a grass and bamboo bar in honduras , one is told to reach for another brand of drink . this beer blends well with the salty brine that has infiltrated your mouth and sinuses . the rejuvenating characteristics of a cold port royal feel great to a body that has been pickling in the briny deep all day .  it 's very creamy and goes down easy . i 'm really disappointed with this .

everything from the nose is lost to sweetness , very disappointing .  natural light is what it is a cheep beer thatu can get the job done , and even though it isnt the most tasty on this earth i wanted say . quit hattting on the beer and buy something different if its not your style , if your looking for something with a less water taste and better head try some pabst or hamms is its right around the same price .  m : medium-high carbonation fits the style nicely .

deep brown color ... .i really like the nose ... .definite cocoa and a slight hit of cherries ... the nose is top notch but it goes down the tubes from there ... a tart/sour flavor overwhelmes this..perhaps it 's the cherries ... a soft chocloate flavor is a slightly noticable underlying flavor ... .  this is typical beer of a brazilian macro brewery . a pale industrial lager as many other brazilian competitors , with a little more bitterness .  syrupu sweetness , not cloying , with hop dryness in the blend . this is what imperial pilsner is supposed to be ? what happened to the pilsner part ?

a complex , sweet smell with notes of chocolate , honey , bananas and a slight spicy note hiding beneath .  a : super white nose and a bland yellow body s : a weak rice or corn aroma .  the tastes match the smell for sure , but this thing is way too sweet , it tastes like a thick maple soda . extremely malty , alcohol definitely makes itself known .

the smell is of dark fruits . plums , grapes , raisins , and cherries . i tried a `` lift your kilt scottish ale '' from cottonwood at the brewgrass festival and was wondering if this is the same thing .  pours an insanely pale color , it looks like watered down lemonade , not even sure if i have seen a beer with this little color before , has no head either , pretty boring overall .  light-medium caramel malt sweetness up front , continued in the middle with a hint of earthy hop bitterness , finishing with a more of the same . medium mouthfeel .

s - toasted leather , dark malts , smoked peat , sorghum , liquid smoke , iron minerals , strange herb perfume aroma , hickory wood chips . t - watered down liquid smoke , roasted malts , toasted sugars , unknown fruit character barely sneaks out among the savory smoked meat flavor .  very , very pale , nice carbonation , small stream of carbonation . seems to have used maize for clarification purposes . little bit of yeast sediment floating around the bottom .  as i drink more my palate adjusts but it does n't ever really get over the off flavors m - pretty thick , not too carbonated , nice mouth coating qualities d - burnt coffee does not go down very well , plust the thickness of the beer limits my ability to quaff this completely i like coffee , i like stouts , and i like a lot of coffee stouts ( new glarus and founders breakfast stout for instance ) .

strong coffee aroma has me salivating , it is mixed with a lighter chocolate aroma , this beer smells rich with hints of bourbony alcohol . the taste is where i was thrown , there is an extremely lemony tartness in the flavor which may be fine in another style , but not what i was expecting here , especially after the inviting aromas . i 'm not sure if the tartness is a result of roasting the malts and the tangy acidity that follows or something else , but it masked most of the flavors and was very prevalent .  a - pours pink with half an inch of white foam and soda-like carbonation . looks an awful lot like some kind of fanta .  mouthfeel is medium , clean with a bitter hop aftertaste .
smell : there was no smell to mention .  very little head and no lacing to speak of . not a great looking beer , frankly .  good carbonation .

nose is dark malt with some nice subtle estery notes of banana , raisin and pear .  this unusually plain pale ale is a pee yellow , and has an aroma of musty basement inhabited by a cat . it is a little less than ideal for a standard american pale ale , but will certainly do in a pinch when decent beer is needed for mindless television watching .  it has good texture .

skunk on the nose , unavoidable skunk due to the bottle color . once it dies down it is a very malty smell , i would have like more hops .  a : the beer is clear pale yellow in color and has no visible signs of carbonation .  the aftertaste lingers nicely , and the mouthfeel is firm . full bodied and smooth , but lacking an extra punch .

smell - pumpkin with some nutmeg maybe a bit of brown sugar and cinnamon . overall - i just wish that this beer tasted more like it smells but that might just be me being a fan of spicy beers .  it appearance is awfully light in color to have blueberry flavors .  m - medium bodied with good carbonation .

smell : nutty , with some hints of espresso and whiskey .  went in to check out the pub exclusives and fill a growler or two . the beer was a very pale , watery yellow with a small white head that dissipated quickly . very clear , almost as a few drops of yellow food coloring had been added to a glass of water .  the feel of this beer is it 's crutch very creamy and boisterous keeps me tasting over and over .

almost no aroma at all which i thought was unusual for a dipa . no hop smell whatsoever .  pours a clear , unassuming yellow , with a minimal , filmy white head , and an exceptionally light body . fine carbonation and decent lacing , but it 's hard to ignore the fact that this looks like a big pile of nothingor at least , it looks like any other pale american adjunct lager .  ) the body is a hefty medium , bordering on the truly heavy , with a light moderate carbonation and a fairly chewy feel . harsh .

s : the smell is quite amazing and complex in my opinion . there are some light hops initially noticed . overall , it is very pleasant . t : after the very satisfying smell , the taste was sort of a let down .  no head , no matter what i do , i see bubbles but no head forms .  really nice body all around ... overall - i would really enjoy this beer if it were n't for the bubblegum flavor , it 's really off putting and not very pleasant .

aromas are surprisingly floral , nectar-like , and a bit perfumy from the boquet of aromatic hops . these compliment the softer pilsner malt aromas and mask the grainy-sharp sensation in the nose that usually accompany pilsner grains .  pours out coppery , with no head to speak of . their are a few bubbles , but no real foam .  m : solid mouthfeel , carbonation is pretty much spot on .

aromatics are subtle with chamomile and not overly done with honey or citrus . pale biscuit male gives off a subtle sweetness there 's an air of the honey and citrus but the chamomile hits an herbal and marshmallow like tone .  pours as a cloudy orangeish color . resembles frankiszer but has some sediment floating around in it - probably just active yeast culture . definitely wonky - has a smell like that of wheat beer but it is n't a wheat beer . has kind of a coriander-orange peel aroma with a touch of wheat ( appears and smells like a blue moon but with a lot more color ) .  light body with good carbonation .

sweet , dark fruit aroma . very sweet , fruity taste .  appearance : this brew is classified and a standard american adjunct beer , and thas is exactly how is should be classified .  still for such a big beer it had a great body , just not sure if i would want more , until it got about 5 years on it .
smell is nice wheat , spice , sweet malt .  pours a pale golden color with a head that is almsot mroe remniscent of pop than of beer .  mouthfeel - it does have a pleasant rich/buttery mouthfeel .

s : earthy hops , lots of caramel , toffee , and vanilla . smell was nice , taste was pretty comforting , but i still think an oak aged ipa is weird .  a : a light amber color with no head and lots of soda-like carbonation .  mouthfeel is thick and smooth , no watery sensation at all .

nose is pleasant , full of citrus and wheat , and an undefined spiciness .  a : hazy yellow with no head . looks like a cross between a witbier and a bud light .  the body is nice and thick , with a flavorful malt profile : sweet medium caramel malts with a bit of roast character . hops , by the way , are almost nonexistent , which would n't be bad if not for the oxidation , which makes the faint floral flavor seem dull . overall not bad , but has the same type of oxidized or maybe just oversparged flavor common to other corporate breweries like gordon-biersch .

the smell is about half and half lager flavor does no tliv eup to the malt smell at all .  has a very pale yellow color with a 1/2 inch head .  the mouthfeel is it 's only saving grace . it 's a light bodied beer and is very drinkable , although i know this will be my last one .

if you can get past the social stigma of walking into the only brewpub for 50 miles around , swaggering up to the bar and ordering a pint of golden wuss , you just might enjoy this brassy crossover beer . you might also need to get over the infected aroma , which was troublesome though its brush against the taste was not overly corrupting . its modesty is its virtue and in a region where monstrous combines harvest thousands of acres of grass this time of year , it makes for a very decent lawnmower beer .  the appearance of this brew is not the best . no head ... zero .  nice lively mouthfeel .

nose brings toffee , yeast , cherries , dried apricots , chocolate , coffee ice cream , and spices . very complex and wonderous . palate gives us sour cherries , yeast , sweetened iced tea , hints of caramel and toast , and some overall tartness . the mouth has some good , sharp peaks midpalate and the finish is a slow , deliberate fade . a very smooth and clean finish overall .  i drink miller light because it 's lower in carbs and calories then other beers yet still has a good beer taste without a bad `` light beer '' aftertaste . it might not be a premium beer for special occasions but it 's a great everyday-beer for the everyday drinker .  medium body , good crispness .

really big malty aroma . in the back some faint fruits can be noticed such as grape . this is very malty with a decent amount of metalic bitterness at the end .  has a very pale yellow color with a 1/2 inch head .  mouthfeel : light in body . very crisp throughout . clean aftertaste .

aroma is quite citrusy with plenty of zesty grapefruit and a hint of pine . it also has a tiny bit of tropical character and some sweet non-descript malt . this beer smells very nice and has a nice hop flavor , but it seems a bit out of whack . much better than the dreadful ipa my friend ordered , but overall a pretty forgettable beer .  appearance is of multi vitamin piss light lacing that quickly disapears .  mouthfeel : light bodied beer . moderate carbonation .

intense aroma of pumpkin , vanilla , brown sugar , and pie crust . sweet and malty , bursting with pumpkin flavour as well as vanilla , cookie dough , and an earthy bitterness in the finish . i like pumpkin beer , but only in small doses . considering this is like pumpkin beer on steroids , this was shockingly easy to drink . i was worried i would fatigue on it part way through , but there was no such problem .  this beer pours a real pale straw color , i 've had urinations after chugging lots of water that have been darker than this .  m : full body with mild carbonation ; slightly clinging .

awesomely complex . taste : chocolate , chocolate malt , coffee , chocolate syrup .  a : pours a clear weak yellow with a thin white head which does not last long at all .  golden in color , slight haze ( nothing wrong with that ) , definite aromas of honey sweetness . lingering sweetness in the palate with a slight funk . interesting beer and something that one might only need to consume once .
