has an interesting unique look , very cloudy with a hint of ruby color , alot like cranberry juice ( duh ) smell is good , has a classic belgian wit aroma , spicy yeast dominates taste is ok , easy to drink , but the fruit really ruins the beer in imo just an unnecessary addition  now i am stuck with with the remaining 5 bottles with no one to try and pawn them off on . this beer was a terrible dissapointment and had really no pumpkin flavor at all to it . it had quite a bit of cinnamon to it but no pumpkin flavors .  m : good thickness and carbonation .

clean nose , just some light pale malt aromas .  poured into a .2l stange , this brew is a clear gold with a negligible white head . no retention or lacing .  low carbination , medium body . smooth on the palate , the beer says nothing , if it does not say sour cherries .

black raspberry desert chocolate . slightly smokey and tart in the back . vanilla , fudge , and chocolate . d : described as an `` experimental '' beer , this one is definitely unique . worth a try as i 've never experienced a prominent chocolate raspberry taste in my imperial stouts before and i think i like it !  high clarity gold , very few bubbles and absolutely no head . there was a carpet of little co2 bubbles stuck to the bottom , but the beer itself felt flat .  good body and mouthfeel .

nose : notes of coffee , chocolate and wood . roasted malt smells come through strongly . taste : tastes of roasted and chocolate malt , coffee and tangy flavors come through as well .  not attractive head , with big bubbles and falling . not compact .  body is pleasantly creamy , almost akin to that of an esb or pub ale .

not a big fan of this one , but it 's drinkable . i expect more of a fruit profile if the fruit is in the name . sweet and low bitterness , perhaps a bit too sweet .  a : very pale , light watered-down yellow .  m : perfectly fine . quite smooth , medium/full-bodied with a hint of ethanol .

s : aromas of piney hops , almost like an ipa .  this beer is pretty drinkable , but that is all it has going for it . '' it is completely underwhelming , with no nice finish and a boring appearance . i was excited when i bought this because of all i have heard about it , but i was just disappointed upon drinking it .  nice crisp carbonation to keep it refreshing .

it smells fruity and hoppy , but the flavor seemed to be actually sweet with a tad bit of hops .  poured a very light gold colour that was extremely transparent . it looks thin , if that 's possible .  m = moderately carbonated . good .

s : not a ton of aroma . some citrus and maybe grassy notes . there 's a big metallic aroma , too .  light clear yellow color . small white head , not lasting .  pretty much just a tingly water . very smooth and somewhat refreshing beer .

d_what started out nice , look and smell wise devolved into an utter mess .  the weakest 'imperial ' anything ___ a : deep , dingy clear ruby body with essentially no head .  the mouthfeel is full and nicely carbonated yet still somewhat creamy .

s- awesome char smell with chocolate and roasted coffee , and supported by a rich dark fruit sweetness . hoppy bitterness is a fantastic undertone . m- nice smooth mouthfeel .  the pour is cloudy with a quickly disappearing white head . the color is not a pretty orange , with a lot of haze .  appropriately light in body without being too thin .

yep , it 's a black beer . it started well with a nice head and aroma . sweet fruit and coffee flavors , not too heavy .  pours a hazy brown/black with a very quickly disappearing head .  m - nice average mouthfeel .

the aroma is what one might expect from a northwest ipa . it has plenty of citrus hop character and only a rumor of malt .  had a bomber of this with my indian dinner tonight pours golden/straw with 1 '' of white head . zero lacing or head retention s : sweet malt & perfumy hops t : sweet malt & hint of herbal hops up front .  mouthfeel is spot on for the style , light and crisp and a bit dry .
3.5 s : nose is n't bad . subtle , but pleasant pine hoppiness .  a : opaque faded-straw colored body with a thin white head with little lacing .  i liked the mouthfeel , smooth and gentle .

s-chocolate milk mix , rich , earthy cigar tobacco , nutty malts .  clear yellow color , brighter even than many other light beers .  smooth with a creamy but dry finish . i walked away thinking that the `` smoked vanilla , coffee , and birch '' was meant to be flavor descriptors rather than actual ingrediants . all of these elemtns were way too weak to be appreciated for what other beers can do with them . call it a single , nix the mention of the adjuncts , and this beer would be alright .

s - very strong aromas of tangerine , it smells like i just peeled the skin off of a fresh piece of fruit . d - this is a very strange beer with some over the top tangerine character . it really smells like a piece of fruit , which works well in the aroma but not so much flavor wise .  the head is fizzy and light and dissapears quickly . the chunks of yeast floating around in my glass are off-putting .  m- medium body , pretty solid mouthfeel , nothing special but solid .

smell - sweet cherry with a sour breath to it , almost like a flemish red . sour , most definitely sour , with a fruity aroma to it ; most likely banana . very pungent , while not bad , not very saison like .  a - bottle says `` pirate 's gold '' , has a yellow label . if you hold it up to the light and squint real hard i guess you can maybe see a yellow tinge at the edges . between this and amstel ?  m - good mouthfeel , and strong carbonation d - an okay beer , but a bit disapointing .

sherry-like oxidation is unfortunately , very profound in the aroma . nuts and ripe fruits are present in the aroma as well , with hints of peanut brittle , caramel corn and mocha . the mouth experience is quite tame , considering the style . unfortunate oxidation initially on the palate , while on the mid-palate ripe fruity esters and mocha hints are present , which leads into a caramel , port-like finish .  the wife wanted to try a fun fruit beer , my choices were limited , so i grabbed a sixer of this ... neat 12 ounce bottle with silly dog cartoon thingy on the label . let 's see how `` wild '' this blueberry beer is ... a : poured in traditional pint glass at 40 degrees . holy fruit beer , batman , this one 's a clear , purplish red with a light purple fizzy head that fades quickly leaving no lacing and a small purple/off-white collar .  the palates leads with a thick , malty mouthfeel up front and a sticky , resiny bitterness in the back .

nose is fairly strong . taste/mouthfeel- medium mouthfeel , a rush of spice and banana wheat that tastes a little muddled and unfocused , alcohol and nut flavors on the way down , finish is surprisingly clean and watery . overall-flawed , but passable .  a-cloudy yellow/golden color body with a thin head.no lacing and this looks like cloudy piss .  m- the body is full . the carbonation is at a nice subdued level .

poured 22 ounce bottle in a wine glass a : clear ; loose white head of foam thats laces the glass on the way down s : sweetness , pine hops t : tastes like dirt , piny earthy hops take over , i do n't know the age of this beer the code on the neck is 2684311 m : standard d : passed this beer up many of times i have had quite a few of lagunitas beers and have not been impressed by many .  appearance : orange-amber color , clear . little to no head , no lacing .  m & d : very good , sits well and fairly easy to drink once you get the first one down

smell : what smell ? i do n't find anything here that would suggest an american ipa . i pick up a bit of a malt aroma , something like a english pale ale .  a - a pale gold color with a very small head that dissipates quickly and leaves no lacing .  the mouthfeel is medium bodied , with a soft prickly creaminess , along with some easy slickness in the body that helps that raw feeling finish go down . just a smidge of alcohol is felt but it is n't overly noticeable .

the smell is floral hopps , with a nice malt note . just awful , really .  pours a soapy head that goes down very fast . no lacing on glass , a bit over carbonated .  - 3.0/5.0 feel - coats the mouth well , with a bit of pepperly aftertaste .

smell- roasty and malty with much hop presence . hops are pretty strong , but not overpowering .  a : pours a mahogany color , very very flat . absolutely no head , no lacing .  soft prickly carbonation does cleans the pallet , of this light to medium body beer with moderate astringency and warming alcohol .
nose shows loads of treacle fudge and brown sugar with cloves showing in the background .  pours pale golden yellow with no head .  nice mouthfeel for a pale ale .
the smell of it was great . the taste was not as impressive , but i did enjoy the chewyness .  a- super pale straw .  pleasantly carbonated on the palate , with a dry finish .

s - citrusy hops with a mix of dark malts including hints of vanilla and caramel . even lighter hint of booze lies in the background .  kind of a cloudy greyish color . not very appealing to the eyes .  crisp , clean mouthfeel with flavors of dry , pale malt . at first , i found myself wanting more flavor , a la boston lager , but the mouthfeel and resulting drinkability really brought things back up for me in the end .

the aroma was nonexistant . i was at a cajun restaurant so the smoke from the bar and the spices from the kitchen may have wiped out what little aroma there was in the beer .  it poured a murky , yellow-white color . very hard to describe . it also was corn .  taste : muddled and uninspired mouthfeel : absolutely thin and lacking in every way imaginable .

s : cocoa at first , some coffee , diarrhea ( off putting to say the least ) , chalk dust .  my bus driver purchased this for me from a 7-11 outside of cancun ... appears a transparent light gold with a small white head that quickly fades out . tiny remnants of lacing are left .  mouthfeel is disappointing ; thin and watery , with too much carbonation for my taste .

smells of citrus..and formaldahyde .  i despise this brew for brainwashing my fellow americans into thinking that this sort of thing is beer . i can only thank this beer for making me truly appreciate brews of substance and character .  the body was disappointingly thin for such a big beer , allowing the unwelcome alcohol notes to really come through .

o : well , this one was all over the place ; the smell reminded of euro pale lager , the taste was more like german pilsener but way to mild .  poured a smallish head with no retention . color was a pale yet golden sunshine color . the lacing was defiently subpar with any average wheat beer .  it seemed to have very high carbonation .

there lacked a adequate smell here . there was a malty smell , but very slight .  black color turning to a yellow gold around the top . once again it looks very thin and watery . low marks are in order here .  mouthfeel - watery .

it smells nothing special really , typically acoholic smell really , a bit like whiskey .  seems like this cheap import is on sale every week at winn-dixie . this pours a light , watery yellow with a medium-sized , but thin head .  md - thin and not much of a body to it .

the aroma is mostly alcohol , along with a bit of pale malt and a lot of grain . it has a serious adjunct aroma ... corn , and a little hops . the flavor is n't as bad as the aroma projects .  not much to say about appearance- straw yellow , highly carbonated , foamy head .  mouthfeel is entirely too thin and watery .

maybe some crappy veggie dogs in there too . t : toasted malt and a hint of toffee sweetness . o : this was truly terrible .  a mighty weighty appearance , yet the quarter-inch initial head recedes to nothing after a minute . absolutely zero lacing or residual head , save for the thinnest of rims .  not much to say about natural ice other than that it is cheap . little taste that i could discern , but nothing abhorrent at that . maybe some sweetness , a bit more complex than some of its stablemates . of course , it is highly drinkable , which is the point . pressed for cash and desirous of a little buzz ? you could definitely do worse .

aromas of pine , citrus , floral , and just all around nice and hoppy . tastes a little bit of a let down compared to that nice aroma .  almost looks green in its pint glass on my computer desk . fairly aggressive pour that would have 99 % of all other hefes spilling over the sides of the glass , leaves me with only a mediocre head . body is lemon yellow when held to a lamp , and in lieu of the usual cloudiness , this is clear with 1000 's of individually recognisable particulates floating around .  thin to medium bodied with very little carbonation .

the nose is off . some citrus and a tone of off phenolic aromas . there is just a off yeast note that is not good .  poured chilled in ale glass a : no head ; cloudy pale yellow ; ok carb action s : very strong sweet aroma , reminiscent of pears ; suggests a belgian-style beer is ahead t : starts off as a sweet , belgian-inspired farmhouse ale , and segues after a few seconds into a diet-sprite-like wheat ale .  2/5 m : thin and watery with medium carbonation .

there seems to be no aromatic hops whatsoever , leaving the smell very dull .  the color is incredibly pale , and the head dies fast - leaving only a little bit of lacing .  m. thin with no carbonation at all . d. i thought the flavors were interesting , but this beer was much too thin and flat for my taste .

carbonation is hard to gague , and the nose is just a bit of light barley malt . the flavor is better than the nose lets on- a bit of sweetish molasses up front with a ghost of hop in the finish .  comes out of the tap a clear pale yellow with a typical white head - not inspiring .  very pale straw yellow color , hazy but filtered look no aroma noted water like very light bodied taste and looks like water ... . however better than most would give credit to seeing how its bud .
faint soy sauce .  has a very pale yellow color with a 1/2 inch head .  m : medium bodied beer but it is a bit light on carbonation . feels dull and flat .
smells mostly of citrusy and a tiny bit of floral hops .  miserably thin trace of head .  feel is thin , dribbly and loose .
smell is sweet with a strong alcohol odor amd some hints of wood .  has a very pale yellow color with a 1/2 inch head .  the mouthfeel is very thin .

aroma is kind of grainy with a light malt aroma , taste has some malt , kind of true t style , mouthfeel is fine .  pours and awkward pinkish red with a little bit of fizz that i cant even call a head . no lacing .  mouthfeel is watery and boring , with a decent carbonation level but not much else to write home about .

very lovely appearance . aroma : roasted malt , oak , dark chocolate , molasses , hints of brown sugar and coffee .  pours with a white head and no lace .  the mouthfeel is one of worst i 've ever had with a saison .

a : usually drink it in the can , so the view never changes s : it smells like many american macros , maybe a bit better , but that 's not saying much t : defnately not much going on , but overall smooth , well carbonated m : carbonation , foam , and a little flavor , nothing special d : you can easily knock a few of these back and not notice it overall : as i 'm apt to tell my more snobby beer friends , it won a blue ribbon in the past ( most recently 2006 ) , so something must be good about it .  within the rank of the cheap beers in my country it is good , but nothing has to do with the presentation that cerveceria cuauhtemoc vendia for 20 years , has not been leaving much undertow its appearance is clear , smell acceptable , taste awful , drinkability good .  tragically the mouthfeel is watery and the carbonation ( which others had noted ) , distracts from the overall experience .

not much sweetness . some grassiness in there or maybe a barnyard smell . t - way different than the smell . other than that this was a basic , satisfying porter .  a : darker in appearance than a bud light , slightly brighter than a bud heavy . easy drinker and goes well with a margarita mixture floating on the top of it aka : iceberg i would have to say on tap it tasted very similar only there was more head .  it was flat on the tongue and mouthfeel was very weak .

a : pours a hazy red , minimal head retention s : nose features acetone , paint , flashes of rye here and there , lots of herbal qualities t : taste features rye with hints at spiciness , the rye malt brings out a bitterness that does n't seem to be contributed from hops mf : high carbonation , medium body o : well this brew certainly features plenty of rye , but the supporting cast does not elevate the rye in any way .  very little head , but highly carbonated and almost appears to be a pepsi , only a bit darker . it 's okay only if you really do n't like darker beers but want to look `` trendy '' and drink a dark beer with sweet flavor and little else to offend , this may be worth a try .  i am dissapionted in the carbination as it is nearly flat with a medium/light feel .

it smelled like a can of gasoline left out to near its flash point . fusel alcohol to the max !  this beer looks flat and unappealing to me .  appearance : dark amber color with a nice 1/2 '' off white head ... unfortunately this reminded me of a pop on the pour smell : pine , hops , citrus taste : kinda watery , slight citrus ( maybe cascade hops ) mouthfeel : thin drinkability : could do two in a night , but i 'd rather drink something that tastes better

nothing of note on the nose , maybe a bit of burnt caramel or it could have been the glass , it was weak either way . unremarkable overall but nothing offensive by any means .  no head . no lace .  far too thin and light for a bock . carbonation was assertive , but the body just felt thin and watery .

smells like a weird kahlua , cocoa dominates with a smack of alcohol -- coffee-like but missing something . hard to tell for certain what 's going on here , but ... the cocoa is present , incredibly cloying sweetness , tart almost .  no carbonation or head .  mouthfeel - one of the most water beers i 've had .

so with that in mind ... the taste was small and the aroma was microscopic . this one smelled of beer , and i am talking tat white beer can with black letters that was so wonderfully used in the film repo man .  crisp , clean flavor , faintly reminiscent of the grain and hops we know and love . no head retention .  thin and tingly mouthfeel .

smell the skunk rolled from the bottle before the t in the pssst from the cap popping was completely finished . the grain is putrid , but masked by the incredibly sharp skunk .  appearance : pours a light-golden yellow hue , with a half-finger head that quickly dissipates into nothingness . not impressed . while this beer pours out looking horrible , and smelling average , the taste and overall refreshment factor makes it a very nice beer .  although the mouthfeel is thin for a stout , the flavor is pretty good .

the head falls to an island of loose bubbles , a ring , and dusting that leaves spots of lacing.. mind blowing aroma . orange , mango , papaya , grapefruit , pineapple ... candied hops ! sweet and floral , it tickles my nose and begs to be tasted . i taste tropical fruits , with lots of green and white pepper , it is earthy and reminds me of kind-buds .  very weak yellow color.. bordering on clear/yellow , with a head that adjusts well to pour speed , stays very white and leaves a cute belgian to look at .  biggest disappointment was the mouthfeel which lacked any crispness/carbonation at all ; practically flat and way too light .

nose is non existent . really nothing there at all .  `` traditional pale ale '' turned into a mediocre canadian lager courtesy of sleemans . appearance - bubbly pale yellow appearance .  it seemed really thin & watery , not offering up much complexity as i swished it about .

almost smells like a tire .  clear yellow with a mediocre white head . no retention , no lace .  mouthfeel : this beer is almost watery yet with a hint to tannins that leave my mouth dry and scratchy . the beer had a watery texture in my mouth and the flavors were not in balance with the nose . while it did have a light mouthfeel and i am used to drinking hoppy dry beers , this beer would have had an easy drinkabilty yet with its unbalanced flavors i had very little desire to do so .

the aroma , however , was weak and suggested skunky cardboard to me . not inviting .  bud light is my favorite beer to start when starting a session . the color is light and relatively generic .  the mouthfeel was flat and very dissapointing .

aroma is screaming butterscotch candy in my face . taste is not quite as bad as i thought it might be based on the aroma . this stuff is just way too sweet and butterscotchy .  pours out of the green bottle an extremely pale straw , lighter than most pale lagers .  the mouthfeel lacks more . and flat .

smell - figured there would be a fairly interesting smell from the beets . was surprised to smell very little and perhaps had a hit of soapiness .  appearance : the beer is a super hazy copper color with a head that dissipated insanely fast .  above average taste for an adunct lager , but not great by any measure . this is definately better than budweiser , coors or miller , but not exactly to die for . foster 's price point is right about miller/bud level , but always slightly higher . it 's worth the extra coins if you 're on a budget . much more enjoyable than the run-of-the-mill macros .

very unimpressive indeed .  a - does n't look very good . completely clear , extremely light body with a finger or two of poofy white head , basically no lace . looks like a bmc adjunct lager , honestly .  flavor : then , i drank some & everything went downhill . it was watery & disappointing .

the smell issue and alcohol after taste put it off my future list .  very pale yellow colour with surprisingly thick head .  palate is watery with that adjuncty grain flavor , but not too offensive . easy drinking .

it had almost no aroma at all though , which was a bit disappointing . the flavor had very light malt aroma with no hop aroma with a bit of lemon in the background .  appearance would be enhanced with labels staying on bottle , but pale clear color ok.. still high on carbonation .  m : this feels fairly thin ; the flavors fall quickly off the tongue , resulting in a watery finish .
nothing exceptional here .  a painfully flat and lackluster appearance .  the body was very thin and the beer lacked substance .

s- the aroma is pretty typical for a red ale . not a lot going on in the aroma . t- the taste like the aroma starts out with some malt and caramel flavors with a mild hop bitterness in the finish . decent , but nothing special .  pours light gold with a bit of a white head that almost immediately descends to nothing .  m : very thin and watery .

with disturbing the yeast , looked just like every other white ale , cloudy with yeasty swirls , nice bleach white head that dissipates quickly ... smell : smell was actually worse than expected . had a very mild skunky aroma .  pours a crystal clear pale yellow . fluffy head fades fast ; no lace sticks . looks like a pilsner .  coppery colored amber with a sudsy froth top that subsides to a foam slick , no lacing , body is very thin and under-carbonated . perhaps as an effect of my bottle not being quite as fresh as it ought to be , i am detecting absolutely none of the fruity notes commonly perceived by other ba members ... .and this really hurts my overall impression quite a bit .

thanks to nate for bringing this , bottle into a bells tulip ... pours an ugly light brown , muddled , with no carbonation at all ... the aroma is awesome , lots of vanilla , really nice wood notes , a little bourbon , caramel , and a touch of hops ... as great as the aroma is the tasting is as outstandingly awful .  it 's appearance is a fizzy , yellow colored average looking beer . thats this beer 's only huge upside .  has a malty aroma , enticing , maybe some wheat too ? fizzy palate , mallty taste , fruity , not very lingering . thirst-quenching .

really lacking in the aroma department .  [ best served in a lager glass ] poured a clear yellow-amber with a super small white fizzy head that dissapated rapidly and had no lacing.the aroma was of grain malts , a grassy hop and a soapy yeast .  mouthfeel is thin .

lots of sour lemon and yeast aromas , notes of orange peel , lots of phenol , and a funky , rotten egg smell . the carbonation tingles a little on the back of the throat d-the smell is pretty strange ; but the tastes are pleasant .  but today , i finally decided to try it , and though its appearance is not good , it 's got a strong taste .  very light bodied , an ok mouthfeel.. just way too watery and thin , not much for taste , just some lemon zest on the after taste .

a nice white head , great retention and lacing ... the aroma is fantastic , so fresh , just plucked pine needles with pineapples and an assortment of tropical fruits ... taste is equally great , bitting pine and alcohol of a dipa , but muted and so drinkable .  a : pours a flat straw-gold ; zero head , zero lacing .  i was again surprised to find a very thin mouth feel dominated by carbonation which seemed to accent the minimal hops to make them more pronounced .

pours ouy a golden yellow with small white head . smell . is grainy and slightly sour . taste . grainy and cereal like , but no sweetness . body is fuller than others in its style .  i think on the right day with the right food it 'd be a fair beer - like a hot summer day doing some yard work . the beer seemed lighter than miller or bud light to me .  m - watery , light carbonation .

s = aroma on the whole is slightly sweet and malty , but little else comes from the aroma . it is near odorless of hops , which i find puzzling .  out of a can this beer was a perfectly clear , pale golden color . the one finger of white head retained poorly and left very little lacing .  not thick at all , but lacking carbonation .

clear pale amber color . light-medium carbonation and light bodied . no nose .  appears with no head whatsoever light cream collar of lace is left with each sip though dark ruby brown body .  slightly watery body and bland carbonation .

s- not very appealing , some weak malts and an odd metallic smell . t- thin sweet caramel malt with a little bit of bready character to it . overall i guess for $ 5.99 i should n't really be complaining that this beer is just mediocre .  this is a very pale beer , very light yellow color .  a - medium to dark amber ; almost no head , but what little bubbling there was at the edge of the glass managed to leave a slight bit of lacing s - there was nearly no aroma , and what was there was nothing distinctive t - good malt/hop balance with pleasantly surprising bitter finish m - far too thin and too little carbonation in this sample ; a bit of a sticky finish d - though it will not be mistaken for a world-class brew , this one is easy to suck down since it is thin and flavorful ; without the sticky finish , it would score a half-tick higher

once again , the clear glass has proved to be detrimental to the smell of the beer . beer was slightly skunky , enough so that i could detect no other smells . one thing i have learned though . big burst of sweet malt right from the beginning . no hops of any substance .  this poured the palest yellow i have seen in a very long time . the head was bright white with very small bubbles .  mouthfeel is thin i wish it had some body to it would make it much more palatable for me .

it smelled like feet to me , a little bit skunky .  appearance is a light yellow with nill head and lace .  the palate is not unpleasant , with plenty of that molasses , clove , and dried fruit and some decent maltiness , but this beer is very light in body ( hence my unusually low `` mouthfeel '' score - i rarely dock or add points here unless there is significant deviation from stylistic expectations ) .

but perhaps i 've been drinking too much ipa lately to truly judge my recent first sips of this from tap . it was difficult to detect anything revelatory on my initial smell and mouthfeel but i was impressed with its good drinkability and uncharacteristic load of hops . this is a very refreshing lager and my preferred choice over most .  weak soft yellow color , head does n't last at all ... smells a bit skunky as well .  body is a nip thin . a bit too still , but more carbonation would have blasted through the empty body of the beer , making it even less desirable .

aroma - this is where the beer shines i feel . a great funk , barnyard , grassy , astringent blast right to your nostrils . taste - definitely follows the nose . barnyard and belgian yeast right up front , almost a brett taste , the astringency is in the back with grassy notes . great smell and decent tasting beer , i am enjoying it !  almost no head , carbonation or lacing observed .  the mouthfeel is unbalanced as if the carbonation and the liquid will not merge . for as much noise the carbonation made on opening the bottle , it seems quite on the palate .

by the way , is a beer to drunk fast because the taste when it 's in a high temperature is very bad . the merchandise is greater than the taste but is better than other brazilian pilsen style beers .  pours a pale gold colour - almost looked silvery coming out of the bottle . looks like a dull impersonation of beer .  the mouthfeel is way to under carbonated and watery for the style .

aroma of neutral grains with a restraining vegetal character . slightly better in flavor with sweet grain notes and a touch of citrus . likely better from the can where the weak aroma is not a factor and the carbonation would stick around a bit longer .  murky cola brown body with an exceedingly brief wisp of bubbles and a short-lived ring of bubbles providing the only signs of life . not too impressive looking , but things get better soon enough .  mouth feel was very thin .

s - the nose on this one is as good as it gets . t - just wonderful - almost as perfect as the nose . this outstanding beer 's only downfall . d - great . tons of booze and heat on this one , but the outstanding vanilla and coconut flavors allow me to drink as much of this as is available !  a : pours a one finger head of decent slight cream , okay thickness , and downright bad retention .  very thin , and barely any head .

s. skunk . a lot of skunk and this bottle was not in the sun . pairing suggestions : stinky marijuanna , thats about the only thing that could stand up to the pungent skunk taste of this beer .  it looks like flat coke .  the mouthfeel is syrupy and shows none of the carbonation that the pour hinted at .

the aroma 's weak . very little hints metallic fragrances .  a : pours a half finger head of okay thickness , no cream , and poor retention .  thin mouthfeel with average macro carbonation . touch of caustic mouthfeel in the middle with the bitterness and petrol notes .

smells of honey , biscuits , citrus , and some spicy hops . not one of my favorite ipas , did n't seem very balanced , nor was it very hoppy , just sweet with an overly bitter finish that does n't seem to be produced from the hops .  s- served from a chilled 12 oz bottle into a pint glass . a- light , almost clear with a yellow tinge .  mouthfeel is thin for a ris , almost watery .

sweet and fruity aroma with some odd notes . actually smells kind of like tomato sauce ( ?  a cloudy light amber with enough suspended particles in it to make it look like there is sand floating in my beer when held up to the light .  crisp to the point of being overdone , loads and loads of soda like carbonation . notes : ho hum , average , run of the mill , mediocre ... etc .

had this with some spicy chinese food at a local sit down chinese eatery . s : smelled kind of bitter to me . maybe it was just my nose being on fire that skewed that t : very malty up front , kind of bitter on the tongue , and very dry . i tried this right afterwards as well , and noticed it didnt seem as drinkable as it did while i was eating spicy chinese food .  poured from huge can . very pale yellow with big white head that goes away rather quickly .  i recently bought a bottle and had it at home and was supprised to find that it really was not much better than the average super brewery light beer . the taste is almost nonexistant and unlike some mega beers has almost no aftertaste at all which for this beer is actually a benefit . i would compare is most to a pbr .

good smell , spicy and hoppy .  the 3rd and final beer at the wine tasting event , all 3 were ... a little `` off '' , maybe that 's why this distributing company has discontinued them all ... before i go any further , this is nothing like any oktoberfest i 've ever had , and initially , i thought that maybe i just was n't clued in and that there were a varying range of marzen to be discovered , but after reading a few reviews i see i 'm not the only one who thought of this as a pale euro/helles . a- clear golden with a cream colored head , not the deep rich amber i expected . no lace to be seen , but a few rising bubbles cheerfully wriggle to the top and ... s- ... the release a pale malt and spicy noble saaz aroma thats a little grassy , a little floral , and despite the green bottle , these have all been stored in boxes in crates in a warehouse so there was no chance for light to leak in resulting in a pleasant smell that had no skunk at all .  its rather thin in the mouth , and doesnt ready leave me wanting more drinkabilty - with its high alcohol , and bitter mocha overload , this beer doesnt do it for me .

i have had this beer numerous times and i do n't remember getting as strong skunk smell as i got this time . probably some grain and corn husks in there but the skunk dominates .  has a very pale yellow color with a 1/2 inch head .  skimpy in body , vapidly dextrinous and approaching watery in mouthfeel .

s : the smell is not what i was expecting at all . deep , sweet , chocolate , cherries , and some weird other smell . i do n't know , either way it 's strange . t : wow the taste really makes me forget about the weird smell . delicious chocolate , an underlying sweetness from the cherries , and a dry finish with some roast . if only the smell was n't so strange .  poured into a pilsener glass it forms little head to speak of and no lacing . chill hazed , golden in color , slightly cloudy .  mouthfeel is flat but this is the only disappointment .

really nice nose on this . a big whiff of belgian yeast , revealing dark fruits and a faint hint of very bitter cocoa . after a few nose dives in this one i 've become a bit used to the yeast smell and richer chocolate notes are revealed as well as a faint alcohol aroma .  a : a head that lasts for an average time , that left no lacing nor foam at the edge atop a beer that 's a red-brown ?  mouthfeel was thin and tingly , and the initial flavor was sour fruit , which was fine , but then it too was quickly overtaken by the taste of grains .
smells vaguely of hops . very faint odor .  very pale straw gold in colour . thin head does n't stick around for very long , and does n't lace .  the palate is thin .

s : orange zest , sweet malt notes , light . t : very sweet beer , the orange predominates , but it 's not overbearing .  pours a peachy , almost lemonade in color and fizzy clarity .  m - this bottle was flat . this gave the beer a thick and somewhat unenjoyable mouthfeel .

pretty simple , but really pleasant . 3.5 t : similar to the nose only very much subdued .  uh , it 's lemonade . pale yellow , slightly cloudy . you know , like when it gets up to 79f in seattle .  mouthfeel 2/5 mouthfeel got too watery as the beer warmed .

s- strong cherry and rasberry charachter . a pretty strong tartness is every step of the way as well t- very strong tart charachter , not as sour as i was thinking , nicely fruity at the start but it stays too sweet at the finish which is a little off-putting , however some of my friends realy liked it .  poured into a tulip glass . the beer was a cloudy golden amber color , a bit darker than i expected , big white head that recedes quickly and left no lacing . drinkability is limited by the prominence of the alcohol and the disheartening sight of a glass of beer with absolutely no head and no lacing . it just looked dead in the glass .  for some reason i do n't taste the citrus like everyone else does ... m - thin and flat . propagates through the mouth pretty easily though .

i absolutely loved the smell of this , chocolatey , with some sweet fruits from the yeast and subtle hop profile .  pours an unexciting see-through straw colour with minimal fizzy head despite my vigorous pouring efforts .  the body is very thin and watery and the carbonation level is medium low which does not compliment this beer at all .

the nose is beautiful . i get the belgian yeastiness , and something akin to peaches served with a dash of allspice . so far it 's awesome .  the colour is a golden-yellow , with no lasting head at all .  the palate is thin .

just a light straw color typical of aml 's smell- corn , maltiness , and a slight hop aroma taste- this is one of the better macro lagers out there .  soda pop head that dies to nearly no bubbles . very thin and spotty lace that does not last .  mouthfeel is equally watery .

the phenol aroma overpowers any bouquet the brewer may have tried to put forth .  a- pours clear orange , no head at all , no lacing on the glass .  smells basically like apple juice . watery . also , the carbonation that was so present during the pour now seems dulled . for all its faults , in the end rogue makes a malt liquor that achieves what you usually want out of the style .

smell -- has a sturdy vinegar character , perhaps the red wine variety . i 've smelled worse vinegarized flanders beers , but i 'm not loving this aroma .  thos brew pours out as a clear yellow color with a fizzy whit sheaf that last only a few seconds .  not the worst tasting beer ever , but very thin and watery .

s- smells grainy , little bit of corn , little metallic , almost white wine smelling .  a : pale straw color , looks like a macro . the carbonation looks weak but feels good on the tongue .  m : super thin with no carbonation .

the smell is worty and fairly unappetizing , although strong .  with the last `` porterish '' day before summer actually kicks in upon me , i rate this from a 12-pack sampler ... chocolate-vanilla notes adorn a mocha-soda tint with flatlining head and zero lacing ... like experiencing a cologne bottle ... malty punch ... obtrusive , almost as `` no shit '' as flying dog provokes on its label ... a too smooth ( oily ?  m : thin body with almost no carbonation at all .

smell seems off . something feels like rotting and sour grain .  very clear yellow translucent color , no head .  nose : it 's aroma is a little bit malty , a little bit citrusy flavor : the taste has some lemon/citrus notes w/ some hints of maltiness , but the big thing that you notice is how fizzy this beer is . it 's far too fizzy for me .

when i want a cheap , drinkable single serving can of beer , this is what i drink . in all seriousness this beer is macro style with a bit more flavor than the others . one of the positives of this brew is that it does leave a very nice lacing on my glass ; which , i was surprised at . flavor , well , is sour with a mish mash of corn , grains , hops .  it pours straw yellow .  finish really kills me as bad oaks comes off ... mouthfeel is the true downfall of this beer , watery light with no depth ... easy to drink but not good enough that i would .

s : the grain and metal come through far too much here . this smell automatically makes me think of watching sec football in a fraternity basement ( and being unable to feel my face ) , and that 's not as fun as it used to be .  pours clear pale straw with a small head . overall a very average macro .  alcohol is very well masked for a 6.5 % way too much carbonation for my liking .

although very skunky it smells alot like pot which to me is an awesome characteristic . i am curious if the fermentation process of beck 's involves any hemp but it seem 's unprobable .  a : typical adjunct pale and clear yellow body with circumferential white head that disspaeared quickly . no lacing . s : corn grains , some vague hop aromas and some slight cheap german pilsener alcohol smell when just poured and while it 's cold .  mouthfeel is very watery w/ average crabonation .

i smell a light clove-ish scent and bready yeast . smells almost like a dubbel that sat too long . not awful , but really odd per style .  appearance - super clear pale and yellow , looks like discolored water .  m : watery , high carbonation .

effervescent smell : funky overcooked grain , corn husks , some kind of syrupy sweetness , not decipherable through the nose .  regia extra pours a pale yellow with a thick white head from a brown thirty two ounce bottle .  m - super thin , kind of dry .

first off , i 've never had a beer that smelled this bad while tasting so good . it had a caramel scent , with very heavy undertones of wet dog .  so i pour ... very clear hay yellow color with a quickly-dissolving soap bubble head . now it looks like diluted apple juice .  3.0 m too thin for my taste and my experience with better scottish ales ( like oskar blues ) .

even the airy foam atop this beer has pungent , dry , fruity hop characteristics.. as i find out as my nose and lips accidentally come in contact with the crown . aroma pleases with juicy hop aromas.. not overwhelming and no alcohol detectable . a nice brown sugary malt presence here balances.. unexpected but nice . some apple aromas as well as something spicy like yeast .  a- no head , little lacing , the beer has a cloudy haze yellow body with a couple carbonation bubbles .  a nice chocolatey finish that lingers for a while on the palate is the best part about this beer . m : poor .

overall , nothing all that great here , especially with that odd smell . it goes down easy enough , but i really do n't wan na put too much more in me .  odouls premium & extra smooth na brew pours weak yellow from a 12oz green bottle with a twist off cap . head goes to about one finger then poof , its gone ... no wisp no lace ... the top of the brew is smooth as glass .  the mouthfeel is quite disappointing due to carbonation that is much too high for a stout and a body which is not thick or creamy .

appearance : too foggy smell : smelled like rotten flesh when it was in the bottle , but better out of the bottle taste is good .  a - light yellowy gold colour , clear body , poor head and only a few spots of lacing .  taste is very light and mouthfeel is weak .
smell was very mild and nothing i noticed about it stands out .  appearance : nasty ! sludgy brown , explosive diarrhea , with a couple of bubbles .  the mouthfeel is astringent .
s : musky , metallic , clean lager smell .  really no lacing to speak of .  however , the mouthfeel hindered any solid punch this drink could have had with its extremely watery and light feel .

bottle is a lighter shade of brown , needs to be a little darker , as mine had a slighty light-struck ( skunky ) aroma . ok , but nothing special .  12oz brown bottle ( not metal ) into pint glass . crystal clear light hay color with a thin head that does n't last long . almost no lacing . very clean light malt aroma .  the body of this is way too light for a porter .

s - it smells like a sour old beer .  clear straw gold with a wisp of white head that completely disappears .  the problem is that the beverage is thin and flat on the palate and leaves a really unpleasant metallic aftertaste .

aroma is husky corn some sour hops and a bit of skunk i think . not the most appealing scent ever .  poured with almost no head which is now totally gone . color is a cloudy dark amber with lots of sediment .  mouthfeel : body is thin and water and a little flat ; finsih is wet and is like drinking malt flavored water . the flavors are mild and meek , the body is super watery and does n't offer much , so i do n't feel i will be drinking this again .

s : not much of a smell t : sweet , very sweet with light vanilla . m : creamy medium body d : dispite the alcohol this is very enjoyable and drinkable .  well this stuff sucks . get drunk and visit a frat party .  thin mouthfeel .

s - hmm ... this is pretty bad . vinegar , cork , oxidation , some musk and sweat , odd herbs and minerals .  pours yellow with a poor white head .  this beer is incredibly watery and light on the palate .

stoudt 's fat dog passes muster as a rock solid oatmeal stout on 4 of the 5 senses : looks good , tastes good , feels good , suppose i give it the benefit of that it sounds good . fat dog had a hard to place , rotting cheese aroma that accompanied the brew . quite off putting , even interfered with the taste ( with clothespin applied to nose i 'm confident the taste score could be a full point higher .  golden beer with a wispy head that quickly dissolves .  the mouthfeel is pretty sad on this one . very watery and thin .

the smell is very mild with some weak notes of fresh hops . there are lots and lots of small bubbles ; the carbon dioxide is petty strong .  appearance : pours a medium viscous piss yellow color .  ok. m : kind of thin here .

aroma-light grainy malts blend with moderately low notes of hops , but are overtaken by notes of butter ( diacetyl ) and corn ( dms ) . light fruity esters present as well.there are some redeeming notes , but on the whole , the buttered corn aroma really is n't doing it for me . up front the buttery diacetyl rears its ugly head again , but its blunted a bit by a sort of mineral quality and some moderately low hop flavor/bitterness .  appearance : pours a rudy cloudy brown with no head what so ever , some off-white bubbles .  on first taste the mouthfeel seems a little thin . all in all tasty , but quite thin and seriously lacking in body .

smell was milder than i expected ( also could be due to the allergies/cold i have ) . malts and alcohol primarily . coffee aroma appeared much later , as it warmed .  real ale 's website says this is 5.1 % abv as hard as i tried i could n't pour more than 1/2 '' head , lacing almost nonexistent , clear straw yellow , looks like a macro lager .  mothfeel is very light and watery .

s- has a slighty sweet smell , but not much there . t- very light with a slight sweetness .  pours a clear apple juice gold with a 1 finger quickly dissipating white head that leaves zero lace .  tastes like someone put artificial flavoring in carbonated water .

pours clear yellow with a 2 inch cloudy white head ; smells of malt and yeast , with the malt odor dominating , but still very faint overall .  appearance - the muddy water brown stout was cloudy and when put to the light did not have a distinct or appealing color smell - faint smell of whiskey and apricot taste - starts nice and finishes like a train wreck ... sickly sour at the end mouthfeel - not much to speak of drinkability - i would take many other mass produced stouts , i dont think i would pick this up again .  m - thin , watery , overly carbonated .

aroma is only faintly sweet malt and honey . taste is stronger than the aroma but still very light ... malt , followed by a honey cloying , then a mild hop bitterness .  it 's a pale clear yellow with little head or carbonation .  fizzy carbonation and no body .

this beer has some seriously different odors coming off it .  1/2 inch foamy head which quickly evaporates into nothing . absolutely no lacing at all . not a very quality appearance .  caramel , coffee and cocoa are there , but overall balance is towards the dry and bitter mouthfeel - 2.0 lightly carbonated , bordering on flat and a little watery .

the first thing i noticed about this brew was the skunky odour the second it was popped ... .it poured very nicely with a thick crown which quickly disapated ... the body is medium and the taste is that of thin hops with a hint of carmel ... i liked the `` stubby '' .an ok offering at best .  bottle , a : pale yellow , with little head after the first five minutes .  mouthfeel is also watery with not much body and no carbonation but essentially pretty drinkable due to the fact that is just resembles colored water .

aroma is great . rich dark chocolate . wow , what a disappointment after the aroma . mouthfeel is nice . a shame that a beer that smelled so good did n't live up to it .  i am a little concerned about the complete and total lack of head on this one . there is no head , no carbonation and no body .  too thin .

behind that , you get a decent blend of malt sweetness , graininess and saaz hops . to bad the fools had to out this in a green bottle .  pours a clear straw color with a small diappointing head , also there are some unidentifiable objects floating around .  mouthfeel is boring and watery .

s-hint of skunky beer with weak caramel malt aroma . i hate green bottles-all brewers should stop using them . o-not my favorite marzen but respectable-would love to get some before the skunk sneaks in the bottle .  poured a very cloudy yellow under a tremendously disappointing thin white head that disappeared very quickly - very unlike a wheat beer .  a - light , clear , yellow color with a thick head that dissipated quickly s - beer , cheap beer t - beer from a can , cheap beer from a can m - thin , flat , not much d - went down smooth , probably because i 'd wisely iced it down with some ice and rock salt so it would get really cold .

smell is immensely yeasty with hints of clove , orange , and vanilla . decent nose if you ask me .  appearance - murky witbeer like appearance . not very presentable appearance at all .  the body is light and really deters the taste .

s-what comes through first is a perfect balance of sweet caramel malt and a blast of citrus hops . d- this brew is pretty awesome . brews that emphasize the citrus/spicy hop combo are hard to come by and this one does an excellent job with it .  a- pours a clear yellowish color , almost the same shade as piss .  the flavor was spicy and malty and the mouthfeel was tingly along with a burning sensation as it is swallowed .

s - some malt , but you need to inhale deeply . it also smells somewhat sweet to me , perhaps a bit corny .  a very thin 1/8 '' struggles to form , even with an aggressive pour , and fades very quickly to just some thin spots around the glass . a few teeny tiny dots of lacing are left on the glass .  m : this beer is almost flat .

a : pours a clear medium yellow with a thin white head that quickly vanishes s : hints of malt and corn , but weak overall t : simple basic lager taste that does not attract attention , neither too sweet nor too bitter m : smooth and easy on the tongue - moderately carbonated and well behaved d : easy to enjoy several , but may get a bit boring this would probably be a decent beer to enjoy on a hot day , with a sandwich and some chips .  corona light , abv=4.5 % , cals~~109 , light lager reviewed 10/20/08 @ home , bottle & gt ; pilsner glass a 2.0 - very pale straw in color , little to no head at all s 2.0 - minor hop & malt notes , semi skunky smell in background t 3.5 - pretty good taste for a light beer , crisp on palate , minor hop finish mf 2.5 very thin body as expected , super carbonated d 4.0 - pretty enjoyable for light beer in taste & drinkability .  flavor is of arange , and body is highly carbonated . prickly mouthfeel , and a bit boring overall

s : almost no odor to speak of ( had warm bottle , too ) . t : great flavor , much better than the aroma .  magic hat # 9 was left at my house after a party . # 9 pours a very clear yellow with tons of bubbles , but only a very slight head that soon reduces to nothing . the maltiness does come out a bit more in the taste , but unfortunately , it is drowned out by the overbearing fruit .  nearly flat carbonation and medium body allow a solid diacetyl mouthfeel , which is done well if you like it that way .

a - clear s - nothing really to report on smell t - for a light beer it has an exceptional full taste m - just the right amount of carbonation d - i could drink this all day i can see myself drinking this at a bbq in the summer heat .  the classic light yellow/gold color with a shortlived bubbly white head and only a hint of lacing .  that being said i want to keep track of beers i have tried and will start to try reviewing beers i drink ) from a sampler pack found at specs liquor . tastes flat to me . no alcohol taste that i can tell of and not a whole lot of flavor . goes down easy and not much of an aftertaste .

s : not much here . some light chocolate maybe . t : sweet malt and fruits .  there is absolutely no head to be found on this beer when i receive it .  m - watery and sticky . its almost a thin beer .

nose is fruity , hints of sweet carmel .  a - poured a blackish red colour with no head but a ring around the top , leaving no lacing .  mouthfeel : seltzer drinkability : would be good but the mouthfeel sucks .

the smell was exceptional and exciting , with a remarkable variety of spicy tones that are too complex to describe . with great anticipation , i tried the first sip , which was heavenly . and then it happened ... a nasty aftertaste that i could n't quite place but did n't like .  it came served flat with no head or lace in a shade of yellow-gray .  overall , feels unbalanced , too much carbonation and a little too dull .

aroma : coffee and , unfortunately , cigarettes .  a : lots of debris floating around in the beer . i know this is unfiltered beer , but the amount of junk in the beer is imo out of line .  very watery . the mouthfeel was thin and watery as well .

something smelled off but the taste was good .  pours a very light , very clear yellow colour , with a minimally weak head of white , which dissipates almost immediately to a loose collar around the edges of the glass , despite a pretty vigorous pour . minimal lacing . looks very insipid .  i thought that the mouthfeel was kind of watered down ... it needed more `` oommff '' .

s - my first reaction from the smell was a bag of crushed malt . it just smelled like 2-row pale malt . the aroma also threw me off a bit . the can does say `` all malt '' on it so i 'm assuming they tried to get it to be more malty than normal ipas , i just think they overdid it . the aroma is nothing but malt , and not even specialty malt , it 's all base malts .  pours a lot like the american macros - pale yellow and a very small head that disappears quickly .  the body is thin and watery ; one hardly notices the beer until it is gone .

hard to imagine the being sweeter , loaded with caramel , chocolate , toffee , brown sugar , molasses , prune , fig , plum , cherry and apricot fruit , orange marmalade , bubblegum , candied nuts , on the hops side has pine and flowers , nothing too biting . in spite of this theres more room for more focused clove , ginger and pepper spice , quinine and earth . this forestalls the eventual onslaught of caramel , toffee , molasses , maple syrup , chocolate and so on , the orange to lemon citrus retains that syrupy and candied character . more yeastiness here with that bubblegum to banana touch . plum , fig , date , cherry , apricot , peach flavors , nice mix of darker and lighter fruits . booziness elevates as it warms , more rum notes and feels like it goes to your head faster . one glass is really all you need .  a : pours a staw color , no head , no lace s : sweet , yeasty , peppery .  not oxidized , just old and flattish . flattish and heavy , but slick as well , drinkability suffers from the lack of carbonation , hard to finish this bottle .

smell : prunes , first and foremost . underneath that , a thick , banana-bread-like malt quality ; or maybe cinnamon-raisin-muffin-like quality . very sweet , almost cloying , but enough tone shift to remain above average .  the color is a pale gold with a small head , not very well retained - odd for a wheat beer .  the mouthfeel was then utterly unimpressive . overall , the drink looks good but the taste and feel are way too thin and watery .

it looks great but there is absolutely no smell .  sampled on 1-25-08 pours a very clear , yellowish-gold color , with no head , no retention , and no lacing .  this is a drinkable brew that definatly packs a punch , but it 's kind of one dimensional and thin .

smell is pretty classic , dry minerals and sour citrus , floral and sugary , very appealing . taste is very full for a smaller beer , but not what i was hoping for ( or smelled ) .  a little white in another pale lager . passable overall rather than a standard macro .  feel of almost flat carbonated water .

smells sort of like wet hay or grassy . body is fairly light with a thicker coating on the mouth feel than i was expecting . otherwise leaves little aftertaste , and not as watery as many similar brews .  litle head and a amberbrown beercolor with white haze and big flocks floating .  mouthfeel : way too big-bodied , way too carbonated , and way too uneven .

the aroma brings floral hops and peachy malt sweetness . it mellows as it warms bringing more palatable orange bread sensibilities but it still languishes in a sort of acrid no-man 's land .  appearance : light straw-colored , little head and no lacing .  it does n't taste bad or good , kind of like water . it tastes like bubble water with a hint of sweetness . it 's for getting your swill on , and nothing else . too bad this is what most americans think of , when they think of australian beer .

aroma - grainy , a fruity , citrusy orange sweetness that is n't all that complex but is pleasant . taste - yeasty flavor , thin grain , some decent fruitiness but there is a seltzery flavor throughout .  i actually like this beer with a nice slice of lemon or lime . taste pretty good when it is ice cold but do n't let it warm down or the skunkiness comes through .  it has a below average mouthfeel - boring , too watery and macro-brewish .

the aroma was very light , i was barely able to pick out traces of malt and spice in the scent .  ( end sarcasm ) clear gold color with a failry sizable head .  the mouthfeel was thin and not terribly hoppy on the palate .

s : nothing . uh oh ! t : pilsner like . m : light and mellow , yet some bitterness .  a- golden yellow little no white lace / head s- a slight skunky smell to it light hop odor t- tasted like your average heineken , nothing to really stand out m- went down smooth , slight aftertaste the beer skunk after taste very thin d- not bad would have been better on a hot day , not one i would run out and get again but might have it if i were out for italian .  m - light and fizzy , thin bodied .
there 's virtually no aroma besides the hops and that leaves in a hurry .  a - pale straw color ; clear .  overall flavor is nice , but the body is way too carbonated .

strong malty smell , along with some dark fruits soaked in alcohol ... cherries or plums .  hazy golden color with no head and no lacing . it is not completely flat but nothing formed during the pour .  thin watery feel .
nice nose of citrus and leather .  it pours a typical straw yellow with minimal white head .  m : very thin and watery -- it has a consistency not far from kool-aid .

i ca n't smell much of anything in this . at least it is n't skunky .  pours to a pale yellow color , with thin white heaed that dissipates quickly , and leaves little lacing .  mouthfeel : not much carbonation and the body is kind of watery .

i smelled the apricot in this , as well as an odd corn-ish scent .  appearance - served in a pint glass , amber color , with a flat appearance .  pours a clear golden copper hue which leaves a creamy fast vanishing two finger head and creamy lacing , the smell is herbal grassy hops and some honey malts thats it , the mouthfeel is light and watery and has tastes of honey malts , herbal grassy hops , fresh cut grass , pale malts and finished with a mix of herbal grassiness and toffee and overall i definately would not buy again and the bitterness is only very light avoid cheers .

upon removing the cork cage on this bottle of vintage ' 04 , the cork jumps out toally unprevoked . alas , the nose is almost undetectable . this is a very sugary beer that starts with a unique metallic quality like you would taste is some shrimp or other shellfish , and i do n't mean that in a bad way . it is very mellow , and rounds out the sweetness and dark fruitiness that is this beer 's main quality . this must have been my introduction to chimay , because i remember tasting it for the first time and saying `` whats the big deal ?  the appearance is pale gold with a small head .  a little thin overall . mouthfeel : light-bodied and lacking . way too light and delicate of a beer to have an abv of 7.5 % .

smell : grass and a bit of corn are light and barely detectable by the nose .  the appearance was an opaque golden yellow that left a thin white head that dissipated quickly . obviously , little of the head was left clinging to the glass . on the second pour in the same glass , there was more of a head , and more apparent carbonation , but still was not impressive .  i picked up a carton of this pretty cheap the only downfall its in cans anyways it pours a golden amber see thru colour with nice carbonation that leaves a bubbly two finger head and sporadic lacing , the aroma is pretty macro with grains and a feint bubblegum aroma , it has a thin mouthfeel with a rather grainy taste and isnt nothing to write home about , its definately better than the macroswill that sells for much more and easier to down but its not a beer that i would drink if i wanted a nice beer with character .

4.4 abv , 140 calories per serving a-3.0 nice head intially but it was gone quick , very little if any lacing . s-2 slightly skunky , low point on this rating .  this beer simply looks awful . i try not to judge beer by its outward appearances but since the ba ratings system includes a weighted 20 % value based on visual appearances , ill just play along and call em like i see em . and this beer looks awful . ) in fact , this beer is hideous to look at , but delightful to drink . it has a very active measure of carbonation , a bright honey-apricot color , and a strong aroma that is distinctly belgian and musty .  mouthful was watery and a bit disappointing considering the color and head .

some nice elements in the nose ( a touch of smoke , apple , grapefruit , ) but it 's mostly very unpleasant , shows a lot of oxidation , dullness and even a light manure note .  pale , cloudy , straw-yellow with a very small , thin head . an almost complete lack of lacing . looks like faygo pineapple-orange soda .  the body was light and very watery .

poured a light amber color , quick disappearing head , first sniff was extremely flowery . taste was fine , malty fruity and sweet , very pleasant sweetish aftertaste .  a - lightish yellow with a thin white head .  m : bitter , almost no carbonation , light to medium body .

a nice alternative to the big three 's light beers . it 's better overall than hamm 's , blatz 's , and even leinenkugel 's .  a - very pale golden color with some champagne-like bubbles coming up . honestly , looks like a bud light .  m- thin highly carbonated .

smells roasty and a bit acidic , which carries over into the taste .  this beer reminded me of a red bud light without hops not very good . poured it into a glass and the head was great ... for 10 seconds then there was no head at all .  the mouthfeel is surprisingly flat .
pleasant aroma of amarillo hops with notes of mandarin/tangerine .  pours a nice light gold colour with light fluffy head .  the mouthfeel was very thin for a stout .

really nothing good ... maybe this is a very old bottle .  poured a soapy two finger head . head quickly disappeared and left some nice lacing . nice hazy amber color .  mouthfeel on both is not much , just clear water with a bit of beer bubbles .

smells a bit off ... some tart funkiness and off smells that may be coming from the raisin ?  pours a nutty brown ( not a golden brown ! ) with a big , soapy light beige head with good retention and generous lacing . a lagerish wimp that masks as a dunkel - if you compare it to kstritzer schwarzbier , or even krusovice , it comes across as half-baked and undernourished .  the mouthfeel is medium bodied and watery with almost no carbonation .

d - spectacular aroma displayed on a solid background of malt . the aroma is still so full and excellent that it makes up for any weakness in the flavor profile .  the beer pours dark , very dark , a slight hint of dark brown in the black makes this look similar to a pint of guinness .  body is very thin , drinkability is ok , but there 's not very much to this beer .

smells robust with citrusy hops , orange peel and pine . medium bodied and a bit watery at first which is subsequently overcome by a good balance of hops .  the colour is deep gold . the beer pours with a slight fizzing sound . the off-white finger thick head slowly sinks down to a thick lid , leaving no lacing .  mouthfeel is very thin and dry on the mouth .

aroma has some caramel , syrup , and corn . tastes much better than it smells .  bottle into a pint glass pours black in color with a bit of red highlighting along the edges of the glass .  strong roasted malt character with a twang of hop bitterness , but really light and pale in the mouth with a watery body . no creamy mouthfeel , which was somewhat disappointing , but it was overall enjoyable . clean , pure and watery finish was n't quite what i had hoped for , as i was expecting something a little more milky/creamy/smooth .

pours a pale straw yellow with a slight white head that disappears quickly . the beer gives off a light aroma of biscuit and citrus .  pours a clear copper color with a mostly white with light tan head .  hard to slam the beer that got my through college but ... . the twelfth tasted like the first . not really whatt i consider beer anymore but my in-law says it is more of a beer than budweiser ? could there be a reason you can by `` cooler-packs '' in multiples of 6 !

smell is of molasses , toasted oat , and french roast coffee . for some reason i detect some alcohol in the nose too , and for a 5.5 % abv i 'm not liking it a whole lot . after the initial appearance and smell , i fell in love with this beer .  solid white head sits above a gold bodied beer . produces some decent lacing .  not much depth at all m- lacking for a stout -- - no creaminess and it 's pretty thin overall d- wo n't seek this out again and i hope the rest of the breweries selections are better -- - really loses you in the mouthfeel

s : the strong aroma of hops greets you right away as you inhale and is then followed up by a citrusy malt smell .  pours from the bottle a dark brown with a light tan head and settling quickly into a thin filmy froth .  palate scraping astringency . the lack of carbonation particularly makes me wonder if i should have given this more time in the cellar to condition .

the scent is crap if this is an imperial ipa . the only scents i am getting is a estery apple scent . this one smells more like a poor belgian beer then a double ipa .  appearance : this was a very dark , ruby-brown lager with a light tan head . a thin layer of foam was left capping the beer , leaving a decent amount of lace behind .  it tastes ok. kind of watered down . cant taste any malt or hops . it was too bubbly , seemed over-carbonated .

the aroma is grainy sweet with alcohol . the abv is great for getting ripped , but other than that it 's worthless .  pours out a slightly orangeish golden color , good clarity with about a finger of off-white head . head leaves a pretty full , thin lace , but not much stick .  the mouthfeel is light to medium bodied and just way too thin and watery for an oatmeal stout .

i could n't smell much of anything other than some light hops on the nose . remarkably ordinary lager that impersonates a pilsner on occasion .  bottle poured into my stone tulip . btw , this is the first pink bottle of beer i 've ever seen . and artwork is pretty cool . the pour dropped a two finger head that faded to a thin collar . nice lacing .  m : medium body with lower medium carbonation . the mouthfeel is thin and watery .

smell is initially the aforementioned skunk ... followed by malt , hop and a bit of anise .  look : a deep and fairly clear amber color . foamy two finger off-white head . its a great looking lager . i would compare the head consistency to a sam adams boston lager but a little lighter in color and with tighter bubbles .  watery mouthfeel in terms of a stout .

s : light and thin , with some malt and alcohol notes . t : tastes pretty much of malt and corn , no hops to speak of . m : medium-bodied for a macro , light overall , a bit medicinal and solventy from the alcohol .  pours pale orange amber with hazed clarity . holds a one finger head well after the nitro ceases .  mouthfeel : medium body , watery texture , very low carbonation .
funky aroma , grainy . effervescent . lagery . cooked vegetables .  dark reddish brown with a rather short-lived tan head .  thin to medium mouthfeel with zero carbonation -- lifeless .

smell : very weak smell overall- some sweet pale malts and grain hints .  color is a deep clear brown with good carbonation and a nice tight head . overall i feel a marzen should be a little fuller and richer then this , but it is a good drinking brew .  very thin mouthfeel , almost tasted flat , nothing special .

funky smell .  appears a dark amber/red color . with a small white head .  good lacing down the glass s : coffee , sweet bready malts t : coffee , slight harsh maltiness also slight hint of chocolate m : light very thin bodied beer .

s : not much happening here , some vague hints of malt with a slight bitterness of hops . t : a little better than the smell . there was a nice mild malt character that blends nicely with the hops , but nothing stands out . added this to my beer bread recipe and the beer bread was quite nice .  kern 's pumpkin ale has a nice bold bright orange look .  the malt is lightly roasted , but mild with candisugar and syrupy cane sugar . add to that the thin body caused by a lot of sugar and it will add up to a c for me .

smells great ! you go the same whitepepper honey spice wheatishness of duvel only with a wonderfully crisp , weedy background . tastes very nearly as good as it smells . big nodes of weeds , pollen , and wild flowers backing up a spicy , crisp , lightly lemony belgian pale .  nice chestnut hue to it . some head with a decent carbonation level .  it is entirely too thin for a stout .

s - not much smell at all . again , there 's a fruitiness that i ca n't put my finger on .  poured a thick foamy head on a solid red body .  thin watery and light in body o - did not even reach moderate expectations of being a porter and tasting barrel aged , just not very good in my opinion .

there is an obvious orange peel smell coupled with spice and something that resembles dirty socks . the body is somewhat thin and dry , lacking in richness and the taste is pretty much the same as the smell . orange peel , some spice and not much more .  a pretty golden orange color in the glass but the fragrance was musty to me and actually unpleasant .  where this beer falls off is the mouthfeel ; it was like coca-cola without the carbonation . drinkability would be pretty good i guess , if you can get pas the average flavors and thin mouthfeel .

had this on tap at the aranyhomok in keskemet , hungary a - pours a light golden color that produced a foamy white head that disappears and leaves no lacing around the glass s - no real scents , i guess because i had on tap in europe there was no skunk , but i guess sutle malts was all t - not a complex beer , but then again was n't supposed to be .  pale copper in color with a well established white head that is mostly lasting .  mouthfeel is thin .

not bad at all , pours a copper gold with a decent foamy head , rather weak in the nose , ajduncts plus some hop and grain come about . inexplicably though the taste is not bad , bitter-like light and refreshing , goes down smoothly and its aftertaste is not bad at all . still though , decent stuff .  appearance : it pours a rich brown colour with 1 1/2 finger white foam head .  carbonation a bit high . fails on this point . d- easy going macro lager .

s - not finding too much of anything in the way of bluberries . t - much like the smell there 's just not much there .  im just gon na say , pepper in beer is obviously not for me.this beer looked great , nice amber color with a fluffy white head.the smell of this beer just reminded me of ground pepper , something i like on food.just not something i like in beer.my sister poured me a small sample into a glass , and i had about two sips and gave her the rest .  m - no staying power .

smell : sweet and grains and that lingering trademark skunk !  it 's got a really nice color to it but the hops and malts used just do n't please my palette that much .  feels thin and watery on the tongue with a low level of carbonation . bitterness is harsh and detracts from drinkability , mouthfeel is unsatisfying , and the flavors are n't interesting and complex enough to yield repeated enjoyment .

aroma is faint malts with a mild and vague hoppy character and some alcohol .  it looks good in the glass a hazing orange with a nice white head .  smell is not overwealming , but seems sweet with hints of yeast and hop . watery , yeasty , sweet ... more corn than i thought there would be ... taste relatively one-dimensional , unfortunately . fairly drinkable though ... inoffensive and cheap ...

s. malty , with a hint of hops . most distinctive is a strong spice scent . t. sweet , and again malty and spicy , with the hops much more prominent than in the smell .  this beer pours a dark mahogany with a normal-ish 2 inch tan head that leaves just a bit of lacing .  body a bit lightweight , no real follow-through or length .

very odd aroma ... sulphuric , vegetal ... lemon dish soap maybe ? whatever it is , it 's not pleasing .  i do like the appearance , nice amber color .  immediately upon entering the mouth it felt very watery and light for an 80/- .

nose is grainy - pretty faint .  came out of the can looking okay , clear golden colour with a moderate white head .  the mouthfeel is medium-light bodied with a watery texture , and a little too much carbonation .

smell : smells like adjunct-laden shit water , but it says it 's all grain ?  northwoods lager pours a clear golden color with a finger of white head .  taste is rich and sweet , slightly nutty , but this beer really sufferes from it 's thin and watery mouthfeel .

aroma is fairly sweet with a bit of cotton candy and fruity hops . although the hops a bit masked by sweetness and the aroma put off is minimal at best , especially poor for an impy ipa . a beer thats tastes very good , aroma is mia .  served in a stone vertical epic glass that can be described as stemless martini-like . pours a dark golden-copper color with a good white head and some lacing .  mouthfeel/ drinkability : the carbonation isnt stinging and seems appropriate . the body of the beer seems far too thin .

smell was lacking with barely any hop scent coming from the pour . i think i smelled more malts than hops .  pours out to a clear , deep mahogany , forming a modest light yellow , off-beige head of microbubbles with decent retention and good lacing .  mouthfeel was pretty watery and went down quickly .
very , very subtle smell of corn and alcohol .  it 's appearance is fine with a nice amber color and decent head .  a : it 's still carbonated , that 's something at least . too fizzy .

the aroma is skunky with a malt presence that is not pleasant . what it lacks in smell it makes up for in taste .  a - pours a deep gold with about two inches of foam .  the sweetness died out in the taste , however , which was flat and slightly watered-down . a weird bitterness gave an unpleasant mouthfeel but still not difficult to drink .

weak aroma , not much of anything except for a tiny bit of earth and oxidation . plae malt with no depth at all . floral hop flavor with a hint of bitterness . overall , not enough malt flavor to make this one worth it .  the ruination and bastards are extremely well made beers ; beers that i 've converted bpr drinkers with . the colour was nice , looked on par for the style .  mouthfeel is watery . this style needs more body - the maltiness is there , but there is very little roasted character & not enough creaminess .

s- not much at all to smell , faintly malty t- light tasting , hint of malt m - very carbonated , almost too much so d - could drink this all day long , great beer for a day on the boat , mowing the lawn or some other summer activity  this filled the pint glass with a densely black color with a little red at the edges .  m - thin , watery body , moderate carbonation , slight bitterness in the finish .

it 's not bad , it 's just not there ... caramel malt , some smokiness and ripe fruit is really all i could gather . it was so weak i could smell all the random vague smells around my living room when dipping my nose into the glass for a whiff . it 's not bad or offensive , but on a strictly style based opinion ... it does n't impress .  poured from bottle into a pint glass a : dark brown coloring , fairly subtle tan-colored head .  but i felt i owed it to myself to see if smaller carbonation meant bigger taste .

i 've somehow not yet tried this pale from victory . the nose comprises dark greens , egg yolk , caramel , flowers , and light leek . not sure where that egg-y smell 's coming from , but it 's not helping things at all .  pours a dark brown with hints of amber and ruby , a good two fingers builds up on the pour and leaves light lacing down the glass .  fairly watery on the tongue . i was exited for this one after smelling , but the lack complexity on the palate coupled with the watery mouthfeel made this one a disappointment .

s - i found the nose to be very muted , very slight scent of roasted malts . t - luckily this tastes better than it smells .  i love all things kirkland and am also a big fan of costco , but this beer was a genuine let-down . it pours an attractive brassy color , with a pretty nice amount of head .  pretty nice . the body is as thin as water . that leads to a very drinkable beer , actually , since it goes down ... well , like water .

dark fruits like plum and rasin , some molasses , and alcohol , smells nice . taste - hmm , starts out mild , chocolate , malts , and some rather light bourbon . overall - was excited after pouring , smelling , then i took a drink , wow dissapointing .  i know there are tons of people who rave about guinness ... but for what reason , i do n't know ... a : bartender did not perfect pour this one for sure , but it still looked good s : smells like burnt coffee t : tastes like it smells , burnt coffee m : like cold burnt thick coffee .  medium body , almost non existent carbonation , sweet sticky syrupy mouthfeel . i think the lack of carbonation ruins the mouthfeel and makes this taste and smell overly sweet .
