smell is not much , sort of bland with a bit of skunk to it , small hints of malt and grains here and there .  pours a deep black color with a thick brown colored head and a little lacing all around .  mouthfeel is indeed excessively thin , leaving a slight tingle of carbonation , but otherwise going down like iced water .

pours a 1 finger head with trace amounts of lacing smell - yeast and malts with a rather powerful skunky aroma . it 's an offensive smelling combination to say the least taste - it 's got a very yeasty and mild citrus flavors as well as some slight floral hops and sweet malts .  the appearance is dark with a decent head , but swirling it in a glass shows a watery texture .  s. nonexistent . m. also nonexistent . just plain and unoffensive . light beer on amber side ? nothing to brag about but goes down like water . above average in it 's class .

it has a metallic aroma with a soft sweetness and a toasted note and ... something medicinal . there 's nothing stand-out here but it 's very drinkable .  it was pitch black . pitch black like a stout .  it 's highly carbonated , and extremely astringent .

the beer had the light yellow hue and a great head , like all wit beers should have . what was lacking in this presentation was the taste and smell . i could not detect anything in the aroma and the same for the taste .  pours black with a small bubbly tan head .  m : taste was below average for me , but the mouthfeel is even worse . super thin . light carbonation and no body make this almost watery .

smell : good malt presence , but ca'nt smell any hops .  stroh 's in a can , why not let 's do this ... appears a golden clear bubbly quote , unquote beer look to it with large heavily carbonated bright white head floating above body dwindling at a moderate pace leaves some nice patches of sporadic lacing around my duvel chalice ... sorry duvel .  but the overall mouthfeel is unbalanced , with simply too much fizz against a generally thin texture .

crappy lime too .  22 -- & gt ; pint glass a - ruby copper . 2 finger head lingers to a nice quarter incher that sticks around s - alcoholic , caramel toasted malt t - mild hoppy front .  m - kind of flat on the palate with very little carbonation . hop profile caught me off guard and the mouthfeel is pretty weak .

smell- light chocolate smell is overshadowed by nasty green apple smell .  a- deep dark browen/black . light tan head . i think that they literally dumped vanilla extract into this beer once it finished fermenting .  the mouthfeel is very thin and highly carbonated , very reminiscent of your typical macro lager .

does n't quite live up to the smell , but still very pleasant and highly sessionable .  copper colored with a decent light tan head , very active carbonation -- a bit too much -- possibly aged ( ?  i 'm going to have to go against the gimmick and with the style here , the mouthfeel just is n't there . i 'm not impressed at all , it 's like a half flat beer that you 've left on your desk whilst reviewing a beer and forgotten about it only to come back to it 30 mins later . the shining point of this beer is it 's drinkability .

smell : quite sweet , hints of fruit and a bit metallic with a hint of tomato . not a lot of hops here .  appearance was good , dark with a caramel color head that did n't recede quickly .  very light in body with a slick mouthfeel at first that becomes almost slimy .

'' the aroma was not very strong , however . there was a slight hint of hops but the overall taste was not very strong . it left very little aftertaste and was very easy to drink . this beer was very drinkable .  bottle : poured a hazy amber color ale with a huge foamy head with good retention and some lacing .  mouthfeel was quite thin and highly over carbonated .

s- smell is sour , raspberries , slight peach .  it pours a golden color with a bodacious foamy head . the white foam across the top almost has the consistency of pudding .  very thin , and watery . lower carbonation .

real nice looking here . very dirty and manure like smelling . this is kind of unexpected . overall nose seems slightly off putting , but the taste more than makes up for it .  pours a light brass color with very active carbonation . the head has good retention and leaves sticky patches of lace behind .  the body is a bit thin and feels too bubbly .

the nose is deep bready malt goodness with a hint of brown sugar ... very nice . the taste , however , falls short of the wonderful nose , a crisp light/weak malt with thinnish mouthfeel , semi-sweet with low key hops behind it .  i try to keep an open mind about paper city 's products , as they are the closest brewery to me , however , they usually come up empty for me and this beer is a good example . color was a nice amber .  carbonation is minimal , almost flat . again understanding its aged but this beer is pretty sweet and without some degree of carbonation to clear out the palette at the end it becomes cloying .

poured this guy into a frankfurt mug pours clear pale yellow with big display of carbonation and a white head that is a little bubblier than fizzy and sticks in huge chunks to my glass . smell is mostly of sweet watery adjuncts taste is of , again , sweet adjuncts , but not as watery as i expected .  pours pale yellow and settles light amber in the glass . impressive , frothy head .  m : thin body and light carbonation .

very strong perfume , somewhere between musky cologne and rose water they use in middle-eastern desserts . very dynamic and evolutive aroma , good stuff indeed ! taste : lively , robust carbonation - another shocker for me , considering 13 % abv and a swig-top bottle - but it pushed the fruit flavor really hard , a pleasant sour raspberry then mingled with a round , caramel toffee malt richness .  an average pour with a little too much head presented a nice clear amber color .  water with a little spice and alcohol . the smell is the best part with mainly cinnamon . the taste is one dimensional cinnamon with a super light water taste on the back . no malt or pumpkin to be found . not a good beer nor a good pumpkin ale but if someone handed me one i would have no problem finishing it . also you could down 3 or 4 no problem and being $ 6 a 6 pack you ca n't beat that .

fresh . t : pretty much just crystal malt .  hazy orange copper body , topped by four fingers of rocky frothy white micro bubbles .  head falls into the liquid way too quickly and seems to look more like bubble bath suds that the typical beautiful belgian head . certainly is the high point of the beer . alcohol comes a little too strong on the palate and seems to take over the other flavors . flat on the tonque . outrageously overpriced and overrated .

smells like dirt and honey . too dirty smelling and tasting to have more than one or two ( ever ) unless it was all that i had .  appearance - surprisingly though , this cheap beer looked great ! thick bubbly foam , golden , opaque color , and great looking carbonation made this one appealing from the get-go .  for a russian imperial this is even for 9.7 incredibly weak and watery it 's the first thing i notice . the mouthfeel on this is not good , it 's even weaker than most american stouts i 've had .
the smell has nothing . this beer was light and crisp in taste !  the beer is beautiful golden and looks damn good but yuck w the taste ... .  a bit too sticky on the mouthfeel .

... smell needs major improvement ... heads abit low for my liking ... golden copper in colour ... hides the abv quite well ... lacing is very nice ... smooth and drinkable but lacks that special something to make it stand out ... 'jiminy jilikers ' ''  looks fine , a good clear mahogany brown , sparkling and clean , with a small off white foam head on top .  mouthfeel : absolutely no carbonation .

this is one of those beers that is good for the younger crowd , one because its cheap and two when your young you really dont care that much about taste you just want to get drunk . the smell of it isnt a good beer smell what so ever but the taste is right above average in my book  orange color , looks like it might be hoppy , excited .  thin , watery , overcarbonated .

this rauchmalt is combined with modest amounts of crystal malt and two types of chocolate malt that add sweet and chocolaty notes to balance the assertive smoke qualities . hops really take a backseat in this style , so as not to interfere with the complex smoky aromatics '' -- free state this pours a very dark brown almost black . unfortunately , the aroma is weak . some very small tinges of smoke come out , but not much else .  bottle poured into a tulip . half finger , slightly pink head with decent retention and good lacing .  mouthfeel is very light and watery and it has a similar taste as many other bmc beers , however it does have some light maltiness to it that most macro lagers lack .

cans . ugh , off-putting smell . extra high abv high gravities , like 9.0 % and above , have the grape tinge to them . this smells like it is going to have the grapey alcohol overpowering taste thing going on . ides . ) barely any sweetness at all .  appearance : i must say by taking a look at it , its a very pretty orange/ honey color with minimal head ... so far so good .  not much at all going on except for some sweetness and a very slight bitterness that gives way to a watery finish . not the worst macro lager by any means .

smell is bland , but malty .  i picked up a six-pack of this beer with high hopes , based on a friend 's recommendation and the great reviews that it had received . nice mahogany color . thin head dissipated quickly .  mouthfeel : very carbonated with a thin , almost watery feeling .

aroma is mainly awful , smells mainly of socks and super citrusy hops , no malt complexity .  looks can be deceiving . this beer looked fine , sporting a rich copper hue .  the carbonation seems artificial , which really brings down the quality of this lager to something like a henry weinhards ( goes for a good taste , but it all seems somewhat fake ) . without the strong carbonation this would have been a common sight in my fridge , but as it is sieraa nevada summerfest will only make occassional appearences .

aromas are weak , with really only grassy hops and corn discernible . not impressive yet .  appearance : nice half inch off-white head stuck with it for a bit . nice dark amberish color .  mouthfeel : medium-heavy body . makes my mouth feel like sandpaper after a taste . after reading other reviews , and letting the beer warm a bit , i & # 8217 ; m starting to appreciate it more , but i & # 8217 ; m thinking i & # 8217 ; m robbing the cradle a bit with this sample .

a - nice copper color - light head s - not too much . can not pick up much hops or malt t - average for and extra pale ale . like the smell , light in the hops and light in the malt .  the peak one pours a dark black with mahongany highlights . it has a light brown head that quickly dissipated to a thin film and collar that laced the glass a little .  sweet crackery finish , m - thin with very low carbonation .

the aroma is pretty faint and it is hard to really pick up on much . the faint aroma is slightly nutty and fruity .  a- pours a deep hazy red/orange with a nice fluffy , crispy white head that disappears kinda quickly leaving a nice amount of sticky lacing . loads of carbonation !  mouthfeel is thin .

nose is fairly lager-like with some light frutiness .  i poured into a pint glass to a half inch of light tan head .  the presence of tannin explains how , while quite watery , satan red is also quite drying .

sure it 's crystal clear and pale straw yellow but the dense two-finger white head cakes the glass in beautiful , thick lace . s - grainy straw and a boat-load of sweet corn in the nose . while this is n't really offensive in the least , big flats does n't offer much in the way of aroma ... t - heavily grainy pale malt seems ber cheap as does the corn adjunct flavor and husky straw finish but really , this might be one of the better tasting beers of it 's style , which is how i 'm judging it .  appearance wise it looked pretty nice bubbling nicely , smell reminded me a bit of moldy fruit , taste was like someone poured sparkling wine into a pilsner and shook it up , it was n't very drinkable and we all agreed on that , perhaps it needed to be colder and not drank with wines and other beers , but i ca n't review it very highly given my recollection of it .  m : i was disappointed in the mouth feel . the light mouth feel really hurt for me .

aroma is stale with a hint of berry .  bottle : poured a slightly hazy blonde color ale with a huge foamy head with better then average retention .  the mouthfeel is light to medium bodied and watery .

s - strong hoppy aroma , with a light medium roast malt . d - this beer was a let down after starting out with such a promising nose . suginoya brewery is at almost every brewery , and i look forward to trying their other wares , but will pass on their amber ale .  a - pours a nice clear amber colour with a white large bubbled head that dies quickly to a film .  it is a bit bland , the mouthfeel is way too watery .

the nose was the lightest grain and hop presence , and from there it blew my mind . the mouth feel was that of a proper cask bitter , but other than that and the faint aroma ... nothing ! ! !  it 's a very pretty golden color with lots of carbonation making for a thick , white head that lasts a long time .  color very pale green or lemon odor , which suggests more concentrated lemon juice only freshly cut lemon slices , but preserving a small mouth , perhaps a bit too much . the lager that is the basis must be extremely low in taste because the body is still very watery , just a few hints of lemon , no sugar but not bitter unfortunately .

smell is a little off out of the bottle - a bit glassy , but the mouthfeel and drinkability are high .  poured a nice garnet hue with a slight off white head that barely lingers with minamal lacing going on .  light body , short finish , little texture , too much carbonation at the front .

poured froma bottle into a willy a-deep golden color with a good head retention low head no real lacing s-very fragrent and floral also a good sweet berry note , very grassy t-lost me right here it is almost nothing like the smell the berry is very subtle and lacks any real defining flavor .  appearance : black which shows a clear ruby when backlit . had a creamy tan head that left a little bit of lacing .  mouthfeel : a bit on the fizzy side - really scrubs the tongue .
smell- nice nose of hard alcohol , vanilla , deep caramel and barrel flavors .  nice goldenrod color , head dissipates after a few minutes .  limp bodied and watery , with no real aftertaste .

smells of funk , but like a locker room , very earthy and not what i would call pleasant . overall , this is a decent attempt at a saison , but i find the nose to be quite offensive .  labeled scaldis , pours a nice brown amber with a huge head that stays throughout drinking the beer .  `` simple '' is the best word i can use to describe the taste , but it does deliver with scorched malts with a touch of lactose . my biggest complaint with this beer is the mouthfeel- it 's way too watery .

a : pale straw , fizzy , some head retention s : stale cereal grains , corn , a hint of sweetness t : starts with a tinge of sweetness , big grainy bread profile , considerable amount of flavor for an adjunct lager , decent balance mf : light body , high carb o : better than most of what bmc offers , but only by a slim margin  appearance : pours a brilliant copper in color , extremely clear with a ton of carbonation bubbles ( not necessarily a good thing ) .  mouthfeel : medium to light treading dangerously close to watery .

this a big funky nose ! t : i was excited to try this , but i find myself feeling a bit let down .  the beer pours a bright straw color with a fluffy white head from the can .  it drinks as a light beer ; it is very thin and weak , much unlike guinness .
wheat smell , with a sickly sweet remainder , not exactly pleasant .  a : lovely raspberry colour . when held up to light looks a thick cherry colour .  m : bubbly and very thin .

smells slightly yeasty , not much else in the way of aroma . tastes hoppy , but not too bitter . a well balanced beer , not a whole lot in the way of flavor or smell , but what is there is n't bad .  reviewed 2/7/2008 ( bottle ) : pours a golden yellow colored body , with a huge creamy white head , lasting , with okay lacing .  body is way too thick , sweet , and syrupy .
smells of diacetyl .  pours a clear light copper amber with a medium forthy white head that retains well and laces the glass .  the mouthfeel was flat leaving a watery feel in the mouth .

aroma is a nice spicy hops with a good bready , roasted malt to it .  a- the head is bubbly bubbly slightly creamy brown with a reddish tinge . holds nice to the glass . the body is dark again brown with a red hue- murky .  i do n't taste any pecan ... m : thin . not to impressive in this dept o : do i love it ?

unfortunately , the aroma does n't really stand up to the look . there is hardly any malt presence . the taste and texture are ok . it does not hold up to the style well , but if you 're a monty python fan it 's definitely a must .  12oz can into a tulip . appearance : careful pour yields a one and a half inch , bubbly , off-white head that dissipates slowly leaving splotchy lacing . pours hazy dark amber , and leaves sparse lacing .  mouthfeel was thin like water , very little body .

lots of carbonation in the pint glass i ca n't place the aroma , seems earthy . not the most pleasant smell . i do n't note much for aroma hops taste is malty , fairly light in taste , small bittering finish . not a great version of a munich style beer .  very dark mahogany brown colour with a tanned brownish white head that is quite foamy . retention is good with some lacing too .  it tasted mostly like water with a very light toffee/sweet taste in the back of the tongue . that 's it . it was very drinkable in the same way water is drinkable . when a brewer wants you to chill his beer , there must be a issue with the flavor at cellar temps . i ca n't believe some people consider this to be the flagship for the style .

pretty good aroma wafting from this especially when warm , distinguishable espresso and coffee grounds with baker 's chocolate , coarse grains and a earthy woody note , not unlike campfire smoke with the addition of some licorice . great aroma and feel , solid overall .  appearance : rich amber color , with about one finger 's worth of head .  the body is light and really lacking .

easily the best adjunct lager i 've ever had . the guys over at miller must have splurged on the rice when formulating this recipe .  appearance : nice deep brown/ruby-red color . tan , 2 finger head with some pitting upon settling .  mf : it 's medium-bodied at best despite the label 's claims of `` full bodied . '' speaking of which , it has a soda watery type carbonation , not at all the `` luxuriously smooth '' of the label . i have to say that they could get the mouthfeel under control ( i 'd imagine this is less of an issue on tap ) , it would be hands-down my favorite irish stout .
smell is mainly light corn .  looks pretty good in a pint glass .  the mouhfeel is weak , watery , thin .

smells nice , a bit fruity , with a refreshing effervescent quality . does smell a bit on the citrus side .  a : nice coloration with some light lacing .  the mouthfeel is confusing as it feels too thin for the amount of sweetness on the taste buds .

a good hot weather outdoors session beer , can only get in a bottle , not available in a keg for my kegerator , a shame , need to add a lime and lots of salt , that way i can not taste the actual beer . this is a light beer but not as watery tasting as american light beers and the lime and salt make it something a little special .  a : this sour brown ale , true to its name , pours deep ruby-tinted brown , with a quickly-vanishing two-finger head that is also a rich burnt-straw-brown mahogany . maybe i 'm just not a sour beer drinker , as this is perhaps a well-crafted beer for its style , but not what i like to experience when tasting a fourteen-dollar bottle of beer .  mouthfeel is overyly fizzy and thin .

this beer is not terrible for what it is , its really easy drinking and is not offensive in anyone aspect . its definitely a way watered down version of there regular lager but its still not a bad beer for a light beer . its strong point is obviously its drinkability and its low point is you cant definitely at times feel its very watered down .  when i pulled the bottle out of the box i was tickled pink . poured in a pokal glass at 45 degrees . appearance : a dark copper color with reddish and orange hues . there is a quarter inch light tan ring around the glass .  it does bring vanilla to mind . the sweetness almost removes it from the style of beer . far to thin for a brown ale .

the sulfurous aroma however was absolutely what i would consider the worst aspect of this beer . there was a lot of bread yeast aroma behind the sulfur as well .  nice auburn with yellow highlights .  m=fairly thin , a little medium . watery .

very enjoying ! t - malt is smooth , caramel sweetness is restrained and some dark fruits show up .  appearance-dark golden color , nice white head that dissapears slowly .  good for a lager , but way too much carbonation really throwing this beer off .

nothing spectacular on the nose but for the typical belgian `` funk '' which was fine but i could distinguish nothing else . overall , a keeper , i just expected some more hop character to poke through but , then again , perhaps belgian darks are n't where we go for hop nirvana ?  the beer has an overall nice appearance .  the worst part for me was definitely the mouthfeel , which was waaaay too thin .
trying to get some more scents , but the smell really is quite weak .  i was excited by the color and look .  mouthfeel : lacking . too light for the style .
i really ca n't smell anything on this beer .  in the glass the beer looks fine , amber in color .  mouthfeel is weak and watery .

thne nose is the main issue as it smelled burnt and almost vegetal in nature . i expected a luscious impy porter nose but had to struggle past the smell with each sip .  daark brown body with plenty of carbonation , topped by a hefty medium to dark tan frothy head . good lacing .  m/d : a very harsh crispness in the mouth and to much carbonation for my tastes .

it has a bad smell , but i do n't like pumpkins so ultimately this beer review may not be fair . the smell of pumpkin and spice is over whelming , and not good . overall i really dont like it at all , it stinks , but to be fair to o'falllon i dont like fruit/vegetable beers .  got about an inch of head with average retention . somewhat impressed with the lacing on this one .  thin on the mouthfeel and the carbonation is way too high on this one making the thinnes hard to handle .
no aroma whatsoever , even right up under my nose .  was really looking forward to this brew , but sad to have tried it .  mf : too thin and slippery !

the aroma is great . tons of grapefruit and orange . it 's perfect . wow it 's smooth .  pours out to a clear ( i.e-filtered ) pale golden , forming a tall , poofy white head with excellent retention and nice lacing .  m = thin . thats it .

i tried smelling it with my glass full and got nothing . i tried smelling it with the glass half empty , swirling it around , and the whole nine yards , and still nothing .  big , black , thick and sludgy looking . nice looking half a finger of leather head . some visual spotty lacing .  very complex and interesting m : disappointing ! very thin for a barley wine .

head retention lasts to the botttom of the glass s - light , cracker/carb smell . slight buttery . no hops .  a : the pour is dark amber/red-brown with a thin tan head forming .  mouthfeel is thin and weak .

there is a slight hint of malt in aroma , not much else , but it smells like a bock . this is a decent bock with some spiciness .  a-tan and spongy head with a black body .  mouthfeel feels thin and weak ; this is my only real complaint with this beer .

this beer actually does n't smell very good . grainy . it tastes much better than the smell .  black pour with a two tone mocha head that is several fingers thick .  mouthfeel was just plain flat , no pep to it at all .

smell is dark fruit , roasted malts , vanilla , oak , and a touch of coffee/chocolate .  appearance : frothy , mostly diminished head , clear body , brown .  m : water thin , light side of champagne-like carbonation .

s : hrm . not pleasant smells . sour fruitiness , as of white wine , is more pleasant . not very pronounced .  this nearly opaque brown pint arrived with a huge , cloudy head .  no attempt whatsoever to hide the alcohol and the addition of the heavy acidic espresso taste and a watery mouthfeel make this hard to down .

smells metallic , not pleasant .  i like beers brewed with rye and love ipa 's , but this was a beer that i could n't stomach .  overall feel was very thin , not impressive and not terribly satisfying .

s there was hardly any aroma on this beer aside from a very faint raisiny sweet note .  a= the pour is a nice deep golden color with a crispy white head on it that holds some decent retention and lacing .  the mouthfeel is light and watery , not much substance . a very watered down dunkel , i would skip this in the future .

it was light and added character to the blonde ale , but it 's a little much in here and it make the aroma offensive . the flavor and aroma come off extra bready with a little rubber in the aroma .  appearance- black with little tan head .  mouthfeel is thin and watery .

smell - chemical , aluminium can , some hop scent but not nice .  appearance : the beer looks really good . nice sized white head which lingers shortly , leaving small bubbles and minimal lacing .  the finish is lightly sweet rather than crisp , and the mouthfeel , which started out thin , ends on a watery , undercarbonated note . zywiec is an average epl , making it a below average beer in general .

smells faintly like hard candy , and a little rice .  the color was very appealing , but that was all . when i gathered the nerve to take a drink and really sink my teeth into this beer , it felt like i was drinking a beef jerky smoothie .  2.0 m : light body . way too light for the style . also , too much carbonation .

smell : pine cones and grapefruit at first then the malt comes through real nice . taste : hoppy as expected but where 's the malt ?  pours a mahogany with a thin beige head .  it is far too light and leaves the tongue and mouth with a stinging feeling and terrible astringency ... d- one redeeming quality of this is that it seems like a session beer but boasts a 9 % alcohol level .

s : smelled like weak malt , no real pale ale scents , maybe a hint of the hops , but it seemed more malt than anything else m : other than average , did n't leave much an impression , a little bitter from the hops , but again , mostly the malt profile with a malt aftertaste t : this is one sudued pale .  my wife picked this up for me last week in nyc , i assume its fresh . poured from a bomber into an oversized snifter . produceing a 1 '' tan head . the beer is black with no light penetration . scattered thin lace left on the glass .  the beer was entirely too light bodied for a stout , this really was one of the most disappointing elements of the beer .

for the price it isnt worth it weekly or nightly it goes down smooth with a good taste there really isnt a smell and it looks like an other beer in this category  appearance : pours a super large 3+ finger thinner off-white head . actually poured relatively clear for a dunkelweizen , then quickly turned cloudy after a few seconds .  m- this is precisely the opposite mouthfeel that i want . it feels like it wants to be sweet and sticky , but it really just falls watery on the tongue .

smell is nothing exceptional : some obvious coffee and a touch of dark chocolate .  greatful red pours a amber color with strong red and light brown hues . good head and lacing .  very thin feel , little oily .

the smell is almost that of a macro lager but slightly less offensive .  pours black with a very light tan head . nice retention and dotted lacing covers my glass .  the first thing i thought when i tasted it was , `` wow that is watery . i think they basically made it too `` light . comparing this to their original , it unfortunately seems to fall into the `` watered-down flavor '' category . if that is what you are looking for , then here 's your beer , otherwise i would stick to the usual recommendation to avoid the light beers . then again it really was n't that bad considering it was so cheap at the time .

at first notice the smell is like any other beer just with a sweet hint . also believe it or not it went well with mexican food .  looks nice . has a dark , almost gingerbread like color .  mouthfeel was poor .

the aroma is not very nice . it 's incredibly boozy . a bit of solvent , nail polish remover aromas are in there as well . the taste is not as boozy as the aroma . the aroma hurts the drinkability and it does n't taste like a well made imperial stout .  appearance this one poured a hazy orange in color and was very fluffy just like a good hefe weizen should be .  this beer reminds me greatly of sol , corona , and modelo . i would n't be surprised if all mexican beer came from the same place ... dirty t-shirts squeezed out into a horse trough and then 'pasteurized ' by the horse before making its way into the bottle , but hey what do i know about cervezas .

smell is pretty strange and unpleasant , an odd mix of fruits and spices with what i want to say is tomato coming out strong in front .  pours a cherry-tinged hazy and opaque amber , but mostly cherry , with decent carbonation and a perfectly white head that thins to a collar .  this is very much like corona . not as good as miller light .

almost no aroma in the nose . the appearances of cloudy lemonade .  hole in the wall shop - $ 7.00 or $ 8.00 4pk cans ( wychwood.com ) i poured the can into a glass in a perfect swoop . there was zero head , but a little lacing . pretty impressive .  very carbonated ... .too much .

it smells metallic and skunky , with some sweet corn graininess and fusel alcohol lurking below .  it looks nice enough , in fact it looks pretty great . it pours very dark with nice ruby highlights on the edges when held up to light .  3.0 m thin .

really not very pleasant .  appearance : pours a clear golden with a fluffy white head that thins to a persistent layer .  a thin mouthfeel . extremely drinkable . but that 's all i can really say good about it , the taste is n't great , and the mouthfeel is too thin .

smells strongly of pine and.. well.. marijuana . a nice earthy hop with most of the aroma hitting deep in the back of the nose . flavor is a nice mix of biscuity malt and rich fruity and piney hops .  either a nitrous pour , a crazy looking on-tap carbonation . looks decent , dark brownish black with a very creamy off white head .  mouthfeel is where the beer suffers . it just feels wrong . a very tasty and aromatic beer , and if you can get past or prefer the super-low carbonation level .

this has one of the best aromas of an ipa that i 've ever had . sticky , piney , resiny aroma . i find this to be a very drinkable ipa .  the santa fe pale ale poured a copper-orange with an thick and creamy off-white head that laced the glass .  m : really unappealing .

s : not a lot to it . maybe very faint wheat smell .  i must admit i was suprised to see this new offering from coopers as i have never heard of it , it pours a pale golden see thru champagne colour with a nice frothy one finger head , sparkling carbonation and bubbly clingy lacing , it has a green , grassy hop aroma with a malty background , it has a thin mouthfeel even thinner for the style for my liking and the taste isnt as pleasant as it looks it has tastes of watery hops with a feint grainish aftertaste not as great as i was hoping for but definately better than the other macro swill out there .  d-a little rough on the palate with the huge carbonation and extremely grainy feel .

there was a mild earthy aroma that lends nothing to the beer .  initial head that rises a half inch or so , then fades to a broken ring around the edge . mahogany color when poured , appears black in the glass .  mouthfeel is thin , macro thin .
s - smell is very subtle . bready malts , musty notes .  appearance : dark-brown/black color with a huge tan head that gradually collapses , leaving thick lacing .  mouthfeel is very thin .

honey is very pronounced edging near a braggat . both in the aroma and the taste . the hops are non-existent until the finish were they are quite strong . overall i think it 's too sweet and i could barely finish the sample . too cloying .  pours a large white head with fair retention and some lace .  here we go : a - opaque reddish-brown , small head with minimal lacing s - malts , hint of hops , not much else t - much like the aroma , mildly sweet malts , faint hop bitterness with weak coffee m - thin , a bit too thin for a brown ale d - no problem putting down a few if i chose to , but i do n't think i would unless it was my only alternative to bmc lagers .

smells of yeast and not much else .  dark golden look . head was about an inch and a half that left a quarter-inch ( or more ) film . reminded me of that candy that fizzes in your mouth .  the second sip shows that this beer is just really thin and more watered down .

aroma is complex and deep- cherries , plums , cloves , cinnamon , orange peel and nutmeg all seem to float on a platform of caramel and molasses . but what starts out as intriguing eventually becomes overbearing by the end of a 750ml. , and those phenols become too prominent .  pours a brassy yellow with a solid foamy head that laces the glass nicely .  mouth : enters the mouth with very light carbonation that flattens as it goes back . overall , it 's not a bad brew , it 's got a great hop flavor but not enough depth or balance , and the weak mouthfeel ruins the experience .

not much in the nose , really . some faint pale malts and not much else .  it pours a very active pale gold , with a thick , three-finger head that imparts nice lacing - looks kinda like a hefe or wit .  way too carbonated here , which hurts the mouthfeel quite a bit .

s- like a macro lager .  had at watch city 9/2 reviewed from notes served in a pint glass a : this beer pours a straw yellow with a two finger of creamy head .  mouthfeel : medium-bodied . it took much diligence to see my way to the end of this beer , and , were it not for the runaway carbonation , it could 've been far better . one to revisit , provided they clear up the carbonation issue .

very pleasing . t - this beer smelled and looked so promising but the taste fell so short .  nice appearance and delightful smell , but was not happy with the taste .  taste is malty to start , but very thin . the body leaves one wanting more . dry finish with an almost soda-like feel . despite the lack of body , this beer is rather drinkable .

i love how the smell changes over time . got ta give 3f props for the phenomenal smell , tho .  appearance : same great creamy looking head and leaves rings of lace all the way down ... the color is not as black as it used to be , its more of a very dark brown .  mouthfeel : way too carbonated .
i could not detect any aroma from the taster glass . flavor is mainly a bit of sweet malt .  starts off nice , with a hazy golden color and decent head .  m - too light , watery , bleh .

smells heavenly - a brilliant blend of maple syrup , caramel , toffee , figs , burnt sugar and bourbon . just a hint of booziness at the end . tastes a lot like it smells - however the bourbon is much more prevalent than the other flavors - you get hints of the caramel , figgy , malty deliciousness present in the nose , but they 're largely overpowered by the bourbon .  nice amber color , plentiful carbonation .  the mouthfeel is way thin , but drinkability is ok .

faint smelling : cinnamon ... not much of anything . i was not picking up anything on the nose . the taste was not bad , just not really anything .  has a pretty nice look actually .  the mouthfeel is disappointing with absolutely no carbonation and mild flavors lingering around . overall , i could have possibly gotten a flat beer but this beer had potential ( when carbonated ) but it didnt come through in my bottle .

s - little bit of a corn smell in the nose .  pours a nice `` pale-golden '' yellow , nice head , that last fairly long .  the first thing i notice with this beer is the watery mouthfeel . the mouthfeel is terrible .

smell is pretty weak .  dark brown with light tan head-nice looking light simple sour nose .  maybe a little dusty , but i probably dislike the low carbonation & tackiness more . my tongue feels like i just drank a pot of black tea .

i was surprised by this beer . it is likely the best chinese beer i have had . it does not have a lot of flavor , but what there is is not offensive.the flavour is very mild , a bit of hops and perhaps grain . i wish water tasted this good , as what this beer reminds me most of is a good mineral water .  a : looks nice , deep ruby amber , solid creamish head .  very little mouthfeel , this beer is meant to be drank ice cold as implied with the cold indicator on the can unlike most beers that i drink .

aroma is of lightly roasted malts and a bit metallic , along with a bit of chocolate and some subtle dark fruit notes . lightly sweet overall with an odd overall character ; possibly a bad bottle due to the metallic character .  the appearance is pretty good . it is mostly foam but the head is thick and cloudy and rocky and dense .  smells and tastes bland and grain like . almost stale . it is a good beer to party with if all your doin is playin beer pong or circle .

intense sweet banana scent . very full bodied aroma .  pours almost black in color with a very small off-white head .  very sweet flavour , largely the same elements as in the aroma , but far too sugary and overwhelmingly sweet for me .

aromas of hops , alcohol , and yeast .  appearance seemed good , super pale golden yellow with a billowy head of white foam just over a finger high , not bad for a lager .  the body is kind of thin , and there 's too much carbonation , which brings the drinkability down a fair bit .

grainy/malty `` beer '' smell ; pretty common smelling .  appearance - dark amber , a shade or two darker than a vienna lager and with a reddish tint . head retention is moderately good , leaving a spotty lace on the glass .  mouthfeel is very , very light -- it goes down like nothing at all .

i get a definitive white wine smell , a lot of yeast , and a hint of wheat ( but maybe because that is what i was looking for ) or grain . it looks and feels good but the beer disappointed on the smell and taste .  barnyard in a bottle . but uniquely so . if for no other reason than to go back to a differing style .  mouthfeel : this is where the beer went south for me . the carbonation was almost non-existent , which was in stark contrast to the initial appearance .

s : rather grainy . sweet bready malt and a linger bitterness in the back . traces of corn . t : grainy bready sweet malt with both corn and ripe banans ( is there also some wheat in it ?  as the blonde approached my table , i noticed the white lace that collared her neck . as as blondes go , she definately deserved a second look , and i obliged . the lavender was so thick i could almost taste it . i needed relief from what looked to be a good encounter but had turned poorly so quickly .  the mouthfeel is poor . it seems to lack enough carbonation .

smell is extremely poor , not showing any orange .  appearance : clear coppery color with a rich thick white foam . plenty of persistent lacing on the glass as i drank it down , but the foam on top does eventually go to just a thin film . shame that a beer which looks so nice at first turns out to be a let down in all other categories .  m - light bodied , very thin feeling , and very little carbonation o - not too impressed with this beer .

beautiful aromas of freshly baked banana bread , vanilla coke , toasted candied coconut . definitely will be cracking some more of these open in the future , alcohol is well hidden and i tend to consider rr a bit too hyped but this is a very nice beer .  a-cloudy gold , nice white head s-fairly gross smelling , like a very tangy orange with wheat t-orange and wheat upfront that quickly fades in to a tanginess . sam adams , thank you for changing the spring seasonal to the noble pils , you still should 've left this out of the winter package and never made this again .  t- vanilla/cream soda , one-dimensional caramel malt . very vanilla . m- mouth is unrefined and rough in the way i would expect from good ol bmc . sweetness lingers in an unpleasant and sticky way .

the nose was very faint . i could detect some sublte pruney scents with much effort . some roasted nut and toffee flavors hit your tongue and do n't get overpowered by the hops that jump into the fray .  ultramour pours in fine and has a nice with staying head and a deepredbrown beercolor .  i will admit that i did not like the mouthfeel very much . too bubbly .

the aroma is of very faint caramel . it is really airy , and there is absolutely no complexity . it would be a lot better if the aroma had more going on , but the rest of the beer is solid .  pours a reddish brown almost copper hue with a 2 finger foamy off white head that leaves little soapy lacing .  the smell reminds me of anchor liberty ale , only slightly less pungent . watery body , with some caramel notes . theres a citrus hop flavor in there too , but there is also a tannic `` spent hops '' flavor which is not so good . it lacks some bitterness too .

the smell on this one is incredible , and leaves little to be desired . a lot of chocolate hits the nostrils as well as bitter espresso . this is by far the best porter i have ever smelled , thus far . the taste is not quite up to par here .  pours a deep dark brown , hints of burnt amber in the light .  it 's low in carbonation and a little thin and watery , which is a real shame .

the smell is like a cheap american beer , the taste is malty , and the entire experience is just thick .  undated brown bottle into an ipa glass . pleasant clear amber body topped with three+ fingers of off-white head .  m : thin and watery , very little carbonation , too thin to be cloying , but i 'd rather this beer be full bodied .

s - skunky smell . smells like a cheap adjunct other than that though .  it poured a dark brown-copper color with a nice off-white head and good lacing .  perhaps age will remedy.. m : explosive mouthfeel upon drinking , but the body is very light , with the alcohol evident .

its not very good in the smelling department . its not very good in the tasting department .  22oz bottle poured into weyerbacher tulip . bottle reads `` best by 12/11/11 a : clear golden honey that paints my palm in an amber hue , with a 1 1/2 finger of soapy white head that clings to the glass as the beer arches downward when the glass is tilted .  mouthfeel was stingy and watery .

sickeningly sweet aroma and `` bad beer '' aftertaste .  pours a hazy amber , some orange highlights , decently thick and solid looking white head forms , quickly bubbles its way down to a thin ring around the glass , few lace spots stick .  the taste was simple and good , but part of me thinks it was overshadowed by the dominant carbonation .

smell of hops and maybe a hint of skunking . if there were such a thing as `` beerness '' i 'd say this sample has a lot of it , because it 's like any of the mainstream bmcs just magnified in the color , taste , and smell . and i understand this was sort of a gateway beer which bridged the old bmc style to the more modern hoppy ipas , so i respect that , but instead of coming across as fresh strong hops it comes off almost more like a skunked bmc .  the pour on the beer was very nice , proper stout black with a thick tan head on top .  mouthfeel - this is where this one lets me down . feels very thin for a porter , very watery .

on a brighter note , it still smelled and looked good . it was n't bad .  poured a entirely opaque dark brown color that yielded nothing when held up to light . big , creamy tan head that required two pours . lots of lace on the sides of the glass .  the taste is cloyingly sweet , viscous , the aromas transfer , and turn very bready on the finish , the middle has cherries candies , almost medicinal the mouth feel is vaguely reminiscent of cough syrup , but watered down . there is no bitterness and even less carbonation .

s : perfumy nose ( muscat ? ) with grapes and chamomile flowers , pungent , with hints of honeysuckle . t : there is a belgian yeasty estery upfront which is nice . after that the grapes really come out , particularly the gewurztraminer which i 'm a fan of since i love alsatian whites . but anyways , it 's a fun beer to delve into , tasty for sure . a marriage of northern french wine and belgian beer , it makes perfect sense .  served in a bruery tulip . pour yields a garnet-colored brew that is almost bordering on purple . good tan head and a bit of lacing as it goes down .  m : dammit , i hate porters like this . light , watery body , slightly oily , and slick on the palate . this would have been so much better with more body to it .

not too impressed , as others in 6-pack had poor smells but also tasted fine . t : sweet , malty , biscuity m : carbonation , good lingering mouthfeel for golden o : a decent , very drinkable golden .  a- cristal clear golden yellow . good effervescence . ok medium white head that even left some lacing as it settles to a nice ring of foam .  medium body . nearly flat .

thin head , that leaves a nice residue as the beer is drunk . not a lot of smell , maybe a little malty sweetness , but you got ta inhale deeply to get anything .  pours a really nice dark red colour , which reminded me of some of the better belgian ales , but there was absolutely no head , though i tried to get some as i quite like it .  mouthfeel is lacking as was expected . all in all this one is a step above the macro light brews .

the smell is quite inviting . taste is slightly bitter .  well , it looks good - coppery gold with plenty of creamy head .  i feel like i have now experienced the true port/lost abbey experience , this is the first one i 've had that is flat ... a : pours dark brown with caramel highlights , zero head even after stiff pour , some clarity s : nose is predominantly oak and vanilla , some char quality in there , stout base takes a back seat t : vanilla and bourbon again dominate , some ashy character in there along with light notes of leather and tobacco , a bit of of boozieness on the finish mf : low carbonation is an understatement , medium body o : good flavors here , the lack of carbonation takes away from the quality a bit , for the premium price tag , i would expect carbonation .

this lager almost pours with the look of a pepsi or coca-cola . the nose on this brew leaves much to be desired . smells more of cardboard or wet paper with a roasted malt .  pours with light brown , two-fingered bubbly head , fades slowly and leaves a good lace .  taste : decidedly like its nose , only more so ; large notes of bittersweet chocolate and espresso rule the roost , here ; not nearly as sweet as you might imagine ; total lack of carbonation left the impression of a somewhat light , thin mouthfeel .

12 oz bottle from the summer mixed 12 pk a : yellowish orange with a small head . somewhat cloudy , but not as much as i would expect s : i really ca n't get much out of this . t : i 'll call this `` oberon-lite '' . no real hefe characteristics . more of the oberon orange tang , but not as prevelent .  bad sign , but i ordered it anyway a - looked fine , medium golden , mildly hazy s - mild citric hop smell quickly hidden behind malty/bisquity sweet smell . can still smell the yeast on it as well , which makes me wonder if they filter at all .  the herbal hops will become medicinal with traces of alluminum and will become a bit less appealing as it goes from a zippy feel to rather stagnent . a flat and bitter hop flavor is the finish .

its by no means a sophistocated beer , nor is there a whole lot to the smell or taste of it ( smell being almost undetectable besides some wheats and the taste being a simple blend of understated malts and yeast ) but despite this i actually enjoy drinking this .  this beer looked great , but was otherwise very unimpressive . it poured out of the bottle a very pretty hazy orange with a perfect amount of what appeared to be velvety-smooth head .  high carbonation and a continental hop aroma mixed with corn . light , watery body with a vegtable-grainy taste . dry , crisp finish . strictly unsatisfying .

s - smells like a bud light . the smell is disappointing . very hard to pick out anything in the smell . t - in spite of the smell , the taste works out to be pretty good .  pours black with brownish edges , feeble foam rises and leaves a thin ring at the edge of the glass .  mouthfeel is thin , almost no carbonation .
smells sweet and inviting . very light caramel malt in the nose .  black with a small tan head .  the mouthfeel is watery with medium carbonation .

quite a nice choice of fragrance hops . looks and smells phenomenal . taste , i just ca n't wrap my tongue around it .  it pours a hazy orangeish gold with a creamy eggshell colored head .  very , very foamy in the mouth .

s - smelled like it was light struck - a little skunky . otherwise , grassy aromas are present .  it poured a deep , cherry red with minimal head which foamed a bit when swirled .  it is very thin like any us macro , making it very drinkable like water .

the aromas were really weak and could not get much character from it except the malts .  lacy rich foamy light tan lasting head . cloudy bright rich red ruby brown shade color . loose sediment dust .  mouthfeel : bad , fizzy foamy body , hot finish drinkability : meh

smell is adjunct , grass , and rubbing alcohol .  poured the 12oz bottle into a pilsener glass . small bubble rising up to the top where a three finger spongy bright white head rests . o : this lager is a good cheap option since it 's very drinkable and decent .  mouthfeel is very thin and weak .

n : not much of anything . minimal fruitiness and spices climbing to mostly lemon as it warmed . t : definitely shined more when it was crisp and cold than when it warmed .  nitro like creamy in texture and tan like color head in appearance . some good lacing while drinking also . bouquet is dead for an oatmeal stout , not much going here .  the carbonation sort of ruins the mouthfeel from the can and hides the taste .

once it warmed slightly , it emitted a rancid odor as well as taste .  this beer poured a nice deep brown with a fairly bubbly head .  mouthfeel was light in body and watery in texture with a flat carbonation .

if i have drunk enough of oregon 's microbrews in a short span of time beforehand this seems ok . otherwise it tastes pretty foul . fortunately , even with only one potent ale under my belt , this imperial pint ( just one of the perks of the goose hollow ) seemed creamy and fresh . it was a very light straw colour with a big foamy head which left some lacing . vinegar anyone ?  a= pours a nice cloudy golden copper hue , sits hazy golden orange in glass . a good foamy white head forms and lingers pretty well .  the mouthfeel is this beer 's weakest point . also , it feels a bit heavy on the palate and is almost syrupy .

s - nice aroma of cider ... that seems to be a recurring theme for me with this beer .  i really want to like this local brewery but something about every beer i try ends up being below average . this beer , for a stout , is great looking but the taste is something very strange .  mouthfeel is very thin and overly carbonated .

smell is thin and elusive ; a mild graininess is about all i can pick up . a sweet corn aroma dances around in the background , barely making its presence known .  nice color for the style .  mouthfeel : thin and watery ( or slim-bodied , which sounds more positive ) , medium-low carbonation ( too low for the style ) .

smell : an earthy plant kind of smell , not a whole lot there .  a - rusty orange ; vibrant and bright . off-white head - pillowy and high . nice !  mouthfeel this one was clumsy and , worst of all , lacked the fluffy character of a good hefe weizen .
smell theres almost no smell to this lager except for a hint of lemon and maybe grass .  pours amber with a large , white head .  on top of that , the beer tasted a bit flat and felt thin .

dunkels ; pours a clear , deep copper-brown w/ a thin light tan head which dissipates quickly leaving a moderate lacing in my pils glass ; a subtle smell , cereal grain , toasted nuts , and hints of dark fruits and noble hops ; a crisp , malty flavor , nutty w/ a caramel-like undertone , faint fig/date-like notes as well , an excellent finish ; very dry and light bodied with plenty of co2 , this beer feels like it evaporates off your tongue ; a very drinkable beer , i 'm def .  pours dark reddish brown , the color of cola , beige head retreats leaving a thin ring .  the taste is similar , just a little sweeter , with more wateriness and less hops . i could n't get over how watery this beer tasted and felt . maybe i 'm rating it a little low because of that , but it has a lot of strikes against it : watery , bland , and definitely not a bargain .

the hop aroma was very good , while the malts were only so-so .  it has good color , but beyond that that this ipa is not a pleasant one to drink .  the flavor is closer to my expectations , but the body is way too light for an oatmeal stout -- there 's no chew . the carbonation , which is on the high side , does n't help .

smells of tons of citrus and pine , with a hint of kitchen cleaner and hardwood resin . very resinous taste win a lingering bitterness and faint light caramel .  appearance : this pours a maple brown , nearly mahogany , with an eggshell colored head that retains nicely . strangely light appearance for a double cda , though .  mouthfeel : the carbonation is very high , way too high , for a milk stout . the body is thin . drinkability : just an ok beer , the mouthfeel also hurts the drinkability .

s : it reeks in a good way , horse sweat and damp basement a bit of acetic sourness , along with a great wine barrel smell from the combination of oak and grapes . t : taste like a sweeter fruitier version of what it smells , although not as strong .  mythos from greece : a hellenic lager , in a 11.5 ounce green bottle . strong euro-skunk aroma . thick white head , long lasting , with pronounced belgian lace . light bodied , deep golden color .  mouthfeel - super watery overall - the only thing this beer has going for it is the aroma which is misleading .

i did not use a lime , if you need fruit with your beer perhaps you should look for another type of beer . there is no smell of hops , but the taste is crisp , and this beer is super easy to drink .  pours a very cool orange color with a pretty dense head with very tiny bubbles .  i really like a strong flavor from my beer ... or food for that matter m : watery . with the cloudy , opaque look of this stuff i was expecting ( and hoping for ) a little creamier or more substantial mouthfeel .

s : sweet malt for sure . moldy wood and cooked veggies .  poured from a 22oz bottle into a magners glass the beer pours a nice golden color with a slight amount of haziness to it . there is a big 1-2 inch head that falls back to about 1/4 inch and statys .  dissapointing , watery mouthfeel .

very strong smells of pineapple and pirate beers waft away from the glass . there is caramel , yeast and citrus along with the sea , like the belgian pirate-themed beers i have tried . cold weather seems to encourage the brewing gene ... slainte .  one moment i think i really like bocks and then i have a bock like this , and then am not so sure .  m : this was the most dissapointing . aside from the lingering dry finish this was a very thin porter .

the label on the bottle i 'm drinking has a coat of arms , 2 cherries and says the abv is 6.8 % . the smell was the first thing that weirded me out ; maybe i was expecting more of a lambic-ness , but the smell had a funk that i found hard to place . what the hell was that smell ? dirty underwear ? the taste started okay with a tart , bitter cherry flavor but followed by a metallic nastiness that almost pressed down on the back of my tongue .  the pour was highly carbonated , with thick tan , lingering head .  the mouthfeel was a bit thin and watery .

s : nice big belgian yeast nose . one of the best smelling beers i have ever encountered . t : starts off sweet with some raisins . the worst part of this beer and it was still way above average . d : very drinkable .  a : cloudy amber color with a decent creamy head that left decent lacing and remained throughout .  empty , chalky mouthfeel , not much going on here .

a clear yellow pour , white head that quickly fades to nothing.slight grain aroma.a little bit sweet standard pale lager flavor but not gross like so many others , some detectable hop hints at leasst.drinkable .  highlights of dark red can be seen as the glass sits on the dark wooden table . the head is a light tan , and stays in a thin layer on top of the liquid and leaves decent but spotty lacing .  mouthfeel is overly fizzy , making an already light beer even fluffier . overall , this is an interesting beer that could be very refreshing if less carbonated .

it produced a two-finger white head that lasted a few minutes and left some decent lacing on the glass . there is no smell to this beer - neither good nor bad . very mild flavors here - a faint amount of malt to balance out a faint amount of hop bitterness .  the pour is promising .  mouthfeel is thin .

this , in turn , screws up the taste and renders the nose skunky , no matter what quality of beer is `` truly '' inside . the head is average , 1 inch and quickly dissipating , the smell is skunky but round , the appearance is straw yellow , the mouthfeel is fine , not offensive but not great , the drinkability is probably 4 of these max .  a clear pale-gold colour with medium carbonation - it looks just the same as in the bottle . yields a good head of white foam that disappears rapidly .  m : watery , very light-bodied , body of a light lager .

i found this beer to have an interesting , complex aftertaste . i had another dark beer ( ca n't remember the name , and it 's not listed on-tap on their website anymore ) at brewery creek that did n't have any flavor at all . so i am pleased that this had a lot of flavor . it just was n't my cup of tea .  pours a deep ruddy brown with a thin layer of head that leaves a massive amount of lacing .  mf : too smooth and wet . watery even , but not creamy .

big rich sweet aroma , distinct raw honey scent .  this brew suffered from major oxidation ... we had two sixers of this and they both tasted the same ... such a shame , i had heard such good things about this dark berry brew ... i literally couldnt drink an entire bottle of the product we had due to the horrible funk taste i came across ... oh well it looked great being poured into the saskatchewan tundra ... cheers !  the carbonation and the bitterness overpower the toasty flavors .

s- the only two things i can pick out in this beer are a yeasty aroma in the front of this that is pretty dominate . almost smells like a very yeasty bmc product .  pours a clear august-afternoon sunshiny amber with a small amount of head , about one skinny finger .  mouthfeel is very thin , again very soda like .

a vague `` smell '' but i wouldnt even hazard a guess as to what smell that is . ok i will..its kinda a vague alcohol enrinched caramel candy smell , but it is very faint . you have to get your nose wet to smell it . quite pretty coloring .  this beer looks very good , but as a light japanese beer , it is indeed light and lacking in what one expects of one 's beer . however , it 's a nice golden , sunflower color , and it is extraordinarily easy to drink .  mouthfeel is painfully carbonated . light bodied , way way to much carbonation .

n : sweet malts and , uh , nothing else t : sweet bready malts , almost no hops , caramel .  summer ale poured a bit cloudy and dark yellow , almost amber , with a full and faintly off-white retentive head .  it 's piercing , almost . the nose lands itself squarely on the tongue , unadulterated . what you are left with is a diminished , pale , watery finish . this , fortunately , leads to high quaffability .

this beer is totally disappointing . its not that its a bad beer , but aroma and flavor are just largely not present .  freshness date on bottle of may '09.. single purchased at julio 's westboro , ma a:1 finger head that quickly disappeared . nice amber color in the glass .  the flavor was both too light and 'way too bitter for a pils . it was watery and lacking in aroma . not much foam - what there was disappeared quickly . the word i 'd use to describe this beer is `` insubstantial . ''

a faint strawberry scent , i would n't even call it an aroma ; nothing much else here . t - very weak , it does n't have much flavor at all , and what flavor it does have is not very good .  25cl into a tulip . unexceptional head , nice lacing .  mouthfeel was very light bodied and again , watery .

pulled it from the cooler in a bottle at around 8pm and took a sip , whatever kind of sweet , watery whatever , but it down and played a pick up game of football for around fifteen minutes . when i returned to my beer it didn`t even taste the same , when this beer gets a chance to warm up a bit its flavor really shines through , it tasted so smooth , like a golden apple dunked in orange juice , with toher very warming herbs , a great brew to transition into autumn brews .  poured a bright copper color with a large tan head that dissolved away quickly . looked nice .  m surprisingly watery for the body ; slightly carbonated with a light , watery finish . my major complaint is with the mouthfeel , the watery texture really detracts from its drinkability in my book .

aroma was a bit lacking . maybe my sniffer was n't working at full power , but i detected very little aroma aside from a faint toffee smell .  appearance this one had a nicely carbonated orange body with some cool-looking sediment and a promising head .  flavor is good and somewhat spicy , but fades too quickly because body is too thin and watery .

s : pale malt and yeast , practically no detectable hop aroma .  smell is heavy with cooked vegetables - carrots and peas . accidents happen , and the reviews for this beer seem quite good , but at over 10.00 a bottle , i feel mistakes must be mentioned when they occur .  high gravity beer , this one is king . drink alot of water when drinking or a major headache occurs . so drink with caution .

the smell is extremely vibrant and spicy reminding me immediately of egg-nog . despite being very interesting and flavorful it becomes difficult to drink about halfway through .  a pours a amber color , with good white head that disappeared very rapidly .  mouthfeel is way watery and i feel like it is slightly udnercarbonated .

s - this is some repugnant shit , as my man jules from inglewood might say . there is a rancid sweetness , some wet-dog and a mushy pea aroma ; to describe any more would be just disgusting . t - again , disgusting . d - great gimmick for abita ; i feel like i 've really given back to the gulf community by buying this blasphemy of a beer .  a : wow ... i must say i 'm quite amazed at the formation of the head on this thing . after it settles it leaves a 1/2in white creamy head . looks kind of like ice cream the body of the beer is black with some ruby highlights . the only thing keeping me from giving this a five is the fact that it really dos n't look like beer , more like a milkshake or something .  m : very overly carbonated to the point where it was difficult to drink early on , mild acidity , medium-bodied .

the smell was that of a standard stout , but with the addition of a rather metallic copper smell .  the reddish brown beer pours with a nice sized beige head . she looks pretty good , but when i went for a smellelmers glue .  the mouth is super thin . the thinnest mouth i 've ever had on an ipa . d= the thin mouth makes me go for sips more often and the flavor does n't linger long ... great flavor on this one no doubt .

the smell is bland lacking depth . the taste is much more rewarding showing the depth which the smell was missing .  pours a three finger cream head that fades slowly leaving a trace of lace . chrystal clear amber color . good carbonation and medium bodied .  i 'm no fan of bud , and probably have n't had a bmc beer in 2 years , but this is not one of the worst 50 beers in the world . it 's far better than many of the cheap , crappy pale lagers in many parts of the world . although it had little taste to speak of , it was exceedingly easy to drink , which , for bmc swill , ai n't that terrible .

the smell was typical and under-whelming , but really not an important aspect of this kind of beer .  it 's a really nice , orange color , with bubbles set up in just the right way .  one thing about this beer is it feels extremely watery .
virtually no nose .  it looks pretty enough , with its amber body and nice tan head , but the heavy mouthfeel did n't sit too well with me .  m - weak and thin . lifeless .
smells like very like wheat grain . almost nothing there . tastes the same as it smells . very , very light wheat .  nice fine head . good rich color .  the body was water and medium light .

there was not much smell , a little malt , which lent me to believe this was a eastern us type pale ale . the mouthfeel was very smooth and drinkable ... so no complaints here .  a - clear light amber pour with a nice light one finger pour that results in very gentle lacing .  watery mouthfeel .
a tart fruity aroma is not very appealling .  appearance : looks like a good respectable stout should look .  watery mouthfeel .

bottle into pint glass a 1 finger white head on top of a very carbonated golden straw colored brew , kept a thin layer on top but likely only because of the amount of carbonation , no lacing 3.5 s nothing more than a bit of grain and very slight florals 2 t pale malts and some quite apparent grassy hops and a bit of fruit fade to a sweet finish .  the beer poured a golden-brown colour with an off-white head that displayed very good retention , a good start but it 's all downhill from here .  i must admit i was suprised to see this new offering from coopers as i have never heard of it , it pours a pale golden see thru champagne colour with a nice frothy one finger head , sparkling carbonation and bubbly clingy lacing , it has a green , grassy hop aroma with a malty background , it has a thin mouthfeel even thinner for the style for my liking and the taste isnt as pleasant as it looks it has tastes of watery hops with a feint grainish aftertaste not as great as i was hoping for but definately better than the other macro swill out there .

s : funky smell - cheese and sweat . very strange , the smell does not match the taste . my friend that was with me and is not as adventurous a beer drinker was totally turned off by the smell . but when she held her nose , she enjoyed the taste .  this bell 's porter was dark brown and had a tan head which went away .  2.5 m thin , with only the grain tastes and the slightest stickiness keeping it from being water itself .

smells mainly vinous , sauternes with raisins and sherry . a bit uneven , and demanding , possibly with dark chocolate or strong cheese .  beer emerged from the bottle a rich golden color and offered a decent white head that then went on to leave some lacing on my glass .  m : a very thin and watery beer .

the nose , however , is rather unpleasant . rather prominently hoppy in the english vein , this initially has a very noticeable soapy , mildly cleaning-solution like aroma . once it breathes for a bit , it does become better , changing to a rather pungent ekg aroma . a mild toasted white bread-like malt sweetness is present as well .  a careful pour got me a couple fingers of stiff foam over a clear honey colored brew .  almost no body present .

s- the primarly aromas here are of sweet corn and malt . i do n't really detect any hop bitterness , but rather some skunked aromas . it is quite sweet , primarily of corn and some clean , bland white rice . the corn sweetness hides the alcohol well and there 's no real bitterness to detract any novice beer drinkers .  a : a strange deep red color with both pink and brownish hues .  the flavor echoes the aroma , but the mouthfeel is n't quite up to scratch - weirdly thin and watery , which does no favors to the toasty , nutty , tea-like , and hoppy notes that are all individually assertive but harmonious and balanced in tandem , like a good jazz band .

s : the first thing i notice is metal , which is quite off-putting . as the beer has opened up , the metallic scent has faded some , but is still present . after a while , a strong chocolate quality begins to take over as the dominant factor on the nose . fairly restrained bourbon quality .  color is a nice cloudy amber like you would expect from a beer of this type .  the body is very thin -- like there was a lot of adjuncts added .

the smell is that of boston lager , rather skunky with hints of hops and malts .  a - complex deep amber color in the center which fades out to a pale yellow . it produced a frothy brown head which slowly dissipated .  better than expected , but as someone who despises ab products + light beer i was n't expecting much trouble is , within the same can it tasted like lemonade in some sips , water in others . giving it a 4 on drinkability because it 's light , so one could drink a lot of these if they chose to .

awesome looking brew . s : wow , what a nose on this beer . sweet smelling with fruity esters along with some spiciness as well .  a ) pours nicely . golden honey , good carbonation , white 1cm head , which persists . surprisingly good start .  mf- watery and too light bodied for a red ale . mouthfeel lacking .

yeasty aroma with the funk of rotten fruit and full kitchen garbage can.. nasal accents of strong commonly-belgian hops work their way in as well .  12 oz bottle poured into a pilsner - fridge - 2009 appearance : pours a transparent golden color with lots of flowing carbonation . the head is white and rises 1 '' tall , showing a good amount of foaminess and retention . a coating of lace remains behind . nice !  mouthfeel is very thin with low carbonation , almost watery , drinkability is poor , huge bitterness and watery mouthfeel is a disappointment .

strange very dry grain smell not sweet . cant ' quite pinpoint the smell , [ spice of some sort ] not unpleasant , but not like any pale ale i 've had before . that smell is present at the back flavors but still unidentifiable .  i poured the beer into my favorite laser etched pint . the head is a little more bubbly than the stout , but other than that it looked like a pint of the draught .  carbonation is way too high .

s- overall a very clean smelling beer ... .primary aromas of faint malt and some graininess .  this is a nice looking beer , but is thick and very fruity in the nose and is so middle-tongue sweet i had to cut it with with lemonade just to be able to drink it .  it 's drinkable , but the body and carbonation are really lacking .

smell is subtle at first and different than any beer i 've smelld before .  a quick run to the sink and pours into our tulips and we were in business . huge white head . not much lace .  really fizzy ( like coca-cola fizzy ) on the tongue , with a metallic finish , not really what i was hoping for , dissapointing .
